Title: BI & Data Analyst
Description:
Why join us? 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 We are looking for a highly motivated BI & Data Analyst to join the Financial Systems Team in Toronto. This role will report to the Manager, Financial Systems and be responsible for designing and validating management system reports (including Power BI, Power Query and Excel), performing data analysis using a wide variety of applications, and driving automation efforts within the Finance team (specifically focused on Robotic Process Automation). To succeed in this role, candidates will have a strong aptitude towards working with large volumes of data, experience in data analytics, ability to mine data, and understanding data flow & structure. This role requires strong attention to detail as well as the ability to multitask in a complex environment. The preferred candidate will have a strong focus on customer service and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups, financial team and IT department. 

 As a member of this team, you will be responsible for 
Work with financial and operational data from primary or secondary data sources 
Seek efficiencies in existing processes and execution of process improvement initiatives, including exploring and identifying potential new tools and technologies for enhancing reporting automation capabilities, including the use of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) 
Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in complex data sets 
Exploring large data sets and drawing meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs 
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues and follow data governance policies 
Work with management teams to prioritize business, analytics and information needs and understand project requirements 
Assist with the preparation and development of reporting, presentations and various materials for discussion at the executive level 
To succeed in this role, you have 
Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. 
Have a minimum of 1-2 years of demonstrated experience in a similar role (e.g. Data Analyst or BI Data Analyst). 
Willingness to learn RPA and automated technologies, with a strong inclination to improve processes and not settle for ‘status quo’ (exposure to UI Path an asset). 
Advanced Excel knowledge (including Pivot Tables, Power Query, VBA Macros), and proficient in Power BI, and SQL. 
Experience and exposure to Hyperion Financial Management, Global Spreadsheet Server, and other BI Tools (e.g. Tableau) an asset. 
Strong eagerness to learn new tools, topics and explore opportunities to leverage technology to generate efficiencies and improve capabilities. 
Team oriented individual with strong communication skills, who is comfortable engaging with different groups within the organization (including non-technical audiences). 
Technical expertise in data mining and analysis, with an understanding of financial reporting concepts. 
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and innovative approaches for resolution. 
Strong project management and organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and manage high priority projects with multiple or competing deadlines. 


Our story:
 Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees. 

 For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
You found us. Awesome. Something led you here, maybe a glimpse of potential and something amazing? Well that’s how we feel about Klue.
 


 Everyone has competitors, yet few know them well. Cue Klue. We are a team relentlessly focused on creating industry leading software to enable every department of every business to leverage the best of the web’s knowledge and the collective insights of their own people.
 


 We are a high-growth company with:
 

An experienced leadership team at the helm
Risk-takers and builders who own it and get IT done
Combined group, who love the fact that not everything is defined, so we can innovate, create, ignite



 Joining Klue, you’ll have the opportunity to own your zone, experiment and find what works. Then execute with the support of a team propelling you forward. We’re all creating this industry leading product. It's an experience that will no doubt change your career forever.
 


 We’re growing and currently looking to add a Data Analyst Intern to our team. This internship will span several functions of the Insights department and will give you a broad view of what it takes to run an innovative SaaS company. Klue is a very collaborative company where we believe in the value that can be unlocked by sharing data insights across departments and clients - you'll be getting a full picture of how a SaaS company on a rocketship trajectory operates. You’ll have many opportunities to listen in on strategic conversations and will be encouraged to ask questions along the way. As the company grows, we will have many roles to fill within the Insights department and would hope the right candidate would consider returning one day.
 


 As a data analyst intern, you will be focused on helping our insights team ensure our data providers and outsourced content creators are delivering accurate data to their end-users.
 


 The Insights' team scope covers data validation for existing sources, outsourced content, and new potential data sources. As the data marketplace is always evolving, you will also be involved in broader projects across the team.
 
 This is You:

 Highly analytical and critical thinker
 Ability to digest and communicate complex data
 You like ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced environments
 You have experience with Excel and/or Python
 You like to learn new things and are keen to become an expert

 Bonus points for...

 Experience with analytics platforms, data cleaning initiatives, data gathering.

 What you'll be measured on:

 Ability to identify trends in data sets and develop unique solutions.
 Efficiency in data gathering and data cleaning.


   If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.
  




  We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off.
 


 As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.
 


 All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.
 


 We’re excited to meet you and in the meantime, get to know us:
 

   ED&I Initiatives & Commitments - Pay Up For Progress & 50 - 30 Challenge & Klue Blog
 

   ️ Series A (2020)
 

   Series B (2021)
 

   Culture, culture, culture! 
 

  Glassdoor
 

   About Us
 

   Twitter
 

   Instagram
 

️ LinkedIn


   Angel.co

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Opening up a world of opportunity.


We're a financial services organization serving more than 40 million customers across the globe through our Wealth & Personal Banking, Commercial Banking and Global Banking & Markets businesses.
We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up a world of new opportunities for our customers, our people and our communities.


HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking. 
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.


About Asset Management
HSBC Asset Management, is the asset management division of the HSBC Group. HSBC Asset Management develops and manages investment management products and services for clients around the world, from individual retail customers to major multinational corporate clients, sovereign wealth funds and financial institution clients.


Our vision is to be the leading asset manager for HSBC clients with a clear long-term commitment to be focusing on understanding and meeting the needs of the personal, commercial, corporate and institutional clients of HSBC's global businesses.


About the role:
Data and Analytics Professionals at HSBC have responsibility for executing our HSBC Data Strategy. Their responsibilities are threefold:

Recognising data as an asset to HSBC by managing Data Risk and ensuring we are compliant with our Data standards and policies;
Using analytics and data science to unlock the value of our data; and
Implementing and maintaining our Data Technologies.

Data and Analytics Professionals are geographically dispersed and aligned to the Global Businesses / Global Functions or regions.


Responsibilities:

Manage and deliver Data Management services to the Global Business of Asset Management and local business in Canada (“the business”)
Manage and support the business with technical capabilities to analyze, edit and report on the management of data
Manage and support master and meta-data used by the business to ensure that data is used consistently
Support the business in the design and delivery of technical solutions compliant with data management requirements
Good team player and capable of working with global and local functional team members in different time zones
Establish and maintain good working relationships with other business units and teams locally and globally
Good knowledge of data analytics, data visualization and good data literacy



  Requirements 
 


Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience managing data in investment management or other related industries.
Undergraduate degree in finance, statistics, computing science or other related qualitative disciplines.
Completion of CSC or other equivalent courses on investment industry.
Good team player who can work with global and local functional team members in different time zones and who can foster and maintaining good relationships.
Detail oriented and able to prioritise multiple projects and/or tasks.
Good analytical skills with advanced MS suite and SQL. Data analytics, data visualization or other equivalent training would be beneficial



HSBC Proud
HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment.
We encourage all Black people, Indigenous People of Canada and people with disabilities to self-identify in their applications. Please contact our Canada Careers mailbox (careers@hsbc.ca) with any additional inquiries or for support and reasonable accommodations during the selection process.
If this is not the ideal role for you, we invite you to sign up here to our Talent Community so we can update you about job opportunities and career events in your area of interest. We are always looking for people with purpose and ambition who can help build the bank for the future.

Title: Data Analyst - Fall 2022 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































 Job Title




































 Data Analyst - Fall 2022 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Data Analyst Co-op will work closely with the Corporate Client Group (CCG) National Operation’s Data Analytics team to support the business with the management of data, reporting and process improvement initiatives. The incumbent should possess data and management information related knowledge and should be familiar with MS Excel and Access. Strong problem solving, time management and attention to details will help ensure success in this role. RBC CCG National Operations supports CCG’s planning, directing, and overseeing their operational policies, rules, initiatives, and goals. The CCG team is responsible for meeting annually established targets for revenues and returns, providing advice to our partners along with broader RBC relationship goals, while the National Operations team helps & supports the group execute long-term and short-term plans

 What will you do?

Support the implementation of robust database and reporting systems for the CCG team and senior management 
Fulfill ad-hoc and periodic data requests based on business requirements 
Analyze data for useful insights and build meaningful dashboards & data visualizations
Automate reporting processes to help the team save resources 
Perform data mining, cleanup and investigate discrepancies to enhance data quality
Support database administration activities and troubleshoot user inquiries

 Document and diagram key system and data management processes

 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

3rd or 4th year student with a minimum of one Co-Op placement of relatable experience
Working towards undergraduate degree in Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science or Engineering
Intermediate level of MS Office with a focus on Excel and strong familiarity with Access 
Related knowledge and experience in database and data management principals
Ability to perform well under pressure, meet time sensitive deadlines, and prioritize work
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Team player and also able to work independently •Strong oral and written communication skills
Proven capabilities in effective management of tasks and delivering high quality work 

Nice-to-have

VBA
Tableau
Python


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference.
Opportunities to build close relationships.

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. Title: Jr. Developer/Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview: Ontario One Call acts as the communications link between buried infrastructure owners (our members) and individuals who are planning to dig in the province of Ontario. In 2012, the Ontario Underground Infrastructure Notification System Act (OUINSA) was passed, which stipulates that by law, anyone in the province of Ontario must contact Ontario One Call before they dig.Ontario One Call is charged with the responsibilities of the OUINSA, which involves the operation of a contact centre to receive and process excavation requests, compliance activities to ensure that members meet their legal responsibilities and public education around the need for safe excavation.
*Core Values: *
At Ontario One Call, we are Reliable Experts who Care:

Reliable…We are dependable and accessible
Experts…We have the mindset to lead innovation
Caring…We ensure the safety and well-being in our communities.

Do you have what it takes to join our team?
Position overview: **Ontario One Call employees enjoy a hybrid work model with both work in the office and work from home available. This role is based in Guelph, Ontario and candidates must be willing and able to work in office as required including working primarily on site during their probationary period.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst should possess an understanding and background in reporting and analytics. Reporting to the I.T. Manager, the Jr Developer/Data Analyst will assist the I.T. Manager in maintaining all reporting and analytic and operations projects.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, building and deploying reporting and analysis.
Primary Responsibilities: **

Design and maintaining systems and databases for reporting purpose; this includes fixing coding errors, running job tools and other data-related tasks.
Creating appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the process if necessary
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop new datasets and data driven solutions
Generate reports and analysis
Maintain a repository of reports
Document processes/procedures
Travel as required

Qualifications: **

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluent in reading, writing and verbally communicating in English
Strong technical documentation skills
Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs
Software Programming


C#
.Net
XML
HTML
JavaScript
Python


Strong database and SQL skillset


MySQL / Maria DB
PostgreSQL
Microsoft SQL


Familiarity of data management, data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts including data modeling and transformations.
Strong Microsoft Excel background
Strong Microsoft Access background
Microsoft Power BI (asset)

**
Education and Experience: 

Completion of post secondary in a relevant field
Minimum 1-3 years in similar role with Data/reporting/analytics

Technical Requirements: Candidates wishing to apply must be able to meet the following technical requirements while we/they are working remotely:

High speed internet connection delivered via Fibre, Cable or DSL
Computer that meets the following specifications:


Windows 10 (all updates applied)
Minimum Intel i3
Minimum 4GB RAM
Minimum 512 MB disk space free
Computer connected to internet via Ethernet cable (WIFI connections are NOT supported)
Antivirus software (installed and up to date)
Ability to install Cisco Anyconnect VPN and Avaya Communicator

Candidates must complete and attach a pdf screenshot of a speed test when applying.

Go to: https://ontarioonecall.speedtestcustom.com/


Use password ‘on1call’ to perform a speed test on our custom server


Take a screenshot of the results screen and save it as a pdf file
Attached the file of the screenshot to your application

Rewards: 

Salary of $48,000-$52,000/annum dependent on qualifications and experience
Extensive health, dental and life insurance benefits
Highly engaged workforce and excellent workplace culture
Diverse and inclusive environment
Collaborative team
New, clean and bright facility

Ontario One Call is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.As a precondition to employment, the selected candidate will be required to provide satisfactory employment references, successfully complete a criminal background check prior to or any time following hire, and provide proof of full vaccination for COVID-19.
Don’t forget to include these items in your application: 

Cover letter & Resume
Speed test
Confirm that you meet the technical requirements of working from home

Job Type: Permanent
Salary: $48,000.00-$52,000.00 per year

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST
LOCATION: Vancouver, BC, 885 Dunsmuir Street
STATUS: Contract Position with Potential for Staff/Extension
Tetra Tech is a leading provider of consulting engineering, program management, construction management, and technical services throughout Canada. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 400 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—21,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech employs more than 3,500 experts in Canada who are poised to take on the next challenge. From more than 50 offices across the country, our multidisciplinary teams have capabilities that span the entire project life cycle.
This Vancouver office location specializes in small to mid-sized projects for clients across Canada. The types of clients we work for include:

Heavy industrial facilities
Pipelines and refineries
Mineral processing
Municipal and utilities
Water treatment

POSITION SUMMARY
Tetra Tech is looking for a Data Analyst Consultant with experience in Process Control, Plant Automation, or Building Automation to join our talented Vancouver Team on a part time contract position with a strong probability of extension.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform Cause and Effect Analysis of Industrial Process
Work with data from multiple sources and data sizes/granularity
Prepare and present reports and analyses to key stakeholders and other business units
Perform process modelling
Perform data analysis and troubleshoot technical issues with platforms, performance, data discrepancies, production issues
Train and guide the junior engineers in data reporting and analytical skills


SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, SOFTWARE & SYSTEMS

5+ years in relevant experience as Data Analyst or equivalent role
Experience in Process Control, Plant Automation, or Building Automation
Experience with ISA-18.2/IEC 62682 – Alarm Management Life Cycle
Attention to detail and work ethic for dealing with a variety of data issues
Demonstrate effective time management skills and the ability to work independently or in a collaborative team environment 
Good disciplinary knowledge in ETL development and writing SQL queries
Working knowledge of Python and/or Java
Good disciplinary knowledge in data warehousing concepts and structures (star schema and dimensional modeling) 
Able to effectively communicate with colleagues from Building Automation, Electrical, and Mechanical backgrounds. 
Experience with MS Office Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, Visio and/or AutoCAD

EDUCATION

Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science, Big Data, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or similar formal education 

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION / REQUIREMENTS

A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. A copy of a valid work permit may be required.
If you are considered for the position, clearance on all applicable background checks (which may include criminal, identity, educational, and/or credit) and professional reference checks is required. Some Tetra Tech positions require an enhanced level of background assessment, which is dictated by law. These positions require advanced criminal record checks that must also be conducted from time to time after commencement of employment.
To meet the physical demands required of some positions, candidates must be in good physical condition and willing to work in all weather conditions.
Periodic travel within Canada to client sites and regional Tetra Tech offices will be required
Clearance on pre-placement medical and drug and alcohol testing and background checks may be required for our client worksites
Must be able to adhere to our Office Vaccination & Covid Policies. We will be confirming your eligibility to comply with these requirements.
Current Working Environment: Hybrid Working Arrangement (In office & work from home)

WHY TETRA TECH
In addition to rewarding job opportunities and continuous growth, we offer an attractive employee package including:

Competitive compensation and benefits
Rewarding retirement savings program
Professional development opportunities
Great working location, right in the heart of downtown Vancouver

Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties, including women; Indigenous persons; members of visible minority groups; and persons with disabilities. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.
Stay connected to us:

Find out more about Tetra Tech Canada
Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest news
Visit our Careers page, and create a profile to receive Job Alerts
Read our Tetra Tech newsletter to see what we’re doing in your community


HOW TO APPLY
To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter at: http://www.tetratech.com/careers. We thank all those that apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. 
Please no phone calls or agencies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Please note: In order for a candidate to be considered for review Utilismart requires a separate resume attachment
Utilismart Corporation has created and operates its own secure, cloud-based Meter Data Management (MDM) system along with a wide range of AMI/AMR software solutions and data services for Utilities, Municipalities, Commercial and Industrial and Residential consumers. Utilismart provides information needed to make informed business decisions about electricity, water and gas in the Smart Grid marketplace.
Utilismart Corporation is presently inviting applications for the position of Technical Customer Support.
The successful candidate will be required to be physically onsite at our office located in London, Ontario at least 50% of the work week.
Duties and Responsibilities

Verify customer data deliverables and respond to customer inquiries regarding data, file delivery or web portals
Operate meter data collection systems and Utilismart proprietary systems
Daily communication by phone/email with clients, partners and regulatory agencies (such as IESO)
Conduct data quality audits
Prepare various reports to ensure the integrity of our product and proactively identify and resolve outstanding issues

Skills

The applicant must be able to apply technical skills to monitor systems, and to troubleshoot, validate, and/or resolve problems with software and large volumes of data.
Strong interpersonal skills and oral/written communication skills are required, as well as excellent analytical skills, mathematical skills, with a strong attention to detail.
Applicant must possess the ability to work independently, and as a team player in a fast paced, dynamic work environment.
Utility industry experience considered an asset.

Education

A Computer Systems Technology Diploma or equivalent diploma/degree is considered an asset.

Please note as a condition of employment any applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment from Utilismart Corp. will be required to comply with the Utilismart Corp. Covid-19 Pandemic Guidelines and any future revisions.
Utilismart invites applications from all qualified individuals. Utilismart is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

Title: Data Analyst – Remote
Description:
Help Us Shape the Future of Healthcare



   At League, we’re big on building connections - both through our product and with each other. Our platform is consumer centric, personalized and always on. We’re reimagining the health benefits experience to give people a more consumer-centric way to manage their health: immediate, seamless, and tailored to their unique needs. It’s a front door to healthcare that empowers people to live healthier, happier lives. Every day. 
  


In this role, you will:


Be seen as an expert in measurement and ensure that our marketing efforts are being evaluated holistically across all channels
Collaborate with Engagement and Marketing Leaderships and Marketing Managers to review and interpret data to uncover strategic opportunities and improve efficiency and effectiveness for driving KPIs
Build out various Looker dashboards to understand the impact of different segments / campaigns / channels on various metrics including engagement, retention, and conversion on value-driving actions throughout the funnel and automate recurring views
Own and deliver insights to the B2C marketing organization
Use SQL, Looker, and Segment/Amplitude to conduct ad hoc deep dive analysis on engagement segments and marketing campaigns to deliver performance improvements
Create and iterate on a framework for measuring success of campaigns and experiments that scales for growth
Contribute to monthly performance reviews, quarterly business reviews and other larger analytical projects. Collate and present findings.
Leverage business knowledge, performance data and marketing scenario planning to recommend budget allocations to achieve goals and maximize ROI
Owns the relationship between marketing team and data team including working with the data team to understand the various data assets required to support marketing data requests
Modifies or builds Looker Explores as needed or works with the data team to update the data models that Looker depends on, including translating the marketing team's needs into technical requirements for the data team
Partner with the marketing team to design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments


About you:


4+ years as a hands-on data analyst, with experience in the marketing landscape or supporting marketing requests from an analytics perspective
A strong understanding of marketing and app KPIs, channel metrics, campaign strategy, attribution, engagement, and retention
Experience working with large datasets and extracting insights using SQL
Experience in advanced analytic and statistical techniques related multivariate and A/B testing, performance attribution, customer segmentation, and marketing effectiveness
Experience building dashboards in BI tools such as Looker and Amplitude
Exceptional organizational, problem solving and analytical skills combined with the ability to communicate findings in an insightful and concise manner
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders is a must
Curious about business results and proactive to analyze data and communicate drivers of performance
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapid growth start-up environment



   At League, everyone is welcome. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.

Title: Business Data Analyst - Full Time - Remote
Description:
LifeLabs is the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada, serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for over 50 years. Our team members are truly centred around our customers, and we know that behind every lab requisition, sample being tested, or investment in technology is an individual and their family counting on us. 

 Consistently named one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes, LifeLabs has also been recognized for having an award-winning Mental Health Program from Benefits Canada. The passion and commitment of over 6,000 diverse and innovative team members unites and motivates us to ensure our customers receive high quality tests and results that they can trust. Agile, customer-centred, caring and teamwork: we live these values every day in what we do to support our customers and healthcare providers, driving forward our vision of empowering a healthier you . 

 Make a difference – join the LifeLabs team today! 

 Reports to Director, Sales Operations 


PURPOSE OF THE ROLE: The Business Data Analyst provides actionable insights that can be easily interpreted by business stakeholders; designing, developing, and maintaining ongoing metrics, reports, analyses & dashboards that drive meaningful and actionable insights. To provide analytical support, business data analysts are required to comprehend the business and information needs of the organization and translate them into BI/analytics/reporting deliverables 

 Core Responsibilities Develop presentation materials to be used with the Board, executive team and broader organization based on direction from the Director, Business Development Assist in preparing written documents including business development proposals and company information documents for marketing purpose Provide data to evaluate and identify strategic opportunities for future initiatives Supporting the development of reports for senior management, including market intelligence Provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and industry research 
Work cross-functionally to track/monitor ongoing activities/projects; Maintain project documents (meeting notes, project plans etc) 
Provide additional analysis as required 

 Minimum Qualifcation and Skills Bachelor Degree in Business, Finance, Management, Economics, Compter Science or equivalent 2 to 5 years in a business analytics environment Function as a consultant to the business to understand what decisions they are trying to make and then using that business acumen, select the right data, metrics and analysis to answer their need A detailed oriented, self-starter with demonstrated analytical and logical structuring expertise An excellent written and verbal communicator An enthusiastic and collaborative team player High-level of adaptability and emotional intelligence Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, Alteryx (ETL), SQL, Power BI, VBA, and well developed skills in quantitative and data modeling Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada; Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively 

 #LI LM1 #INDEED 

 At LifeLabs, we strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where our team members and the communities we serve feel accepted, valued, and respected. 
In accordance with LifeLabs’ Accessibility Policy , the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. For a confidential inquiry or to request an accommodation, please contact your recruiter or email careers@lifelabs.com . 

 LifeLabs is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. We have been a leader throughout the COVID-19 pandemic regarding health and safety measures and have always put our employees and customers at the center of every decision that we make. As an organization in the health care sector, we believe the COVID vaccination adds a layer of protection that complements the extensive and necessary health and safety protocols that we have taken to date. With this in mind, we currently require all LifeLabs employees, contractors, students and volunteers to be fully vaccinated. 
LifeLabs operates under a distributed workforce model, where employee flexibility is a key priority. Further information will be provided during the interview process on what this means for employees.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Service Canada is looking to staff an EC-05 Senior Data Analyst position within Quality Services Division, at-level or on an acting basis starting summer 2022.
In this role, you will: 
· Perform data analysis, mining to create routine, complex ad-hoc and custom queries.
· Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources.
· Responsible for data preparation, quality checks and data cleanliness to prepare selection populations and samples.
· Work closely with the Product and Operations teams to understand business requirements.
· Develop and produce reports upon request including dashboards and report visualizations
The ideal candidate would have
· A university degree or technical certificate preferred in a quantitative discipline with experience in the data field. 5+ years of job-related work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience years of proven working experience as a data analyst
· Experienced in data storage and movement, including relational databases
· Experienced in statistical reporting techniques and visualization,
· Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
· Experienced in data programming languages using statistical programming software (SAS, SQL/Excel, R),
· Strong knowledge SQL and relational database concepts
· Proficient to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
· Effective communication skills (oral and written)
Valid Reliability government security clearance required or must be able to obtained
Job location is in National Capital Region
Work is currently remote with possibility of being in office when requested

proven working experience as a data analyst: 5 years (required)

Title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 377991

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

 The Customer Operations Data Science group provides critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps internal clients drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.
 The Customer Operations Data Science team provides insightful perspective and direction on operational strategy and performance of Bell’s award winning Customer Experience business unit. The team focuses on cutting-edge end-to-end business intelligence solutions that support information creation and delivery within business lines and to senior executive across Bell’s business units.

 Team members are experts in business strategy and operations, analytical and strategic, yet highly pragmatic and results-oriented. As an Analyst in Customer Operations Data Science, you will work on projects that take on some of the most cutting-edge business solutions in the Telecommunications industry. Reporting to the Senior Manager - Advanced Analytics, your knowledge of strategy and operations combined with your communication skills and analytical rigour will shape the way that we do business.
 
Job Duties/Accountabilities:

 Passion and enthusiasm for analyzing large datasets and making actionable decisions.
 Ability to break down the most complex problems into smaller actionable pieces.
 Ability to work with and make appropriate decisions with incomplete datasets.
 Help the business “connect the dots” and understand “the big picture” – and to never loose sight of this.
 Interest in using data and technologies to help solve business problems.


 Critical Qualifications/Competencies :

 An undergraduate degree in business/commerce, engineering, mathematics or other quantitative fields. Nevertheless, if you have an English degree and are interested, then please apply.
 2-4 years of SQL experience using enterprise production level data.
 Experience with SQL (Teradata), SAS and visualization software (MicroStrategy/Tableau).
 Experience in telecommunications, retail or consulting industries.
 Experience creating BI reports/dashboards and conducting deep-dive data analysis.
 Effective process/project management skills and the ability to navigate and influence stakeholders.
 Excellent communication skills with the ability to comfortably interact with partners and executive management.
 Experience with business and marketing analysis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
We are looking for a results-driven data savvy individual to be a Data Analyst. In this role you will be challenged to understand the details of business operations and their related data as part of our Decision Support, Analytics, and Data team. You are also required to build relationships with other teams such as Financial Planning & Analysis, Customer and Brand, Merchandising, Store Operations, Ecommerce and Supply chain which will be a key part of this role.Good technical skills along with sound business acumen, and curiosity will allow you to succeed in this role. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do: 

Work with Decision Support Analysts to understand and gather requirements such that it aligns with Business objectives thereby helping teams to make better data decisions. Business objectives thereby helping teams to make better data decisions. 
Support development and enhancement of data table design related to customer data, and engagement of customers across the CTC family of companies. 
Support development of customer profitability modelling, by establishing customer data connections, optimization of metrics gathering production. 
Use your business acumen to better understand metrics used in our analysis and reporting to enhance how we access and use data within the organization. 
Propose sound approaches to interpret data to the Business team which would enable the teams to easily work with and communicate complex ideas. 
Support the testing activities with the Business teams to meet data accuracy standards set by the organization. Work with appropriate teams to resolve issues identified. 
Apply and espouse the principles of good design with respect to databases, programs, and reports to simplify ongoing support and enhance sustainability. 

What you bring: 

University degree – Computer Science, Business, Analytics, Information Systems, or related background. 
Strong business acumen. 
Strong working experience with SQL, SAS and Python. 
Experience building customer data marts and establishing customer level data relationships across several systems. 
Experience working with Hadoop, Snowflake, Azure Cloud, or similar environments. 
Experience on an end-to-end data acquisition (source to raw layer to transformed layer) process is a definite asset. 
Have a strong knowledge or hands-on experience of good database and programming design principles. 
Ensure that significant design decisions are communicated, validated, and adhered to. 
Provide rationale for design decisions. 
Experience with mapping, defining, and managing business processes. 
Experience working with a relational database and with large and complex datasets is an asset 
Experience with Data Profiling and Metadata Tools 
Strong analytical, communication and proactive problem-solving skills are necessary. 
Understanding of financial reporting principles and business reporting is important to effective performance in role. 
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). 
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to accept/action constructive feedback. 
Advanced written and verbal communication skills. 
Customer oriented, focused on achieving project objectives and customer satisfaction. 
Provides a positive influence and excels in a self-directed team environment.

As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . Title: Fuel Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Fuels Marketing Team within the Petroleum Division of Canadian Tire is responsible for the overall profitability of the Fuels business (gas and propane) for the corporation. This requires a dedicated team managing relationships with our key vendor partners, negotiating fuel and transportation costs, as well as retail (street) pricing for all grades of gas and diesel for our 288 gas bar locations across Canada within each market. 
Reporting to the Fuels Marketing Manager – the Fuels Data Analyst is accountable for providing overall support to the Fuels Marketing Team. This support includes both routine-daily reporting using existing data and analytical processes as well as conducting more in-depth analysis to ensure that the business is fully optimized from a pricing & margin standpoint in each of the markets we operate. This in-depth analysis requires the development & design of MS Access Queries & Tables to effectively access the data we have stored in various databases. 
What You'll Do 
ROUTINE DAILY FUELS MANAGEMENT SUPPORT 

Provide analytical support to the Fuels Marketing Team through daily reporting (eg. Margin Reports, Exception Reports, Incidents Reports, etc…) 
Daily cost updates – Shared responsibility with the Fuels Pricing Analyst on entering and updating supplier cost data in the AS400 system. Verify from Source documents that the information entered into the system is accurate and complete. 
Provide additional analysis for the 401/400 HWY series locations. 
Conduct ongoing analytics and reviews of ‘Margin Exceptions’ for each site to identify challenges as well as opportunities to engage in price restoration activities. 
Support the Fuels Marketing Team to implement special regulatory projects. 
Back up Fuels Pricing Analyst on communicating with fuel suppliers and transportation vendors on the day-to-day operations. 
Weekly update to the CT Hub Propane Pricing Notification. 
Infrequent Pricing Desk call centre coverage as well as routine release of day-end reports 
Provide back-up support to the Fuels Marketing Team as necessary. 

IN-DEPTH DATA ANALYTICS SUPPORT 

Conduct pricing/margin analysis to ensure that retail pricing ‘philosophies’ for each gas bar location are optimized to ensure the right balance of profitability and competitiveness. 
Leverage industry data (eg. Kalibrate data) to perform regular benchmarking analysis. 
Create MS Access queries & tables as required to help support the team effectively. 
Work with the Petroleum FP&A Team in managing both upstream and downstream data requirements. 
Analyze fuel grade spreads for each market and Identify trends and opportunities where necessary. 
Engage with the team to design and implement enhancements to current processes. 
Ensure that the Propane business is fully optimized at each location in terms of overall profitability and competitiveness. 
Support the Operations Team on developing the necessary reporting for the annual ‘Performance Plus’ Program. 
Become a subject matter expert (SME) on the AS400 system with the ability to create ad hoc reports and conduct necessary data mining. 
Respond to inquiries from Senior Management and FP&A as required. 

What you bring 

High degree of proficiency with the MS Office Suite of products, primarily Access and Excel 
Experience in MS Access database query design and/or SQL knowledge 
University degree is an asset 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and provide recommendations 
1-3 years of business experience in an analytical role is an asset 
Excellent verbal and written presentation skills
