Title: eHealth Data Analyst
Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES

Collects and monitors eLogs for Non-Insured Health Benefits (NIHB).
Provides a range of data collection and analyses to support the data needs of KO eHealth, partners and stakeholders.
Analyzes, interprets and reports telemedicine usage data using appropriate methods in response to inquiries from Clinical Services Coordinator, Assistant eHealth Director and KO eHealth Director.
Ensures data quality and validity by conducting data review on a daily basis.
Works closely with community telemedicine coordinators to ensure collection of valid data.
Prepares and disseminates community telemedicine usage surveillance information in various formats including charts, graphs, and community telemedicine usage profiles to be presented to community partners, if required presents the data in appropriate format to partners.
Works with computer programs and various databases to conduct data extraction, data set creation and analysis using spreadsheets and statistical software packages (e.g., Excel, OTN database).
Produce monthly and quarterly telemedicine usage reports based on health specialties.
Assist in annual performance report by providing statistical analysis of KO eHealth services.
Collects and processes confidential data and information according to PHIPA guidelines.
Perform other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Post-secondary degree in health sciences with a background in statistical analysis or a college diploma in a related field supplemented with two years of experience in data collection, sorting, analysis and reporting.
Professional and responsible attitude towards work
Ability to speak English and/or Oji-cree,Cree, Objibway
Excellent computer skills such as M/S Office; Excel
Experience in working with various databases.
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills
Good oral and written communications skills
Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Demonstrated ability to treat confidential information in a mature and professional manner.
Dedication to service excellence

Location: Balmertown, Ontario
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why Work for Us?
 Innovation. Act with Integrity. Collaboration. Embrace Diversity. Care
 We come from many countries, cultures, races, ethnicities, abilities and nationalities. We bring our passions including singing, biking, swimming, dancing, cooking, volunteering, parenting, coaching and much more! We are proud of our nearly equal balance of men and women and strengthened by our non-binary and transgender team members. Every employee belongs.
 We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.
 Company Description
 Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics, initially focused on the treatment of cancer. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates.
 Zymeworks is seeking a highly-motivated Data Analyst who is looking to grow their career with our company.
 This position will report to the Associate Director of Enterprise Applications and can be based either in our offices in Vancouver BC or Remote (Canada).
 As a condition of employment, Zymeworks requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and provide verification of such.
 Key Responsibilities

 Develops tools for Zymeworks’ scientific data system’s integrations, and visualization of many forms of data including scientific R&D data.
 Participates in requirement analysis with our scientific R&D teams to understand the experimental data being produced, provides proposals to organize and formalize the data from these experiments, and works on developing tools to store this data in the system. 
Use multiple system API’s to extract and transform data to a standard format to be used by scientific staff/end users. 
Create workflows and visual dashboard for presentation of a variety of data. 
Manages and organizes the storage of our biological data (protein products, antibodies, small molecules, other molecular entities) in the LIMS/ELN/Inventory, along with associated metadata. 
Performs daily administrative tasks such as data administration and access control of the scientific software systems. 
Works with our in-house lab scientists, and external Contract Research Organizations to develop, document, and enforce standard operating procedures and protocols for our experiments and the associated data upload and management procedures. 
Works with the vendors and in-house scientific and software teams to implement and support best practices and optimal utilization of the informatics and data management resources. 
Documents and trains scientific staff/end users on best practices and compliance policies related to the scientific data system and data handling.

 Qualifications and Education

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Chemistry and a minimum of 2 years’ related experience working with data management software in the biopharmaceutical industry or similar data management software or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 Skills and Abilities

 Working experience with programming languages (Python, C/C++, Java, Perl). 
Working experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire). 
Basic knowledge of databases like SQL, PostgreSQL. 
Working knowledge of ELN / LIMS / Molecule Registration systems.
 Demonstrated experience with Information Technology standards and practices such as Change Management, SDLC, ITIL. 
Strong drive to work in data management including capturing, refining, annotating, characterizing, and storing data. 
Self-starter, team player, problem solver who is highly flexible and responsive to evolving project needs. 
Familiarity with using different API tools. 
Fluent in written and spoken English.
 Familiarity with proteins, protein expression and purification methods is an asset, as well as basic knowledge of experiments like mass spectroscopy, DSC, SPR, FACS, ELISA or other cell-based assays. 
Experience in negotiating software requirements within and across research departments and translating those requirements to software solutions. 
Experience in the capture and management of high throughput experimental data. 
Experience working with / building ETL tools and familiarity with data warehousing concepts

 NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: Zymeworks values our relationships with our Recruitment Partners. We will only accept resumes from those partners whom have been contracted by a member of our Human Resources team to collaborate with us. Zymeworks is not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received without contract.
 #LI-PT1

Title: Marketing Data Analyst - (Remote)
Description:
Mattermost is an open source platform for secure collaboration across the entire software development lifecycle. Hundreds of thousands of developers around the globe trust Mattermost to increase their productivity by bringing together team communication, task and project management, and workflow orchestration into a unified platform for agile software development.
 


 Founded in 2016, Mattermost’s open source platform powers over 800,000 workspaces worldwide with the support of over 4,000 contributors from across the developer community. The company serves over 800 customers, including European Parliament, NASA, Nasdaq, Samsung, SAP, United States Air Force and Wealthfront, and is backed by world-class investors including Battery Ventures, Redpoint, S28 Capital, YC Continuity. To learn more, visit www.mattermost.com.
 


 We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more about working at Mattermost and apply!
 


 Mattermost is seeking a passionate data enthusiast to lead our Marketing data analytics. As a data-driven organization, Mattermost relies on our data team to drive marketing insights, ensure accurate data across systems, iterate on current key business metrics, and dive into complex datasets to answer business-critical questions.
 

   In this role, you will work closely with the marketing, sales, product, and engineering organizations to deeply understand customer trends, analyze marketing activities, product adoption, and sales results in order to surface insights that impact the health of the overall business. If you are data-obsessed, love connecting the dots, thrive in an iterative environment, and aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty with data, this is the role for you.
 


 About Our Tools


   Tool Stack: Marketo, Salesforce, Wordpress, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize, Snowflake, dbt, Stitch, Hightouch, Looker, Google Sheets/Excel, etc.
 

   Coding Languages: SQL, Python, LookML
 
 Duties and Resonsibilities:

 Work with the Marketing team to quantitatively understand problems and potential solutions; analyze disparate data sets in creative ways to generate new understandings of our business.
 Maintain and enhance analytics infrastructure including data models and visualization tools at Mattermost in cooperation with analysts across the organization.
 Analyze the performance of campaign launches and experiments using analytics tools, data platforms, and internal databases.
 Ensure the highest levels of data quality, organization, and reliability.
 Examine funnel performance, identify issues before they become problems, and suggest solutions.
 Use historical data to forecast future performance in real time.
 Surface analytical insights: proactively investigate root causes of aberrant data, and identify opportunities for optimization.
 Support design and implementation of experimentation necessary to improve channel efficiency, drive growth, and inform marketing investment decisions.
 Build and maintain dashboards that will capture the Marketing team’s performance against our success metrics.
 Participate in the definition and measurement of KPIs that will drive the company’s success.
 Assist in training new hires and colleagues on the workings of Mattermost’s data and what it means to be a data-driven culture.
 Lead strategic cross-functional data initiatives to stitch together Mattermost customer journey data for internal analytics consumption.
 Partner with the Data Engineering team to ensure relevant data is centralized into our data warehouse and modeled for performant analytics, while meeting our high data-quality standards.


 Required Background and Skills:

 4+ years experience with complex data analysis, visualization, and dashboards as part of full-time work, college coursework, personal projects, internships, or research
 Extensive experience with SQL
 Demonstrated experience using a data visualization tool such as Looker or Tableau to visualize and model raw data sets
 Able to proactively engage, communicate, and collaborate with cross-functional business stakeholders
 Deep understanding of marketing tactics, including campaigns and marketing channels such as SEM, SEO, Social, Events, Display, Content, and Email
 Knowledge of digital tagging methodologies and tracking. Expertise in new/emerging technologies in digital tracking (URL, cookies, cookie-less approaches).
 Experience applying probability and statistics to real-world problems; applied experience in experimentation design, A/B testing and/or probabilistic modeling a plus
 Passion for data and analytics
 Logical and analytical abilities to help solve problems and derive insights from data
 Resourceful, self-motivated, and able to successfully complete multiple competing projects under tight deadlines
 Experience using dbt or other data transformation tools
 Python experience
 Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Business, or related discipline



 Mattermost is a remote-first company with staff living and working across the globe. We are currently hiring staff in these countries/regions:
 


 Australia - Bangladesh - Brazil - Bulgaria - Canada - Chile - Colombia - Finland - Georgia - Germany - Greece - India - Ireland - Mauritius - Mexico - Norway - Pakistan - Philippines - Poland - Portugal - Spain - South Korea - Suriname - Turkey - Uganda - Ukraine - United Kingdom - United States



 We are constantly working towards adding more countries/regions to this list, but first we need to make sure we are compliant with local laws and regulations, which takes time.
 


 Mattermost is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people from all walks of life. We don't discriminate against staff or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Title: Data Analyst
Data Analyst, Health Surveillance - BC Centre for Disease Control
Description:
Data Analyst, Health Surveillance


   BC Centre for Disease Control
 

   Vancouver BC
 



 As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.




   This position supports Data and Analytic Services initiatives. The scope of this role and assignments varies and may be focused on COVID-19 surveillance, integrated administrative datasets, public health lab surveillance, infectious disease modeling and other priorities and initiatives. Strong programing skills in R, Python and/or SAS preferred. Experience with data science/machine learning, visualization or infectious disease dynamic modelling tools desirable.
 


 What you’ll do




Perform data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation.
Develop and maintain data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports.
Write computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same.
Create analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data.
Receive and respond to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures.
Automate routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.
Perform descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply.
Identify issues, trends, and developments.
Communicate findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level.
Automate routine analyses using standard programming tools.
Monitor data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identify and communicate anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensure that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible.
Follow up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data.
Correct data errors in a timely manner.
Document processes for these procedures.




 What you bring




Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent.
Three (3) years’ experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.




   You also have the ability to:
 



Write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
Manage and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.
Create data visualizations.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Operate related equipment
Carry out the duties of the position.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.




   You have knowledge of:
 

Standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.
PC systems and applications.
Descriptive statistics
Health-related terminology.




 What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.




 Job Type: Regular, Full-Time
  
Wage: $36.41 to $38.49 per hour
  
Location: 655 West 12th Avenue, Vancouver BC, V5Z 4R4
  
Hours of Work: Monday-Friday; 0830-1630
  
Requisition # 128325E
 



 What we do




   The BC Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) is dedicated to preventing and controlling communicable diseases and promoting environmental health for the province of BC. BCCDC is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).
 



   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA and BCCDC are committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.
 



 ATTN: PHSA Employees:




   To be considered as a PHSA employee (internal applicant) for this position, 
  you must apply online via your internal profile at http://internaljobs.phsa.ca
 



   Please note the internal job posting will no longer be accessible after the expiry date of
   July 14, 2022. If the internal job posting has expired, please contact the Internal Jobs Help Desk and advise that you would like to be considered as a late internal applicant for this position. 
  Please do not apply for the external job posting.




   If you have not registered your internal profile, a password is required to log in for the first time. To obtain your password, please contact the 
  Internal Jobs Help Desk at 604-875-7264 or 1-855-875-7264. Please note regular business hours are Monday – Friday (excluding stats), 8:30am to 4:30pm. For inquiries outside of regular business hours, please email the Internal Jobs Help Desk at internaljobshelpu@phsa.ca and a Help Desk Representative will contact you the next business day.

Title: Technical Business Analyst/ Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 156361  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team 
Scotiabank’s Financial Crimes and Operation Risk Engineering is responsible for running global services that provide the design and delivery for AML technology solutions to meet our Financial Crime regulatory requirements in the different jurisdictions that Scotiabank operates in.

 The Role 

The Advisory Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for designing data mapping solutions, data profiling and data analysis and working closely with the AML business partners to implement AML data solutions


 Some of the key accountabilities include:

 Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies
 Takes requirements and does some data analysis work using SQL
 Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers
 Translates requirements for developers by creating out the mapping documents
 Work with QA to address comments and concerns and relay requirements and goals
 Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities
 Supports one or more highly complex business processes
 Works on multiple projects as a project team member
 Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs
 Create business solutions that increase competitive advantage
 Exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions


 What You Will Bring to Succeed
 
Must have skills:

 5 years of experience in a similar Business/Data Systems analyst background – preferably within a FI or related large enterprise
 3 years of experience analyzing data using SQL
 3 years of experience working in data projects
 3 years of experience in AML/KYC


 Nice to have skills:

 Basic knowledge of programming languages in order to comprehend reading code and basic functions
 Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions
 Self-starter that actively engages issues seeking resolution, ability to meet dynamic changes on prioritization
 Ability to manage assigned tasks and expectations without direct instruction or oversight
 Fast, adaptable learner who can hit the ground running
 Ability to work well under pressure while demonstrating strong professionalism
 Excellent communications skills to coordinate with high ranking individuals internally (Director, VP level and up) 

Strong investigation, prioritization, and organization skills 

Candidate must have an open mind when it comes to approach, and be able to assess each situation separately
 Must be able to collaborate closely with a team at times, while also being capable of holding themselves accountable to meet individual deadlines without hand holding


 The Workplace

 We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work 
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! 
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world 
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
 We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results 
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

 
Scotiabank
 As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone.  Is this Role not the Exact fit? 
Sign up to stay in touch; we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team.

Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. Title: Data Analyst, Reliability
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our Signals & Communications Office is seeking a Reliability Data Analyst to provide expertise in and coordinate the development and implementation of data management strategies and data collection systems for Customer Service/Safety and Security Division. They will identify, analyze and interpret data trends/issues and make recommendations for improvement to business, operations and system processes. 
What will I be doing? 

Develops weekly reports analyzing On-Time-Performance (OTP) of Rail Operations (GO Transit and UP Express) using data from multiple database and trouble tickets. 
Builds forecasting models for utility expenditure and asset performance. 
Develops and implements data management strategies and data collection systems including the design and development of relational databases for information management and retrieval that optimize statistical efficiency, data quality and supports evidence based decision making. 
Imports, cleans, transforms, validates and models data to improve data quality and ensure data is accurate and relevant and fosters understanding of operational, business and system issues/trends while advising on data issues which includes quality, availability and usability. 
Identifies, analyses, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets using programming platforms for data gathering and analysis activities; produces ongoing and ad hoc reports and dashboards that identify issues, provide insight into results and outline recommendations for process improvements to resolve operational, business and system issues. 
Presents data in dashboards, charts, graphs and/or tables by building, designing, and maintaining online applications such as data input/data collection screens to capture and present meaningful information/data for reporting, analysis and presentation purposes for use by management, internal business units and stakeholders in identifying and implementing process improvements. 
Develops and maintains a comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of internal and external data sources relevant to operational, business and systems data to design and build meaningful databases that centralizes data for internal stakeholders to access. 
Liaises with internal stakeholders and business units to identify relevant data which can be shared and will contribute to the data collection process as well as to determine stakeholder and business unit specific data/information needs. 
Liaises with counterparts in other transit and enforcement agencies to gather and share information on data management and collection strategies, operational, business together with system issues and best practices. 
Contributes to the identification and development of new process improvement opportunities for operational, business and systems activities through the development and implementation of data management and collection strategies as well as the analysis of data to support process improvements and evidence based decision making. 
Provides subject matter expertise to internal stakeholders and business units to provide technical advice, assist with data interpretation, needs analysis and provide insight and commentary for decision making purposes. 

What skills & qualifications do I need? 

University degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Engineering or a related discipline, or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent. 
Minimum four (4) years’ experience in a Data Analyst or similar role, with a background in technology, information management, relational database design and development, business intelligence, data mining or statistics. 
Knowledge of relational database concepts, database management software and tools and computer applications including MS Office Excel (Pivot tables, Power Pivot, formulas, VBA) python and SQL queries. 
Analytical and problem solving skills to collect, investigate, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with strict attention to detail and accuracy. 
Machine learning, especially NLP (Natural Language Processing) – would be considered an asset 

Accommodation:  Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. 
Application Process:  All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. 

Metrolinx employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Metrolinx’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination will be required. If you are not able to obtain COVID-19 vaccination for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Metrolinx. 
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. 
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Title: Data Analyst
Company: North Eastern Ontario Family & Children's Services
Description:
DATA ANALYSTTwelve (12) Month Full-time Contract Position in TimminsAs a member of the Continuous Improvement and Standards team, the primary responsibilities will be to facilitate the application, collection, analysis, interpretation and evaluation of data. You will develop and apply effective and efficient data tracking reports and mechanisms as deemed necessary by the Agency. You will be a resource applying your expertise to any and all NEOFACS programs and sites. Additionally, you will conduct research and program evaluations as required to identify trends, patterns, and service gaps. You will promote effective communication venues and strategies to increase awareness and understanding of the effective application of data, program evaluation and research. You will also act as the primary liaison with other professionals and research affiliates.
JOB REQUIREMENTS (QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS):

University Bachelor’s Degree in Health Informatics, Statistics, Health Administration, Computer Science or similar;
Master’s Degree or post-graduate diploma is preferred;
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent computer, communication, organizational, presentation and training skills
Bilingualism (English/ French) is an asset
Must have a valid driver’s license and use of own vehicle will be required
Must provide government-issued evidence of receipt of 2nd Health Canada approved COVID vaccination dose at least fourteen (14) days prior to your start date, or evidence that you qualify for a human rights exemption.

The job description for this position is available upon request.
Please submit your resume by: July 22, 2022Quote Competition # 22-45
For more employment opportunities please visit our website at www.neofacs.org
North Eastern Ontario Family and Children’s Services only accepts resumes that are received by the email address above. We thank everyone for their interest in North Eastern Ontario Family and Children’s Services; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
NEOFACS is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free selection process. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the interview coordinator of accommodation measures you may require during our selection process. Information received relating to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
Working for the well-being and safety of children, youth and families.
***********************************
ANALYSTE DE DONNÉESPoste contractuel à temps plein de douze (12) mois à TimminsÀ titre de membre de l’équipe de l’Amélioration continue et des normes, l’heureuse candidate ou l’heureux candidat aura comme responsabilités principale de faciliter l’application, la collecte, l’analyse, l’interprétation et l’évaluation des données. Vous élaborerez et appliquerez des rapports et des mécanismes efficaces de suivi des données comme l’organisme le juge nécessaire. Vous serez une ressource et appliquerez votre expertise à tous les programmes et les sites des SFENEO. En outre, vous ferez des recherches et des évaluations de programmes au besoin pour cerner les tendances, les habitudes et les écarts de services. Vous ferez la promotion des lieux et des stratégies de communication efficaces pour sensibiliser les gens et leur faire mieux comprendre l’application efficace des données, de l’évaluation des programmes et des recherches. Vous servirez aussi d’agente ou d’agent de liaison principal ou principale avec d’autres professionnels ou professionnelles et des personnes affiliées en matière de recherches.
TITRES, QUALITÉS ET COMPÉTENCES REQUISES

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What makes SYNNEX extraordinary? We believe that success is achieved by bringing together unique points of view. Our team is comprised of innovative perspectives from a diverse group of bright minds who are inspired with a vision to imagine and the energy to make it happen. Whether you're just starting out in your career or a seasoned executive, we have a wide range of opportunities for those who have a passion for technology and a desire to bring their full self to work every day where you can grow and make a difference.
 
 Take the next step towards a rewarding career and be a part of a team that embraces inclusivity and teamwork. You're ready to be SYNNEXtraordinary!
 
 Our recruiting experience is digital!
 
 Technology is at the core of our business - we don't just sell technology, we use it. The power of digital interviewing allows you the flexibility of using your computer or mobile device to record your interview on your own schedule in the comfort of your home. Our recruiting process allows you to tell your story in a stress-free way that is interactive and fun, so if you receive a link to Share your Story with us, we hope you have an awesome digital experience.
 

Data Analyst

 The Data Analyst is responsible for leading, developing, managing and executing critical analytics, reporting and data visualization needed for financial operational reporting and processes. The incumbent will partner with co-workers and other business stakeholders to develop analytics, views/queries and models to provide business stakeholders and senior leadership the information and actionable intelligence they need to make informed business decisions. Proactive identification of opportunities to enhance reports and identify business profitability improvement opportunities is also a key focus of this position. The incumbent will be a seasoned, well-organized, skilled analyst who is experienced in dealing with many disparate systems, data sets, tools, processes and responsibilities. The incumbent must be a self-starter who can manage work priorities and schedules independently. Assignments will also include mid-high complexity projects that the incumbent will manage and lead with a high degree of autonomy. The Data analyst will also have direct interaction and communication with senior levels of management (VPs and above).
 

Get Inspired by the Work You'll Do


 Build, produce and maintain financial operational reporting, visualization (PowerBI) and analytics as required by business stakeholders and leadership (40%)
 Proactive identification of reporting and profitability improvements (25%)
 Prepare and analyze ad-hoc requests (20%)
 Report maintenance and support (15%)


 Your passion is sparked by:


 Advanced knowledge/experience with SAP BI/BW tools and Data Visualization (PowerBI)
 2+ years of equivalent work experience
 Bachelor's Degree with Finance, Economics, MIS, Information Systems, Mathematics or related quantitative discipline field of study required
 Intermediate to Advanced knowledge/experience with SQL, MS-Access, Excel, database design
 Familiarity with Statistical modeling techniques recommended
 Able to interact effectively with all levels of management
 Strong organizational and time management skills, driving tasks to completion
 Able to constructively work under stress and pressure when faced with high workloads and tight deadlines
 Able to work independently with minimum supervision
 Able to quickly learn new systems and technology
 Able to express ideas clearly and convey necessary information
 Able to prepare appropriate reports, presentations and other business correspondence


 We have Great Perks • Flexible Time Away (flex vacation) • Every day is Casual Day • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance plan • Discretionary Profit Sharing • Employee Referral Award program • Employee Purchase Plan/ Company Discounts • Out of Country travel assistance • Health/ Wellness initiatives • Paid Personal Days • Employee Assistance Program • Education Reimbursement • Milestone Service Awards • Community Involvement activities in partnership with Kids Help Phone • Employee of the Quarter awards • Group RRSP with Company Matching • Training Opportunities • Huang Leadership Development Scholarship • Bi-annual President's Club • Annual Founders Award
 

Be Inspired In Your Career.

 #LI-SK1
 

@ SYNNEX Corporation, we believe employees are our greatest asset and we empower them to make a difference in our business.
Diversity and inclusion makes us all better. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, protected veteran status, and all other protected statuses. 


@ SYNNEX Canada Limited, we are committed to supporting accommodation and inclusivity for persons with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and employment lifecycle. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know; we will work with you to meet your needs.

It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Title: Cognitive Data Analyst
Description:
They say you only get one chance to make a great first impression. At Wysdom we’re here to change that. We exist to help our clients make a great first impression with their customers – over and over again!Conversation is the new user interface (UI). It will power everything from self-driving cars to gadgets around your home. For a conversational UI to satisfy customers it requires continuous improvement. Wysdom creates and manages the smartest virtual agents on behalf of our clients.Wysdom is a fast growing, venture-backed start-up led by a team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We make sure Wysdom is a place that employees can learn, grow, have fun, and achieve excellence.Fit is everything for us. We believe in hiring for attitude, skills, and potential. We offer lots of autonomy and flexibility to be excellent at delivering value and hitting goals. If you’re an entrepreneurial, results oriented person, who doesn’t shy away from a challenge, you’re going to enjoy working here. Are you who we are looking for?We are looking for a rockstar Cognitive Data Analyst to join Wysdom. Wysdom is committed to slowing climate change by removing our team's personal commute so has become a fully remote company and this position can be located anywhere in Canada.But what will I actually be doing?Are you an experienced data analyst with a passion for problem-solving? Do you thrive on applying cutting-edge technology to meaningful problems? As a Cognitive Data Analyst, you will be responsible for driving the success of our data-based solution in the field. Part of your work involves building a deep understanding of the AI training process, knowing what drives success, and partnering with clients to enhance their VA (Virtual Agents) performance on third-party VA platforms. You will work with one of the most diverse teams of Conversation AI specialists, UX designers, data scientists, and innovators to deliver the best AI-enabled customer experience.Our clients are some of the top brands in the world. You will get a chance to be a part of how these companies are transforming their customer care operations into world-class digital experiences.In this role, you will: 

Engage with clients to develop a keen understanding of their business goals, strategies, their dataset, and scope out data requirements to better measure conversational AI experience
Develop efficient analytical reports about VA performance for our clients and executive team
Research & build novel data-driven ML based systems to automate VA optimization
Work with center of excellence team on the innovative POC projects focused on using AI models to do better analytics
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to deliver data-based solutions
Implement or edit tools & automation to drive efficiencies for delivery & optimization teams
Create & review to continually improve our insights products through performance improvements, new metrics, and visualizations

About You

University degree in a technical or mathematical discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering) or equivalent experience
2+ years of experience in data analytics
2+ years of experience in programming with Python
2+ years of experience working with ML frameworks/libraries e.g. Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tensor flow, or Pytorch
Experience in configuring & maintaining data visualization tools specifically Tableau, Power BI etc.
In-depth understanding of SQL (Experience with NoSQL, specifically MongoDB is an asset)
Excellent client-facing communication skills, and strong knowledge of the AI or chatbot industry
Proven proficiency in writing programs with modular structure
Strong technical experience in professional services and a proven track record of successfully delivering projects
Passion for delivering amazing results
Attention to detail

About Wysdom.AIWysdom.AI is a venture-funded start-up and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what it’s like to work at Wysdom.
Maqlgi8VeH

Title: Product Data Analyst (Remote or Hybrid)
Description:
Product Data Analyst

 Who we are

 Knak is very passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity.

 Knak is a world-class enterprise email and landing page creation platform with a focus on making successful and happy customers by providing them with an incredibly powerful, yet easy to use creation platform.

 Our industry leading SaaS solution is built by Marketers, for Marketers. We know that it’s the small things that make the biggest impact and that emails and landing pages are where the rubber hits the road when it comes to Marketing Automation.

 Our mission is to change the way Marketers work by making them more efficient, while improving the conversion rate of their campaigns and helping them stay on brand.

 Oh, and we have a bit of fun while doing it, too!

 As a Product Data Analyst, you will work closely with Knak's VP of Product and other key stakeholders to build a data platform with data from critical systems. You will then be responsible for analyzing the data and surfacing actionable insights to the wider Product Management, UX and Engineering teams.

 Role and Responsibilities:


 Work with Product Management team to build out key metrics for the Product Org
Develop dashboards in Visualization tooling (Tableau and Mixpanel) to track the Key Product Metrics
Lead data research projects requested by Product Management Org
Research and iterate on Key PLG/Activation metrics like: Setup, Aha & Habit Moments
Do independent research into the the North Star Metrics for the Product Org to uncover key insights which will be fed into the Product Discovery and User Research processes
Analyze and surface recommendations from Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, Support Tickets, etc)
Assist in building out a data platform across Knak, collaborating with other Data Analysts across Knak
Be a champion of data governance: establish naming conventions, build out data dictionaries and be the gatekeeper for the key product metrics
Surface recommendations and create presentations for leadership.



 Skills and Experience:


 4+ years of work experience in an Analyst role
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills;
Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, Mixpanel, Interana, etc);
Experience with SQL to extract, manipulate and discover insights in large data sets
Statistics and experimental methodology (e.g. A/B testing).
Ability to write scripts to handle data and automate processes using Javascript, Python, R, or your choice of language.
Experience doing quantitative analysis;
Passionate about data quality and willing to learn independently
Bonus points for experience with Product Metrics (Adoption, etc) PLG related metrics or Growth metrics (Setup+Aha+Habit Moments)



 What We Offer

 At Knak we have four foundational pillars. Culture, customers, product and growth. Culture is our number one pillar because we know that is at the core of building a strong company that can build amazing products and delight our customers. We do this with a laser focus on hiring the right people who are smart, positive and who want more than the typical nine-to-five offers.

 We offer an extremely rewarding, second to none work environment as acknowledged by Ottawa’s Best Places to Work 2021! We show our investment in our people through our competitive salaries, equity in the company, great benefits, paid vacation, Life leave days (because life happens), team lunches and off-sites, and most importantly our commitment to YOUR career growth.

 If this sounds like something you’re looking for, then we’d love to hear from you!

 If you don’t see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply.

Title: IT Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block. 


 Job Description
  The IT Logistics team at Block is responsible for helping to provide the necessary equipment & devices to our team members, across all business units, to help them maintain productivity and creativity. The scope of our services include IT hardware and software procurement, asset management, vendor relationship management, including, but not limited to laptops, desktops, monitors, and all supporting peripherals/accessories. We help to manage the entire product lifecycle of these corporate engineering devices, from vendor selection, vendor onboarding, asset database management, inventory & storeroom management, forecasting, procurement, receive/deploy, and end of life.
 Our mission is to enable our global customers to get the tools they need quickly and easily, while also looking out for Block’’s best interests as a business. Deliver hardware and software to new hires and existing customers as a seamless experience. Protect the business through vendor and asset lifecycle management. Constantly examine and evolve our practices to scale with the needs of our rapidly growing company.
 You will:

 Quickly immerse themselves in the daily operations of IT Logistics program to identify the key measurable performance data points within each of the processes (~50+)
 Collaborate within IT Logistics teams and relevant supporting teams to document business requirements
 Engage with cross functional internal partners to gain access to available API’s and data sets.
 Build relationships between data sets across multiple systems to enrich and validate available data
 Model analysis in Google Sheets and/or Excel to vet analysis and prove proof of concept
 Mature regularly required analysis to migrate from manual efforts to self-service dashboards, automated reports, and build triggers/notifications within the environment to push information, rather than pull it
 Vet the available tools within the environment for workflow automation, and apply / implement to the repeatable tasks to simplify daily operations for the IT Logistics team
 Focus on high impact results and scalability, while attempting to improve wherever possible
 Prepare analysis in an easily consumable format, appropriate for the audience, with ability to communicate the narrative behind the data
 Learn and maintain comprehensive knowledge of the operations that drive operational data to contribute to data-based decision making
 Understand high level goals with the ability to break them into smaller, more manageable tasks to contribute to gaining efficiency as an ongoing effort
 Ability to shift priorities quickly, as the business environment evolves, and deliver results on daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly cadence
 Engage with external partners, as needed, to assist in normalizing data from the source and creating long term, self service solutions
 Lead & support ad-hoc inquiries related to pricing and contract negotiations, component quality, forecasting, vendor selection, relationship management, product lifecycle management, IT Logistics operations performance and supply assurance
 Leverage (and develop) best practices in business intelligence from the existing Square hardware practice (and other relevant teams).
 Work with operations on capacity planning, new product introduction readiness, product lifecycle management, forecasting and issue resolution.
 Communicate to the team and senior management about all ongoing efforts, and any potential disruptions which can affect our ability to support our teams
 Travel ~15%, mostly within the US, California




 Qualifications
 
 3-5 plus years experience in supply or inventory planning or business operations
 2 plus years experience in dashboard development and workflow automation using scripts
 Expertise in Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets, Tableau/Looker or relevant platform that can be easily translated to current available dashboarding/business intelligence tools
 Experience translating consumer demand into supply plans
 A persistent attention to detail
 Curiosity, and the ability to work independently on defining and achieving specific outcomes based on team’s goals
 Experience translating data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
 Bachelor's degree in business, operations, or other relevant field or equivalent experience

 Additional Information
 
 We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
 We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
 Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
 Perks
 We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

 Healthcare coverage
 Retirement Plans
 Employee Stock Purchase Program
 Wellness perks
 Paid parental leave
 Paid time off
 Learning and Development resources

 Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.
 By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.
 With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.
 At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.



 Job Description
  The Information Systems Data Analyst will be part of a design and development team that includes data analysts, data base developers, data architects and process automation team. The mission will be to develop and maintain data analytics tools using Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft SQL Server and other data management tools.
 Most of the Things You’ll Work On:

 Assist in designing and developing data analytics solutions using Microsoft Power BI
 Creating analytics models which consume data from different sources like relational SQL databases, Sharepoint, and other Microsoft tools
 Manage system and data tool security based on industry best practices
 Participate in reviews and enhancements of analytics tools developed by peers [QA / QC]
 Assist in the process of improving data analytics models with adherence to best practices related with performance and reliability
 Properly document functionality and technical specifications of the analytics products under their scope
 Capable of delivering full life cycle development of analytics tools, including identifying user requirements, processing and preparing the data by connecting to various data sources, building reports or dashboards to address the user requirements, testing and deployment, maintenance, user support etc
 Participate in and contribute to the design and development of best practices for data analytics models
 Research new products and technologies to enhance the process of development, testing and deployment of data analytics models
 Understands the interactions and dependencies among data and process components
 Communicates with various stakeholders to understand their requirements, share the results and findings
 Works collaboratively with Manager and team to forward plan workload
 Maintains awareness of multiple asks / competing priorities and proactively requests input from others (specifically immediate team / manager) to speed up or slow down various Epics within workload




 Qualifications
  You'll Need To Have:

 1 to 3 years of experience using Microsoft Power BI building dashboards and visualizations
 Strong knowledge of data warehouse concepts and architecture
 Strong proficiency in SQL with the ability to write complex queries
 Exceptional analytical skills
 Strong communication skills; able to communicate effectively with various stakeholders and with both technical and non-technical audiences
 Advanced Excel skills: pivot tables & Power Pivot. (Experience in macros and VBA is an asset)
 Previous working experience with data from an ERP application is highly preferred

 Additional Information
  We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.
 IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.
 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.
 We request applicants submit their RESUME highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.
 #LI-PS2

Title: Senior Data Analyst

Senior Data Analyst


 Job-Type- Full time

 Deliver flexible reusable and well maintained core data repositories

 Develop and maintain expertise in the Investment domain as well as expertise in accessing querying testing and validating data content to drive quality and consistency within solutions Partner with the Data Governance group to establish appropriate standards and methodologies template and tools related to documenting analyzing and testing data work with management to implement these standards within the IS and Data Governance organizations

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 
The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate the provincial online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and are the exclusive provincial wholesaler to authorized private retail stores. 

 Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. We’re a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect and building value out of our differences. We’re an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard. 

 About the Role 
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data Science team. You will be responsible for maintenance of datasets, scheduled reporting, and design and development of reports in consultation with other business units and teams to implement new reporting needs (KPIs, data, format, channels, visualizations). You will use machine learning algorithms to create predictive models to drive better decision making and unlock actionable insights. You will play a fundamental role in the execution of data strategy across the enterprise, as well as assisting in building the omni-channel view of the customer. 

 About Your Day 


Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Interpret data, identify trends, and analyze results using statistical techniques to provide regular, timely and accurate reports to internal departments and business units
Collaborate with business units to identify opportunities for business process improvements and make recommendation for system modifications
Ensure KPIs are published and reviewed on a daily, weekly, monthly basis and perform analysis on any behaviors/processes that could impact data integrity
Partner with Data Engineers to implement and support production of analytical data models.
Create enterprise and business dashboards/visualizations for effective tracking of metrics
Design and develop predictive machine learning models to enable better decision making and create more value for our stakeholders
Serves as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for other functional departments
Provide guidance and share expertise with other project teams to support business initiatives
Be connected and influential within the OCS analyst community
 About You 


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Operations Research, Math, or a related discipline.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar Business Intelligence role
Highly Proficient in writing advanced SQL queries and views to analyze large multi-dimensional datasets
Expertise in one or more visualization tools (Power BI is highly preferred)
Hands-on experience in Descriptive and Predictive data modeling using R and/or Python
Demonstrated analytical ability in a results-oriented environment with internal and external customer interaction
Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment
Experience with one or more of the following business domains would be an asset: E-Commerce, Retail, Merchandising, Supply Chain or Business Analytics.
Understanding of data warehousing, data modeling concepts and building new data warehouse tables would be an asset.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and the ability to express thoughts logically and succinctly.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
 Remote Work 


This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office a minimum of 1 day per week, with the ability to work from home for the remaining workdays (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance)
When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications
 About the Job 


City: Toronto, ON
Employment Type: Full-Time, Permanent
Required Travel: Rare, within the GTA
Application Deadline: July 11, 2022 at 11:59PM
 We are committed to providing an accessible, equitable and inclusive candidate and employee experience. We provide reasonable accommodation throughout the recruitment process and in employment. If you require an accommodation, please let us know, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Associate Sales Data Analyst
Description:
Department: AGI
 Looking to unbox your full potential? STEP UP with the ALDO GROUP.
 WE'RE ON A JOURNEY TO CREATE A WORLD OF LOVE, CONFIDENCE AND BELONGING
 The ALDO Group has been on this journey for over 40 years. We believe that our passionate associates are at the heart of our success, and that with them we will lead into our future with kindness.
 The ALDO Group is committed to diversity and inclusion, not only now, but for the long term. We strongly encourage people who are Aboriginal, racialized, have disabilities, come from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or have intersectional identities to apply for employment with us. At ALDO Group, we will always strive to take steps to create a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes equal opportunity and accountability.#WeAreALDO


 STEP UP EXPERIENCE

Recognition programs to showcase your talent!
To be part of a company that takes a stand on issues affecting people, the environment, and our partners
Summer Fridays (because Summer is for fun)
Purchase discount on merchandise sold in all our divisions.

YOUR ROLE

 As an AGI Associate Sales Data Analyst, you are responsible for going through the reported sales within our systems and documenting issues. You will serve as a liaison between the Senior Planner responsible for sales reporting, the sales coordinator, our franchise partners, and the internal IT team. You are responsible for both short- term and long-term solutions to the persistent issues related to sales reporting, and ultimately, responsible for delivering clean data. The job requires analytical work, diagnostic work, and collaboration across many teams to find solutions. The candidate needs to be results oriented and driven to find a permanent solution to the issue. Strong communication skills are a must with extensive coordination across multiple teams.
 Responsibilities:

Support and work closely with the internal teams (Planning, Sales Coordinator, IT) along with external teams (Franchise Partners) to identify and document the issues.
Analyze reported sales daily and cross-reference against what the partner reports manually to confirm accuracy.
Coordinate with AGI sales coordinator and franchise partners to document their issues with uploading sales.
Coordinate with internal IT team and coordinator to work on short-term and long-term solutions.
Prepare reports that outline every error encountered issue and summarize the plans that are in place to address them.
Provide concrete solutions to a variety of issues related to the data.
Follow up with all involved parties to ensure progress is achieved and maintained over time.
Ensure the reported data is correct going forward and provided in a timely and accurate manner.



 DO YOU HAVE THE PROFILE WE'RE LOOKING FOR?


Bachelor’s Degree required
Minimum 1-2 years of previous experience working as an analyst
Strong analytical skills, well organized, and detailed oriented
Strong problem-solving abilities and solutions oriented
Ability to collaborate, work alongside multiple teams, and communicate well, while having the level of autonomy needed to find appropriate solutions
IT background is an asset. Familiarity with Oracle, Microsoft Excel, and working with large data sets.
