Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for a new challenge? Consider Trufla for your next career.
- Do You see opportunities in problems?- Do You always question the status quo?- Are You passionate about problem-solving and troubleshooting?- Do You like to bring innovative solutions through technology?- Do You like to deliver world-class quality software?
The insurance industry is one of the oldest and biggest industries in the world. In some shape or form, insurance is embedded in all our daily activities. The site that you are currently reading this job posting from has insurance. The server hosting this site has insurance as well.
You may be asking yourself: I am a Senior Business Data Analyst, why does this matter to me?
Because insurance extends to every possible industry on Earth, the nature of insurance products became very complex; hence the compounded layers in the day-to-day operations to sell and manage insurance products. Here at Trufla, we are on a mission to redefine how insurance should be distributed and serviced. We understand that this is not an easy task, and it requires us to push the boundaries of software engineering. That is why we are looking for talented Senior Business Data Analyst's - like you - who thrive through challenges and excel in discovering creative solutions.
What is it like to work at Trufla?
You will be part of a diversified family that has talented people across the globe driven by the same purpose. Our team is excited to face any obstacle that comes our way, and we take on hardships with a smile. We practice the agile mindset, and believe it’s better to get something done than wait for it to be “perfect”. Learning from our mistakes and putting our best work forward are values we live by every day.
You will be an integral part of what we build, but most importantly, we will ask for your input on how we build it. We value everyone’s opinions and encourage open communication. Trufla is always growing, which means there is plenty of opportunity for career growth. We promote education, collaboration, and monthly check-ins to make sure you are on the right track.
Senior Business Data Analyst
About You
As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are familiar with the business intelligence and visualization workflow as well as statistical analysis principles. Your attention to detail and drive to create informative dashboards and reports can be relentless. You understand that in your position you must stand at the center between multiple parties who hold different vocabularies and priorities and become a data-expert and translator. You have tremendous patience and can work with people to help them communicate their own requirements and queries clearly. You have both the skills and knowledge required to mentor other data analysts. As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are flexible in how you communicate ideas – you are comfortable crafting insights into any form your customers and team require in order to understand the concepts and problems. You use one-on-one conversation, conference calls, presentations, meetings, spreadsheets, diagrams, flowcharts, email or complex documents in order to collect and express ideas in the manner your audience prefers. Because of your flexible communication style, you are familiar with various popular applications and business intelligence tools which are commonly used in corporate environments. You are extremely well organized and can balance multiple tasks and competing priorities.
RESPONSIBILITIES
- Translate business requirements and queries into actionable insights- Develop business intelligence dashboards and reports for both internal and external stakeholders- Work and communicate effectively with various technical (data science, software engineering, etc), and non-technical (leadership, account and project management) teams- Make business decisions independently and execute on deliverables in a self-reliant manner- Lead and mentor Junior/Intermediate Data Analysts
QUALIFICATIONS
- 3+ years experience providing professional business and data analysis- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business field, preferably business analytics, economics, actuarial science, statistics, or engineering (MBA / graduate degree preferred)- Strong statistical foundation- Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication / presentation skills- Thorough knowledge of data visualization software (Tableau preferred)- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail- Experienced with SQL and other querying languages- Comfortable with Python- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well both independently and in a team environment with stakeholders at all levels of the organization- Ability to handle multiple priorities and manage deliverables on tight timeframes- Experience leading and mentoring others- Working knowledge of the insurance industry would be a plus- Automation abilities for multi-tenant analytics and understanding of ETL / data engineering processes would be a plus
VALUES & COMPETENCES
- Positive attitude and enthusiasm for employee training and development- Flexible and adaptable with proven problem solving ability- High degree of professionalism and integrity- Demonstrated accountability and reliability in the quality and timeliness of work- Ability to work well within a team and independently- Critical thinker with strong attention to details
Do you think we match? Apply Now!
If you have what it takes, apply to the job through the "Apply Now" button above.
*After applying, complete your application by taking the required assessment below:
Take Assessment HERE
Trufla Technology is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: CRM & Loyalty Zone Data Analyst - L'Oreal Information Technology
Description:
Title: Loyalty Zone Delivery Data Analyst 


Function: Information Technology 


Location: Montreal 

 Data & CRM Team - Data Analyst 

 This position is part of Digital IT Zone delivery Team and will support the evolution of our data ecosystem on the O+O experience with focus in Data. The goal of this role is hybrid as we are expecting to build the foundation and clear understanding of our data ecosystem but at the same time to look for the application of business intelligence concepts or machine learning models in the future. Understand business is key as will oversee interpreting data insights and effectively communicating their findings with stakeholders from projects. 

 Responsibilities 

 Conduct Data analyses, generates insights and influence stakeholders. 
Data governance foundation, work with the different stakeholders to master the different dimensions of Data (Ownership, Standardization, Quality, Accessibility and security & Compliance). 
Identify right data sources and use the data to identify possible challenges to analyze them for decision making. 
Map use cases priorities and work in the categorization of them to prioritize the top high financial projects. 
Support IT teams, Data Country Leads, BRM at country/zone level and all external partners to manage data project and secure the right demand management process. 
Work closely with the Zone Digital IT in NYC to leverage their expertise and share best practices and understand our Data & Analytics ecosystem. 
Ensures respect of master data generation process to provide high quality data to the rest of the organization. 
As the team is split in different physical area, ensure to support all the countries that are part of our coverage. 

 Skills and Qualifications 

 5 yrs+ experience in data and analytics from an IT perspective. 
Excellent knowledge of analytics at large 
Capacity to understand business, ask the right questions, and be understandable by non tech/non data savvy stakeholders – Empathy is key. 
Capacity to think on the strategic layer but also on the execution one 
Experience working with Agile-driven projects & teams 
Capacity to think out of the box, data driven with good communication and project management skills 
Being able to work under pressure and on several projects in parallel. 
Demonstrates at least a basic understanding of compliance and data privacy laws. 
Programming languages (SQL, Python, R, etc) 
English, speaking and written is a must. Spanish, Portuguese & French is a plus. 
Position based in Montréal or Mexico City. 
Vous pouvez postuler à trois offres maximum sur une période de 30 jours consécutifs. 
Vous ne pouvez pas retirer votre candidature une fois que vous avez postulé, alors assurez-vous de choisir une offre qui correspond à vos attentes ! 
Vous pouvez voir les offres sur lesquelles vous avez déjà postulé dans l’onglet « Votre espace de candidature. 
Veuillez ne pas créer un nouveau compte avec une adresse e-mail différente. Si vous le faites, vos comptes pourraient être fusionnés et votre dossier de candidature sera supprimé.

Title: Database Administrator and Data Analyst
Description:
Job Brief
 We are seeking a Database Administrator/Data Analyst to join our great team of IT professionals at Graymont. We are an innovative, technology driven, global leader in lime and limestone solutions that operates throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.






Canada - BC - Richmond





Database Administrator and Data Analyst
 About Graymont: Graymont is a global leader in lime and limestone solutions. With operations across North America and Asia-Pacific, Graymont’s growing business focuses on technology and application innovation. Graymont’s Information Services department is instrumental in delivering on Graymont’s strategy, exposing employees to information, technology, and opportunities they might not see in other companies. Visit www.graymont.com to find out more.
 Role: We are seeking an experienced Database Administrator/Data Analyst to join a global team of IT professionals. The position reports to an Enterprise Applications Manager and is responsible to design, install, monitor, conduct performance tuning, and maintenance of production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability for a variety of on-premise enterprise applications. In your new role, you will be working in an exciting multi-tasking environment that allows you to demonstrate your core skills of data and performance management. Other activities will require you to envision and develop solutions such as data integration, automation of manual processes, data management, to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, and proactive performance and data quality enhancements.
 This position will be based out of Graymont's newly renovated head office in Richmond, BC under a hybrid/flexible work from home and in-office arrangement
 Primary Responsibilities:

Maintain and manage a robust set of modern highly-available enterprise Microsoft SQL Server systems, and production databases including regular system patching.
Maintain and evolve redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.
Proactively monitor database logs, execution times and resolve performance issues.
Stay current with security alerts and best practices to recommend proactive and remedial actions.
Lead applications team to troubleshoot any service outages, and to maintain efficient application performance.
Design, build and maintain resilient data integrations between both in-house and cloud based applications/systems.
Assist applications team to troubleshoot complex data and other issues.

Requirements:

In-depth knowledge of SQL Server (2012 or higher).
Experience using SQL Server High Availability Clusters and Always On Availability Groups
Strong T-SQL development skills
Experience with scripting and automation using PowerShell, Python or similar tools
Experience supporting Enterprise Data Warehouse environments running on SQL Server would be an asset.
Experience with data integrations using Microsoft SSIS, Informatica PowerCenter, or other data integration products would be an asset.
Excellent analysis and data exploration skills to understand complex application schemas and data.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate within a distributed team across the organization.
Some after-hours work will be required.

Qualifications:

Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems and/or equivalent work experience.
3 or more years of experience in an Application Database Admin and/or Database System Admin or similar role
Certifications such as MSCA (SQL Database Administration), MSCE (Database Management and Analytics) or equivalents would be an asset.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our bottom line is different.
 There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.   Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.
Job Number: REQ4338 Location: Anywhere in Alberta Apply by: Jul 22, 2022 Paygrade: I (OTH) # Positions available: 1 Leader Name: Associate Vice President, Program Delivery
 As ATB’s next Data Analyst in the Portfolio Management Assurance and Delivery team, you will be accountable for tracking, documenting and maintaining critical data elements that feed our program and project reporting and insights as well as resource and talent analytics. You will elevate our ability to provide meaningful reporting and insights, capturing accurate information and collaborating with internal team members across our Technology and Innovation Team (TIE). As a natural connector of dots, you will synthesize complex data using advanced analytics, data visualizations, and dashboards to evaluate and share progress and results on a given product, project, or program. As a data enthusiast, you will pride yourself on an accurate, transparent, source of truth view of all initiatives across the initial phases of our SDLC.
 If you posses the following characteristics, we encourage you to apply:
 Business Fundamentals

Predictive Client Analytics
Business Analysis
Business Problem Solving
Client Centricity and Value Creation
Metrics Reporting

Interpersonal skills and Leadership

Continuous Learning Mindset
Critical Thinking & Problem Solving
Systems Thinking

Your key areas of responsibilities will include:

Synthesizing data using data visualizations and dashboards tailored to the audience/use
Work with a wide range of data/functions
Producing datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools
Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences
A keen focus on advanced analytics that deal with big data, data processing, and multiple data source

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in math, science or equivalent experience
At least 2-4 years working in a similar role 
Working knowledge in current data science and visualization technologies like Tableau, etc. 
Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, strategic planning and execution skills; verbal, written and visualization capabilities
Strong business acumen, including industry, domain-specific knowledge of the enterprise and its business units

Experience with the following is highly beneficial:

Data Reporting, Visualization & Dashboarding Tools
Data Cleansing, Data Curation, Data Harmonizing & Packaging
Data Privacy & Regulation
Descriptive & Diagnostic Analytics

Benefits
 Be great. Be you. Believe.
 We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.
 What happens next?
 Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.
 Stay in touch!
 ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

Title: Data Analyst, Financial Crime Risk
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Risk Analytics @ Neo 

 Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. 

 The Role 

 Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians. 


What you'll be doing:
 Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions Analyze risk profiles across the financial crimes vectors, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities Analyze key business metrics including true positive rates, false positive rates, portfolio fraud rates Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices 


Who we're looking for:
 1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management,fraud analytics, AML analytics considered an asset Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Supply Chain Management
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the maintenance of Supply Chain and Logistics Database infrastructure and delivering key improvements to the platform through expanding and automating data collection, streamlining reporting and information, and researching and implementing new BI solutions. 

 PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Experience or extensive knowledge and understanding of database development (SQL Server), ETL (SSIS), OLAP (SSAS).
Experience in reporting tools
Advanced Excel

Prior experience in Data Science and AI/ML an asset

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Blue Water Group. “Customer Driven. Solution Focused”. Blue Water Group has kept the wheels of the industry turning for over 40 years. As leaders in Warehousing & Logistics, Shipping supplies, Heavy-duty Lubricants, when you need to move, we make sure you can. At Blue Water Group we are committed and dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where our team feels comfortable to come to work everyday and most importantly enter the work environment knowing that they belong .
Are you someone looking for opportunities within a growing company and have a “Can-do” Attitude with a willingness to adjust in a changing environment? If you believe you’re a strong team player with a willingness to help those around you. Then this position might be for you!
Summary
Blue Water Group (BWG) is seeking an experienced and dedicated Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our team at 6474 Roper Road . The SCDA is a data-oriented role responsible for analyzing business-related Supply Chain data across BWG’ Canada-wide warehousing facilities. This position requires pulling, compiling, and analyzing a wide variety of information spanning multiple systems, requiring excellent communication skills, teamwork, and the ability to organize and prioritize meetings and deadlines. The position is 70/30 split between office and warehouse environment, responsible for the day-to-day management of information by pulling and compiling data, investigating outliers, and communicating findings to internal sites and external customers.
Duties and responsibilities

Maintain and create Daily, Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly reports.
Ensure data integrity by understanding and comparing customer requirements and operational deliverables/capacity.
On floor observation and interaction with warehousing teams to understand day-to-day processes to analyze data output from a variety of operational needs.
Measure, communicate and support operations leadership teams, and customer facing initiatives to evaluate current practices and better meet prescribed productivity and service levels.
Development and enforcement of KPI’s and advising/monitoring of corrective actions.
Identify positive and challenging trends and communicate to both operational focal points and senior management.
Plan and compile both internal and external presentations internal to BWG and external to our clients.
Oversee and communicate deadlines with cross-functional stakeholders
Recommend Strategies to develop new processes and procedures to drive continuous improvement.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Post-secondary education preferred.
Previous Supply Chain experience. (or related industry)
Exemplary willingness to work with others, take ownership and drive improvement in our growing Business Intelligence department.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrate process evaluation and improvement experience.
Exceptional time management skills and an ability to work within strict deadlines.
Advanced problem solving and analytical skills.
Excellent client facing communication skills, and customer service focus.
Strong IT Skillset with the ability to analyze large, complex data sets using a variety of software and tools. (Microsoft PowerBI or equivalent is an asset)
Demonstrated ability to take complex topics and large data sets and simplify for varying audiences.
Pay strict attention to details.

To learn more about Blue Water Group please visit our website; http://bluewatergroup.ca/

Title: Analyste de Données confirmé/ Senior Data Analyst
Senior Fire Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 36592

 Company
Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.


Vancouver Fire Rescue Services (VFRS) is an equal opportunity employer who is looking for a highly motivated individual to join our family of Fire Fighters, Fire Prevention Officers, Public Education Professionals, Chief Officers and Administrative Staff. VFRS prides itself on being one of the most progressive fire departments in North America while at the same time maintaining a strong sense of tradition. Vancouver Fire Rescue Services invites qualified candidates to apply for the position of Senior Fire Data Analyst.


 Main Purpose and Function


The Senior Fire Data Analyst is responsible for data modeling and data integration work related to the design and delivery of analytic data visualizations for VFRS consumption. The position will be responsible for designing, configuring and implementing analytic solutions to support the strategic direction for the Department. Using a variety of tools and technologies, the role works as part of the Organizational Performance and Business Operations team, and is responsible for: (a) design and creation of consumable data for analytic purposes, (b) rapid development of data models to address a number of wide ranging analytic challenges, (c) design and build-out of an analytic ecosystem architecture that supports both central data application creation as well as enabling self-service advanced business analytics and (d) supporting the design and adoption of data governance and data management. Technologies in use or may be used in the future include: Qlik, PowerBI, Excel, FDM, SMS, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP AOLAP, SQL Server and SQL DataWarehouse, and ESRI/GIS. The position interfaces with key business leaders from VFRS as well as the City’s Corporate Leadership team. The work performed will enable VFRS to leverage performance metrics to support strategic, operation and financial decisions as well as support service transformation by driving accountability, improving transparency and increasing value for money.


Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships


The position reports to the Assistant Chief of Analytics & Decision Support. The position calibrates tools to translate raw data into valuable business insights and provides insights and recommendations to senior staff using strong logical reasoning skills and business intelligence to drive high performance and quality.


Specific Duties/Responsibilities



Understand business needs and objectives and provide evidence-based support to develop business cases for resourcing needs such as staffing levels.
Lead and support the development of strategies for effective data analysis and reporting to support departmental strategic direction.
Develop, monitor and analyze performance metrics, financial data and benchmarks to establish the cost efficiency and effectiveness of services.
Provide data analysis and financial decision support which could include financial modelling, business analysis, and business case development
Create a standard department wide methodology for benchmarking performance and efficiency
Configure and support the implementation of qualitative and quantitative analytics solutions to further departmental goals and strategic plans.
Design and create consumable data analytics, including departmental metrics, using BI tools. 
Identify and correct data discrepancies and build a data quality assurance model.
Extract data and reports from multiple sources (e.g. Operations, Training, and Prevention) and maximize the utilization of the Departmental BI tool.
Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights and reportable goals.
Apply industry knowledge to interpret data and improve performance.
Keep abreast of industry news and trends and apply to data systems to provide relevant metrics.
Provide analysis supporting the short term and long term departmental direction including providing supporting metrics for the same.
Design and document performance measurement framework.
Present findings with departmental leaders and other stakeholders. 
Develop and maintain user training and documentation.
Perform other duties as assigned.


 
Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management or related field or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 
Preferred Masters of Business Analytics (MBAN), or Professional accounting designation (CPA), or Masters of Business Administration (MBA) 
Minimum of 6-8 years of experience supporting business information systems, business intelligence or reporting systems, and two (2) years project management experience.
Experience in supporting and developing strategies to support major corporate decisions and identifying performance measures to inform strategic decisions.
Business intelligence experience, familiarity with data management, BI tools, data mining, designing reports and dashboards to facilitate evidence based effective decision making.
Extensive experience in strategically answering complex business problems through data analysis, scenario modeling and creative thinking.
Initiating business process improvements, supporting strategic decisions and change initiatives for a large organization.
Significant experience in supporting and facilitating complex multi-stakeholder initiatives and engagements

Title: Senior PSI Funding and Data Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 29073
Ministry: Advanced Education
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: July 12, 2022
Classification: Program Services 4




 About Us


 The Government of Alberta is committed to a diverse and inclusive public service that reflects the population we serve to best meet the needs of Albertans. Consider joining a team where diversity, inclusion and innovation are valued and supported.


Education and growth are integral to our Province’s future and building an even better and stronger Alberta. Alberta Advanced Education is focused on accessible, affordable, and quality advance learning opportunities for all Albertans. Through funding, scholarships, apprenticeship programs, and research, we help Albertan’s maximize their potential and explore the many ways to learn, grow, and educate Alberta.


The PSI Funding & Analytics unit, as part of the PSI Funding & Capital Planning Branch, performs a wide variety of tasks, with the majority of the work related to a few main functions:

Leveraging internally and externally available financial data sources to create an understanding of how Alberta post-secondary institutions compare to one another and to the rest of the country.
Supporting funding decisions by ensuring they are based on evidence and Alberta’s unique post-secondary education system.
Updates and monitors financial policies relating to post-secondary institution activities under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Advanced Education.





Role


 Are you a mastermind in financial analytics, accountability, and integrated thinking? Are you known to think outside of the box and come up with innovative and efficient ways to analyze problems while having everyone smiling? Read on, this opportunity may be for YOU!


The Senior PSI Funding & Data Analyst plays a leading role in understanding how post-secondary institutions finances relate to funding, program objectives, and other provinces. You will use your creative problem solving and ability to integrate information to create ways to analyze data from a variety of sources to provide a deep financial understanding of the financial operations of Alberta’s post-secondary system. Your curiosity, analytical mindset, accounting expertise, and systems thinking will enable you to integrate information effectively to inform funding decisions, policy direction, and communicate to colleagues across the Ministry.


You will have strong communication and collaboration skills which allow you to form solid relationships with colleagues across the Ministry as well as our partners at the post-secondary institutions. These relationships will help you to act as a bridge between the Ministry and the post-secondary when it comes to financial analytics, accountability and financial data matters.


Key Responsibilities:

You will perform a variety of analysis using large and diverse data sets and create information products for senior executive to answer a variety of questions.
You will clearly communicate policies and guidelines relating to financial matters to others in the Ministry.
You will provide advice, analysis and guidance on institutional borrowings and dispositions to senior leadership team.
You will leverage the Ministry’s repository of information sources to analyze and evaluate financial operations of post-secondary institutions.
You will assist the department in the development of funding model options using evidence and criteria unique to Alberta’s funding practices.


 
Key Relationships:
Your work will require you to engage, collaborate with staff across the ministry at all levels. You will liaise with



Program areas to understand information needs and their datasets that can be leveraged to increase the Ministry’s understanding of institutions in a meaningful way.
Corporate Finance, Governance Services, Legal and Legislative Services, Policy, other ministries, Statistics Canada, and relevant communities of practice.





Role Cont...


 What do you need to get there?

Data validation, statistical analysis, and quantitative and qualitative research methods.
Demonstrating strong analytical skills and sound judgment to manage high-profile functions involving sensitive information.
Planning for and delivering results, from concrete deliverables to process improvements, managing resources effectively, and ensuring attention to detail.
Using analytical tools such as Microsoft Cubes and having expert level knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Accounting principles and best practices including Public Sector Accounting Standards.
Ministry and post-secondary financial reporting systems and related information management systems.
Asking the right questions to deepen the understanding of issues so that innovative responses can be developed.
Demonstrating flexibility, adapting to changing conditions while staying focused on positive culture and long-term outcomes.


 
This is a highly integrative role, working to ensure accountability activities across the ministry are mutually supportive and that they balance program area perspectives with broader department policy goals and government direction. To be successful in this role, you will need well-developed analytical, reasoning, evaluation, judgment, project management, problem solving, mentorship, and leadership skills. The ability to collaborate with staff and a broad range of clients is essential to successfully influence processes and decisions. When it comes to competencies, your strengths will need to lie in Systems Thinking, Creative Problem Solving, Drive for Results, and Develop Networks.


To demonstrate your strength in these required competencies, clearly provide examples of how you have exhibited each of them in the past in your cover letter.




 Qualifications


 Requirements:

A University Degree in a relevant field and a minimum of 4 years’ related experience. Related experience or education may be considered as an equivalency on a one-for-one basis.


 
Assets:

Experience in data analytics, financial analysis, and data modelling
Highly advanced excel skills
Analytical tool experience
Experience related to Alberta’s adult learning system
Experience with public sector accounting standards
Possess or are pursuing an accounting designation





APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in-depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.


This link will assist you with understanding competencies:


Critical Competencies:

Agility – Demonstrated ability to manage and adapt to change. Ability to manage human, financial and physical resources within an operating environment.
Drive for Results – Leadership skills, including demonstrated ability and comfort with decision making responsibilities, coaching and teaching, and the ability to inspire and build confidence in others.
Develop Self and Others – Proven ability to foster partnerships and to achieve organizational goals within an organization.
Build Collaborative Environments – Strong track record in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Develop Networks – Ability to foster a climate of cooperation amongst, and build solid relationships with public agencies, government, committees and other partners.
Systems Thinking – Effective leadership abilities combined with a strong commitment to operating within a team environment and the ability to motivate and inspire other to achieve common goals.
Creative Problem Solving – Excellent analytical and decision-making skills.





Salary


 $2,683.10 to $3,507.06 bi-weekly. ($70,028 - $91,534 per year)




 Notes


 There is one permanent position available located in Edmonton. This position is 36.25 hours per week, 8:15 am – 4:30 pm Monday- Friday.


Applicants are advised to provide a cover letter summarizing information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta, at equal or lower classification and salary.


What we offer:

Pension plan:

Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance
Opportunity to participate in flexible work arrangements such as working from home up to two days per week and modified work schedule agreements

Title: Reporting Data Analyst (Power BI) - InsightLens
Description:
Company Overview
 INSIGHTLENS delivers software and services to Financial Institutions which have hundreds or thousands of locations. For our customers, the retail footprint is a critical part of their customer’s total branded experience.
 Financial institutions use INSIGHTLENS to improve the speed, accuracy, and cost effectiveness of brand-related initiatives throughout their branch network. Using tailored software and data analytics, INSIGHTLENS significantly increases the speed of fixture rollouts, reduces the cost of renovation programs, and increases the accuracy of marketing distributions.
 To find out more, please visit us at www.InsightLens.com
 Summary of Position
 The Reporting Analyst is responsible for utilizing various data applications, programming and visualization tools to provide insightful analysis and reports for Envision customers and stakeholders.
 The Reporting Analyst is also expected to coordinate various programs with vendors and customers, accumulate related data and update the corresponding sections in the database.
 Role & Responsibilities

Project coordination activities with vendors related to delivering the outputs and collecting data needed for the database update
Investigate and scope requirements for scheduled and ad hoc analytical and reporting needs
Develop and maintain Excel and Power BI reports and dashboards
Perform data analysis to identify data integrity issues/trends
Ensure that automated data imports/exports contain appropriate data and run in a timely manner
Maintain documentation for reporting and data integrity standards and related policies
Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skill

Qualifications & Skills Required

Experience with Power BI (Power Query/DAX)
Familiarity with data management, data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts, including data modeling and transformations.
Strong Microsoft Excel background
English language working capability (written and verbal).
Strong technical documentation skills
Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs
Excel-based test as a part of the hiring process
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
Ability to communicate effectively with technical peers as well as business clients.

Nice to have:

Experience with Excel VBA
Experience with any ERP system, PostgreSQL

Education and Experience:

Completion of post-secondary in a relevant field
Minimum 2 years in a similar role with Data/reporting/analytics

Title: Senior Consumer Data Analyst
Description:
As a member of the Business Analytics Function, the Senior Consumer Data Analyst will help create value for Reckitt (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. The Senior Consumer Data Analyst will assist in our understanding of our target consumers across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Intimate Wellness, Health Relief and Personal Care.
The Senior Consumer Data Analyst will be responsible for consumer insights, business intelligence report development, predictive models, and to eventually build ML algorithms generated from our data lake. The Azure lake centralizes marketing data stored in our CDP, Google Analytics, consumer survey data and Shopify e-com transaction records and sales data. You will have access to structured and unstructured data with tools to analyze the data like R and Python and will be responsible for setting up priority analyses and models. Working with other analysts on the Business Analytics team, and Brand and Digital Demand Generation teams, you will generate hypotheses to explore about our consumers and develop models to help predict consumer behaviour to improve sales performance. You will be responsible for ad hoc statistical analysis. You support RB Nutrition and Health teams in interpreting results and contribute to action plans indicated by the analyses and models. You will also be involved in the democratization of our reports, assisting to build out reports in Power BI.
You continually search for improvements in analytic technics, with a goal of being agile and improving research turn-around rates. You leverage new technologies and platforms and are keen to discover ways to gain insight from data.




 Competencies and Skills Required



The successful candidate will hold a university degree or equivalent in data analytics, social sciences, statistics, math, or computer science, with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills. Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques. Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning. 
Experience with statistical or technical programming languages (R, Python). Experience using SQL for collecting, organizing, and manipulating data. Model development and deployment.
Experience with Databricks, Spark and Azure.
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence software. Familiarity with Power BI.
Ability to challenge the status quo and encourage use of new information and consumer insights.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties, and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
Strong intellectual curiosity and independent judgement with the desire to understand the basis and drivers of consumer behaviour.
Builds a collaborative, positive cross functional team environment and strong working relationships with senior management, marketing, healthcare and retail sales teams, finance, and outside agencies.





Equality


 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law

Title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Risk Analytics @ Neo 

 Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. 

 The Role 

 Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians. 


What you'll be doing:
 Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions Analyze risk profiles across the credit lifecycle, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities Forecast key business metrics including vintage loss rates, approval rates, loan conversion rates, and credit quality for new initiatives and marketing campaigns Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices 


Who we're looking for:
 1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management considered an asset Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Description:

 Senior Data Analyst:

Previous work experience in the public sector or large organizations.

24 months

Title: Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team of data engineers, scientists, developers and analysts. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing and detecting trends, reducing risk and providing insights to partners in Advice Centre Leaders & Partners. You will be responsible for collaborating with product leads, data analysts and data scientists to design, launch and iterate on user-centric data insights use cases.

 What will you do?

 Design solutions which deliver data based insights to relevant stakeholders, simplify user experience and address user pain points
 Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor trends and risk markers using statistics, metrics and models
 Regularly conduct analytics to identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships with Advice Centre data
 Collaborate with data engineers to source and understand new and existing data feeds data
 Regularly test and improve solutions as well as support investigation of data abnormalities
 Develop, manage and maintain analytical dashboards using Tableau software which provide rich and actionable insights to Advice Centre Leaders, partners and other stakeholders


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must have:

 2+ years’ experience in data analytics, SQL, data visualization (Tableau or similar), and Python
 First-hand experience working with popular Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and notebook environments
 Qualitative and quantitative experience, and solid experience with understanding users and informing those stories with data
 Strong understanding of data and statistics
 Experience with databases and data structures
 Professional oral and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate between technical and non-technical stakeholders


 Nice to have: 

Undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering or related field
 Knowledge or experience with detecting external or internal fraud
 Knowledge of Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, HDFS, Hive)
 Experience working on an Agile team


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 An opportunity to further develop people management skills
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best


 RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Title: Data Analyst (Excel Specialist) - Analyste de données (spécialiste d'Excel)
Description:
Responsibilities

Preparing the weekly sales report used to analyze sales and profitability channel, customer and product.
Maintaining and improving the BI system (Data Rails).
Preparing the weekly inventory analysis report.
Being the main point of contact for the implementation of the new inventory management software (Netstock).
Leading the construction of the yearly budget (Building templates for sales reps to input their budgets, consolidating and reflecting them in Data Rails).
Preparing weekly AR aging report (sent to the AR/HR Manager)
Becoming familiar with the ERP system as the analyst needs to be able to support finance, operations administrative areas of the company when needed with information and analysis that help understand how the business is performing.
Skills & Specifications Requirements


Background in Finance or Accounting
Knowledge of the AS400 IBM system
Advanced Excel skills. Knowledge of financial modeling would be ideal
Knowing how to work with large sets of data and being able to summarize it in concise reports and analysis that help upper management understand performance and facilitate decision making.
Bring forward suggestions to be able to find solutions for needs that arise across different areas of the company; (meaning making use of the tools at his/her disposal to produce reports and analysis that respond to those needs).
Being able to propose and implement new/creative solutions is required to do well.
Enjoying continuous learning.
Has initiative and is able to look for ways to improve current processes and implement new ones.
Being organized and having attention to details.
Qualifications


Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience in Finance and Accounting
Knowledge of the AS400 is a must.

Responsabilités 

Préparer le rapport de vente hebdomadaire utilisé pour analyser les ventes et la rentabilité des canaux, clients et produits.
Maintenir et améliorer le système de veille stratégique (Data Rails).
Préparer le rapport hebdomadaire d'analyse de l'inventaire.
Être le principal point de contact pour la mise en œuvre du nouveau logiciel de gestion des stocks (Netstock).
Diriger la construction du budget annuel (construire des modèles pour que les représentants des ventes puissent saisir leurs budgets, les consolider et les refléter dans Data Rails).
Préparer le rapport hebdomadaire de vieillissement des comptes clients (envoyé au responsable des comptes clients et des ressources humaines).
Se familiariser avec le système ERP car l'analyste doit être en mesure de soutenir les finances, les opérations administratives de l'entreprise lorsque cela est nécessaire, avec des informations et des analyses qui aident à comprendre la façon dont l'entreprise performe.

Compétences et spécifications requises 

Formation en finance ou en comptabilité.
Compétences avancées en excel. Une connaissance de la modélisation financière serait idéale.
Savoir travailler avec de grands ensembles de données et être capable de les résumer dans des rapports et analyses concis qui aident la haute direction à comprendre les performances et facilitent la prise de décision.
Apporter des suggestions pour être capable de trouver des solutions aux besoins qui se présentent dans différents domaines de l'entreprise; (ce qui signifie utiliser les outils à sa disposition pour produire des rapports et des analyses qui répondent à ces besoins).
Être capable de proposer et de mettre en œuvre des solutions nouvelles/créatives est nécessaire pour bien faire.
Aimer l'apprentissage continu.
Avoir de l'initiative et être capable de chercher des moyens d'améliorer les processus actuels et d'en mettre en œuvre de nouveaux.
Être organisé et avoir le souci du détail.

Qualifications

Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience dans le domaine des finances et de la comptabilité.
La connaissance de l'AS400 est indispensable.

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Hive Media redefines what it means to be a data-driven online publishing company. Our team focuses on creating and acquiring web properties, which allow us to build relationships with our readers, advertising partners and technology experts. We own and operate dozens of websites with highly verticalized content and use sophisticated technologies built in-house to deliver individualized experiences to our readers.  Hive Media Group is seeking a sharp, ambitious Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst must be investigative and analytical by nature. We need someone who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and passionate about large data sets. The ideal candidate should be seeking increased responsibility, will have a passion for data, and a solid understanding of the digital publishing landscape. This is a great opportunity for someone who is seeking rapid career growth in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.  The Ideal Candidate:


Independent, self-motivated individual that has a passion for solving puzzles.


Extremely detail-oriented and organized with a habit of checking and double-checking any work before submitting it for review.


Analytical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills who is able to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information quickly and accurately.


Team player with the ability to work across team functions to bring the best possible outcomes forward.



Responsibilities:


Identify, analyze, and interpret trends/patterns in complex data sets.


Produce reports for business leaders that are uniform, accurate, and consistent. Summarize key findings and propose action plans.


Tell a story with data. Advise business leaders on which directions to go, how to pivot and adapt to an ever changing environment.


Work cross functionally across Engineering, Product, Media, and Revenue teams to provide forecasting, data modeling, predictive analysis, and A/B testing insights and strategies.


Investigate root causes for issues/anomalies and provide creative yet logical solutions for solving data and/or business intelligence problems.


Research industry trends and identify new process improvement opportunities.



Requirements:


2+ years experience in data or business analytics, preferably in a digital publisher setting.


Expert Excel skills with the ability to work with large data sets.


Working knowledge of SQL and the ability to quickly learn internal tools


Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc.


Flexible, startup mindset, and ability to operate within a very dynamic, fast-paced work environment.


Strong communicator, both written & verbal with the ability to communicate results to both technical, and non technical stakeholders.


Eager to learn and grow to expand beyond the outlined responsibilities.


Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.


Preferred – understanding of the online advertising and publishing industry, campaign metrics, and media buying/selling.



Why Work for Hive Media?:


Competitive wages


Employer contribution towards Medical, Dental, and Vision premiums for all regular full-time employees and their dependents.


Employee Assistance Program (EAP)


Registered Retirement Saving Plan (RRSP) with company match for employees residing in Canada


Paid Time Off


We care about your career and foster a culture of learning. We provide dedicated time to improve your skills, lunch and learns, online courses, knowledge sharing between team members, and many more opportunities


A management team focused on performance, growth, engagement and connection


Company-sponsored events and fully hosted summer and winter parties.




During the COVID-19 pandemic, this role will temporarily require the use of telework. Hive Media Group may require employees to return to regular, in-office work by state and local public health guidelines. Some "perks" will not be available during telework arrangements.


Hive Media Group LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, Product Analytics 

 WHO WE ARE 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. That includes creating an equitable, inclusive, and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 A DAY IN THE LIFE 

 The Data Analyst is an exceptional analytical thinker who is passionate about identifying product assortment insights and sales trends using analytics. This individual will be responsible for ensuring accuracy of product data, monitoring product performance and guest feedback, building analytical models to isolate driving factors, and communicating findings to business partners to inform product strategy. Working in teams of diverse skillsets and backgrounds, the Data Analyst works on projects tackling the most difficult problems facing our Product functions. 

 QUALIFICATIONS 



Bachelor’s degree in a rigorous quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, economics, physics, etc.
2-3 years of work experience in data analytics, preferably in the retail or apparel industries
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, including demonstrated creativity in problem solving
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Strong proficiency with data modeling in MS Excel and MS Power Query
Experienced with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Base proficiency in SQL, database management, and database structures
Base experience with systems integrations and the software development lifecycle

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Department of Education and Early Childhood Development
Description:
Data Analyst Department of Education and Early Childhood Development Permanent Open Fredericton / Remote
 Who we are: The work we do has a positive impact on our communities and helps improve the everyday lives of New Brunswickers. Together, we are over 45,000 New Brunswickers who are passionate problem-solvers, who make a difference and are proud to call New Brunswick home.
 The Department of Education and Early Childhood Development (EECD) is dedicated to fulfilling New Brunswick's educational mission. The work we do aims to develop engaged and ethical citizens who lead balanced lives and have a desire to learn throughout their lives. Our actions in this regard have a positive impact on our communities and help to improve the everyday lives of New Brunswickers.
 The employees of EECD develop programs and offer services that support parents and educators and encourage learners from birth to 20 years old, to achieve lasting and transferable learning that will serve them throughout their lives.
 What you will do: 
As a member of the Assessment, Analysis and Design Services branch, the successful candidate will be responsible to ensure:

 Data received by the branch is ready to use for analysis, reporting, and sharing; Ensuring that it conforms to the established standards for each data set, is appropriately labelled, and standard conversions are applied.
 Data holdings of the branch are appropriately managed by developing data standards/dictionaries (in collaboration with the Statistician, Director, and Data Specialist), developing, documenting, and adhering to file naming and storing conventions, and complying with data security and privacy legislation requirements.
 Data collection mechanisms are effective for the purpose for which data is to be used and efficient for those from whom data is collected.
 Annual data reports and ad hoc requests for data, analysis, and reports are complete, accurate, informative, aesthetically pleasing, and provided on time. This includes finding innovative approaches to communicating and sharing the results of analyses.
 Ongoing liaison with internal clients, school district personnel, vendors and other organizations.

 The major responsibilities of the position are:

 Basic data analysis using SPSS and Excel
 Researching, selecting, and using the most appropriate technology to conduct surveys and other data collection
 Merging datasets and migrating existing data
 Designing databases for longitudinal analyses under direction of the Psychometrician
 Producing graphs, writing reports, and creating presentations
 Summarizing PISA (Programme for International Student Assessment), PCAP (Pan-Canadian Assessment Program), and other reports
 Collating data from sources such as Statistics Canada and the New Brunswick Health Council
 Conducting jurisdictional scans to gather background information on various topics

 Work environment:

 Office location: 250 King Street, Fredericton
 Office layout: cubicles
 Remote work within New Brunswick is a possibility
 Standard hours of work: Monday - Friday, 8:15-4:30
 We promote a scent-reduced environment

 Who you are: You possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, the ability to problem-solve creatively and to think on your feet. You have a respect for safety, you treat people in a polite and professional manner being courteous and always showing kindness. You are concerned for the wellbeing of New Brunswickers. You are excited by the application of data analyses to real-world contexts and enjoy formulating and testing hypotheses.
 Your attitude, skills and interests are just as important as your area of study. We are looking for diverse backgrounds that bring a combination of the following:
 Need to have:

 University degree or Diploma in statistics, mathematics, psychology, sociology or a related field
 A minimum of three (3) years of experience manipulating and summarizing datasets, with proficiency in IBM SPSS and Excel, and basic knowledge of statistics and quantitative research methodology
 An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered

 Written and spoken competence in English is required. Please state your language capability.
 Nice to have: 

Experience working with Microsoft SharePoint and Office 365
 Power BI

 Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration. Please ensure that preferred language for assessment is identified on your resume.
 Behavioral Competencies:

 Results Orientation
 Effective Interactive Communication
 Analytical Thinking and Judgment
 Concern for Order

 Technical Competencies:

 Knowledge of Research Methodologies, Principles and Practices
 Specialized Subject Matter Expertise and Knowledge
 Written Communication

 Wage: Pay Band 3 - $48,178 - $67,366 annually.
 What can GNB offer you? 

Comprehensive benefits package and the Public Service Shared Risk Pension Plan
 Opportunities for career growth, professional development and training
 Free access to Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) and services
 1 paid Volunteer Day per year to give back to your community
 1.25 days/month of paid vacation

 Providing a safe workplace for all. Your health & safety are important to us. GNB has implemented preventative measures across the organization to ensure your health & Safety.
 How to apply: We encourage applicants to apply online at www.ere.gnb.ca, by mail at the following address, or by email at HR.Competitions@gnb.ca by July 25, 2022, indicating competition number 22-2000-019. This competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same level.
 Department of Education and Early Childhood Development Human Resource Services Place 2000, 250 King Street Fredericton, N.B. E3B 5H1 Telephone: 1-506-444-4909
 We thank all those who apply, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
 Equal Opportunity Employer We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities in which we live and serve. We encourage and support applications from Aboriginals, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. Candidates registered with the Equal Employment Opportunity Program and veterans, who are among the most qualified, will be given preference at the time of selection.
 Check out what it is like to work at the Government of New Brunswick, where we are working together as One Team One GNB to improve the lives of New Brunswickers every day!
 Let's connect. You belong here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
The Transportation and Logistics division of J.D. Irving, Ltd. is comprised of a dynamic group of unique and successful businesses in the marine, railway and trucking sectors (www.jdirving.com). We are a recognized leader in freight movement and logistics services. We offer a fast-paced and progressive work environment, with exposure to a wide range of operational initiatives and a focus on the future with our new Digital Strategy. Our businesses are diverse and exciting, and our quality products and services meet and often exceed our customer expectations because we believe in continuous improvement and innovation. We are growing our businesses, transforming our operations, maximizing our results, and energizing our employees through investment and progressive technology that is making a difference. We value people and teamwork, and we seek and develop the very best talent to ensure that WE DELIVER!
Our division is currently seeking a Data Analyst located in our Saint John, N.B head office.
Qualifications:


 • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics, Business/Commerce or a related discipline. Graduate degree considered an asset.
  

2-5 years of related work experience in the development of predictive/prescriptive models, design of algorithmic solutions, use of predictive tools, and relational databases.
Experience working with Tableau or other data visualization and analytics tools like: Minitab, SPSS, Alteryx, or Power BI.
Proven track record of innovation, ingenuity, attention to detail, ownership and willingness to seek and take on challenges.
Excellent communication skills to enable complex data driven insights to non-technical audiences. Strong data visualization techniques and presentation skills.



Key Responsibilities:


 • Responsible for full data analysis projects, including extracting data from various sources including SQL databases, preparing the data (data cleaning and the union/joining of various data sources), data integrity check (including the detection of outliers), feature engineering, modeling of the data, and finally visualizing and presenting insights
  

Develop and implement descriptive, predictive & prescriptive models
Coach and mentor other analysts
Partner with leaders from our various businesses to provide insights to potential business problems
Explore and characterize data available to business units/teams
Interpret larger organizational needs and design algorithmic solutions that will drive intended business outputs
Serve as a data and /or analytic resource for initiative-based teams

Title: Operations Volume and Data Analyst - Junior Role
Description:
Operations Volume and Data Analyst – Junior Role 
Lynx Energy is a private, intermediate gas production company with a key focus on gas‐weighted assets in Alberta. 
Lynx Energy is an operator of choice, with production from our 6,000+ wells exceeding 19,000 BOE per day. 
Lynx Energy has an excellent opportunity for a Junior Operations Volume and Data Analyst. Reporting to the Senior
Operations Advisor, the successful candidate will be focused on the gathering and in‐depth analysis of production data and preparing related reports. The position will be based in our Corporate Office in Calgary, Alberta with a hybrid in‐office/work‐from‐home model.
Lynx Energy offers a value‐enriched culture with emphasizes on a healthy work‐life balance, focus on learning and development, innovation, and having fun at work. Align with a culture where people and integrity matter!
Key Responsibilities: 

Accurately manage information within the Field Data Capture System, including master data management, data quality and volumetric reporting
Analyze operations data (ie Swab data) using statistical techniques and provide timely reporting
Assist in the development of cross system reporting to support field operations and production engineers
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems, databases, and related

Power Bi Reporting

Work with management to help prioritize operations data and information needs as well as identifying and defining related process improvement opportunities
Support/backup the set‐up of master data in various operations systems i.e. (Cygnet, FMS and

Flowcal, Clairifi, OpLynx)

Support/backup the weekly/monthly flow of volume estimates to the marketing group

Essential Experience, Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: 

Diploma, technical certificate, or degree in a related field would be an asset
Must have Advanced Excel and intermediate proficiency in the other of Microsoft Office Suite, ideally including Teams and Sharepoint
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Excellent communicator, comfortable engaging with people at all levels of the organization
Experience with Scada Systems preferred
Experience with other FDC Systems (ie Opworx, PVR, Field View) is an asset
Experience with Business Intelligence tools/capabilities
Experience working with geographically dispersed field teams

Attributes: 

Extremely high attention to detail; maximum precision and accuracy are critical to success in this role 
Highly driven to succeed and exceed expectations
Open to Mentorship from a team of smart, fun people
Resourceful, flexible, and adaptable
Enjoy working independently and in a team while disciplined in meeting deadlines

We appreciate and thank all applicants for your interest in Lynx Energy. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Calgary, AB T2P 4H4: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, EDAC Inc., is looking for an experienced individual to join their team!
Number of Positions: 1
Schedule Hours: 9 AM – 5 PM
Work Environment: Hybrid, 2 days in office
Reports to: Director of Business Development
ROLE SUMMARY: 
EDAC Inc. is looking for a Data Analyst to join the business development department. is responsible for providing data analytics and market data analysis. This role serves to support EDAC Inc’s sales operations.
Data Analytics

Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligent questions.


Create and maintain the data integrity of the master database.


Development and implementation of employee portal to access complete product information.


Coordinating and analyze data scrapping reports for competitive benchmarking and distribution compliance to MSRPs.


Propose and recommend market analysis data to improve market competitiveness.


Monitoring and evaluating sales performance utilizing POS data.


Provide innovative analytical insights within the Data Products Program – POS, ERP system, CRM tool and Power Bi.


Responsible for Internal ERP system (MS NAV), sales reporting, and analytical tools/application.


Facilitate and coordinate between Engineering and Marketing (SEO) teams to ensure product content data is aligned.

Market Data Analysis

Exploring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends.


Providing actionable insights to guide the sales and marketing teams.


Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams.

Sales Operations

Identify gaps internally, prepare alternate solutions to improve workflow efficiency, provide training for staff based on changes made.


Integrate Business Analysis skills within the organization's processes and procedures.


Ensure standard operational procedures are implemented and followed.


Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new features.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: 
Education: Community College Diploma in computer engineering, or a related Data Analytics field. University degree in the same disciplines preferred but not required.
A. Experience: 3-5 years of business experience in an operational environment
B. Excellent Computer skills in Office applications and data visualization tools
C. Good verbal and written communication skills
D. Advanced knowledge of MS Power BI, Excel, DBMS and SQL
E. Experienced presentation skills
F. Excellent planning and organizational skills
G. Project Management experience
H. Technical aptitude and experience in building Power BI’s and integrating multiple datasets
Experience in analyzing data to isolate trends and other pertinent information to draw attention to Senior Management
EDAC Inc. is committed to equity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We value new perspectives and non-traditional experience, particularly from those who identify as part of an under-represented community. EDAC Inc. will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.
