Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hi Potential Co-Worker,

 My name is Adam. I'm the Engineering Manager at GrantMe.
 We are building the leading education planning platform for a future full of options. GrantMe is securing students' futures and when students and families feel they have options, the future looks brighter.

 Education and careers are changing and the marketplace has been crying out for an innovative partner to help navigate the change. Our education platform is a student’s expert guide that removes uncertainty and creates options.

 We are one of Canada’s fastest-growing startups and we have assembled a team of high-performers who are striving to be world-class in everything we do. We are intentional about creating a brand and culture that is consistent all the way through from company leadership to our students. So GrantMe is a place where people come to do great work and be surrounded by others who develop themselves and want to push themselves. If you want to accelerate your career by 5 years, then GrantMe is the place to do it.

 We work with a sense of urgency and we like to do great work fast. Being student-centred is the soul of everything we do, we act with integrity because we do what we say and by when, and we strive for perfection in our work through constant kaizen (continuous improvement). If you’re the type of person who enjoys getting so passionate about our customers that you dream about them, then GrantMe is for you.

 At GrantMe, we see a future full of options for students and you. Class is now in session!

 The role:

This is a full-time role as a Data Analyst in our Vancouver, BC office.
You will work side by side with stakeholders in all departments to streamline processes and build reports.
Implement processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Work with other members of engineering to build out new API integrations to support continuing increases in data volume and complexity.
You will have the opportunity to have a hands on role in architecting all things data for one of the fastest growing startups in Canada.
You will translate business needs into technical requirements and provide solutions to complex business problems.
Collaborate on building the data roadmap and own its progress.
Have the opportunity to collaborate on future data science projects in the pipeline.



 We’re looking for people who:

Have 1-3 years of experience in a Data Analyst / Data Engineer role.
Have strong knowledge of SQL and are comfortable with at least one programming language such as Python.
Experience in data modeling, ETL / reverse ETL processes, and data warehousing.
Experience with business intelligence tools like Holistics, Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar.
Experience with API's and creating integrations between tools.
Exhibit sound judgement, keen eye for details and tenacity for solving difficult problems.
Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical details into easy to understand concepts for our stakeholders.
Excitement for working with team; collaboration, asking questions and receiving/providing direct feedback are all things you love.
Are egoless - entitled to nothing and willing to earn everything.
Passionate about helping students get into their top choice schools and graduate debt-free.
Are driven, self-motivated, and have a fantastic work ethic.
Are results-oriented: will run through a wall to get stuff done.
Are masters of efficiency, are highly organized, and love using technology to get things done quickly.



 We offer:

Brand new Macbook Air.
Competitive compensation package.
Health, Dental, and Vision benefit plan.
Career growth: skip five years of your career in one year at GrantMe.
Work out of our Vancouver office in Mount Pleasant with an energetic team of professionals who are top in their field.



 Bonus points if you:

Been part of a startup or are an entrepreneur.
Have applied for university, applied for (or even won) scholarships, and have an understanding of some of the challenges involved in the process.



 Sound like fun? Then go ahead and submit your application. We’d love to hear from you!
 Join us as we continue to grow. Class dismissed!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BIMM is booming, so we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team!
 WHO WE ARE
 For over 30 years, we’ve crafted flawless data driven creative solutions for some of the biggest brands in Canada and across the globe. Everything we do is guided by a simple philosophy: marketing with greater certainty. We love creating amazing integrated brand experiences for our clients that deliver real business results.  We all act as one unit and believe in “having every BIMMER’s back”. Nice people only. Egos need not apply.  WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 We’re looking for an energetic person with superior analytical abilities, great attention to detail and strong communication skills to join our growing team as a Data Analyst.
 This role reports to the Director of Analytics and involves frequent interaction with all levels of management, clients, and outside suppliers. The ideal candidate will display the perfect balance of analytic capabilities, confidence, and business acumen.
 RESPONSABILITIES

 Be the subject matter expert for all things digital on a clients’ business
 Be the point of contact internally for all inquiries relating to a clients’ properties
 Make recommendations and help implement process improvements with the ultimate goals of driving client results
 Provide technical expertise on the development, analysis and interpretation of marketing data and reports
 Develop new data visualizations that help lay people understand the insights in the data
 Develop new tagging strategies to meet client needs
 Be the first person that notices when something is unusual with the clients’ digital properties
 Analyze ‘offline’ data in isolation or in conjunction with data obtained from digital sources

 QUALIFICATIONS

 Exceptional analytical, critical thinking and organizational skills, including the ability to quantify and analyze customer data
 Outstanding oral and written communication skills; particularly in the area of presenting complex technical concepts to colleagues and clients
 Able to manage your workload across a number of tasks and projects to help the team execute campaigns flawlessly in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
 Ability to manage a large number of concurrent tasks and projects
 A team player with strong interpersonal skills, a bias for action and strong customer service orientation
 Flexible and able to work in an environment where “change” is prevalent
 Self-starter, with the ability to manage and drive projects with limited supervision

 REQUIREMENTS
 Must Have

 University degree in business, finance, economics, statistics/math or computer science 
1 - 2 years working experience as a Data Analyst, or similar
 Deep experience with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics (both is preferred) 
Must have experience in building tagging solutions with Google Tag Manager
 Strong, fundamental understanding of web analytics principles
 Experience in data visualization platforms like Google Data Studio and Power BI 
Advanced MS Office capabilities, most importantly MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
 Experience with tracking on mobile platforms: Adobe Mobile Services or Google Firebase (both preferred)

 Nice to have

 Experience in the configuration of analytics
 Frontend (HTML, JS, CSS) development experience
 Google Optimize
 Google certifications
 Tableau
 SQL, R or general programming experience


 BIMM is committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are met.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? Are you a big fan of simplification and automation? Manulife is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our team as we work to accelerate growth and become a digital customer leader. 

This role sits within Manulife’s Canada Segment Central Marketing Organization. The team provide a wide range of data services for a variety of business units across the segment which provides a unique opportunity to work broadly and collaborate with cross functional business stake holders. This team also collaborate closely with other data and analytics teams to develop and deliver data driven marketing solutions that are relevant, personalized and engaging for our customers. 

What do we do: 

Specialization in campaign management and reporting targeting our Manulife customers 
Drive technology enablement projects and improve capabilities through Marketing Automation 
Transform experiences through data, processes, and insights to drive business value and delight our stakeholders and customers 


Key Accountabilities: 

Campaign management & reporting and maturing capabilities 

Campaign data management end to end; data exploration, opportunity sizing, translating business requirements into technical requirements, data provisioning to build leads data, testing/QA, supporting execution, developing post campaign analysis & reporting, summarizing and visualizing the data in dashboards for senior management and product owner 
Mature campaign management and reporting capabilities - design, upgrade and implement new data workflows, automations, tools and API integrations. Integrate our technology with Salesforce, MDM, Enterprise Data Lake and more to mature our capabilities. Automate routine activities that are manual. Proactively identify and integrate new data sources, new analytics capabilities / competencies & technologies. 
Leverage marketing and analytical experience to deliver proactive and insightful program/campaign analytics and actionable insights. Complete deep dive of results identifying insights for maximizing the campaign potential. 
Suggest product or process enhancement to increase campaign conversion and channel penetration 
Analyze intermediary and customer data from multiple lines of business to prepare and effectively present recommendations on marketing strategy 
Support ongoing build/enhancement of leads database to continuously improve all analytics, reporting and campaign management. Work with the product owner to build out new data models and support implementation. 
Participate in agile ceremonies and promote agile principles and methodologies 
Support ad-hoc data requests 


Leadership/Collaboration 

Consult, collaborate, and recommend solutions to our stakeholders 
Collaborate with other data teams like Advanced Analytics, Canadian Data Office, Email & Marketing Automation Team, Core Engineering, Salesforce, Digital Analytics 
Support the expansion of our services to more stakeholders and be involved in the opportunity to evolve into cloud capabilities, evolve your own capabilities, and keep an eye on developments that can support our expansion 
Act as the team representative at stakeholder meetings bringing actional insights and providing updates on campaign deliverables 
Collaborate with analytics teams across Manulife and track key trends to enrich the team’s ability to provide enhanced insights and improvements in marketing performance 
Support marketing automation projects, collaborating with multiple data teams and Marketing Managers 
Support project planning by building workback schedules and outline key milestones dates 


Building and assuring the proper data quality and governance processes 

Build data governance, audit, security, and data quality practices in compliance with Manulife standards and policies and aligning to the Canadian Data Office 
Mitigate data, compliance, and privacy risks 
Monitor and track campaign programs and ensure that any problems arising are highlighted to management with proposed solutions - escalate and fix issues related to data 
Create, design and update documentation to help support data understanding and management 
Leverage tools to enhance code management & control practices 


Qualifications: 

Bachelor's Degree in a technical (computer science, engineering, math, etc.) and/or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise 
5+ years of relevant experience with focus on business and/or marketing analytics, including data management/programming experience. Experience in financial services an asset. 
Employing exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems 
Python, SQL, SSIS, Github, PowerBI, Advanced Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint experience. Hive/Spark/Jenkins an asset. 
Exposure to Microsoft Azure (or other cloud) platforms is preferred. Data Warehouse knowledge/experience 
Proficient in data wrangling, data cleansing, ETL/ELT, exploratory data analysis, data visualization 
Significant experience with data provisioning (gathering, storing, and retrieval methods) working with various data sources 
Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills while working in a face-paced environment with changing priorities 
Strong communication skills, able to present effectively to senior leaders in various sized groups 
Strong verbal & written communication skills who can clearly articulate/interpret business needs to translate into technical requirements 
Practical experience with Agile tools & methods such as Confluence, JIRA, Scrum/Kanban preferred 
Ability to foster positive relationships 
Demonstrated ability to communicate methodology, insights and recommendations with non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization 
Strong ability to document and monitor processes 
Experience in setting up data pipelines, processing data with complex analytics and ensuring data integrity 
Understanding of relational and dimensional database design and knowledge of logical and physical data models is preferred 
Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders 
The successful candidate will be innovative, inquisitive, resilient, results oriented and motivated to provide actionable insights, reporting and strategy 
Lives by our values: Obsess about customers, do the right thing, think big, own it, get it done together and share your humanity 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Assist in the design and development of customized operational and management reports including Dashboards and Scorecards using various programming languages and BI Tools. Assist management with briefing and presentation materials on a regular or ad hoc basis. Provide technical support on CBIA produced BI/data products as well as assist in the extraction, transfer and load processes of data using multi-platform programs. Execute on data requests from internal and external clients, and assist other Analysts in the preparation and deliver of Branch information products and services. Conduct various business analytic functions including documenting business requirements, participating in various branch projects and initiatives including the co-ordination and tracking of project deliverables.Major Duties & Responsibilities1. Refresh and maintain ad hoc and regular reports and data extractions on claims and cost utilization, employer and worker profiling, in response to data requests from internal business areas and external clients. . This includes executing routine data requests by writing/editing programs/queries from multiple data sources, updating data sets, validating data, and assisting with data analysis.2. Build queries and/or write programs to extract and compile data using software tools and programing languages such as: Power BI, DAX, M, SAS, R, SQL, Python and Cognos, to merge, analyze, and transform data from various sources in order to conduct business and statistical analysis.3. Assist in the development and production of ad hoc and regular BI products on claims and cost utilization, employer and worker profiling, in response to requests from internal business areas. This includes consulting with business analysts to select the most appropriate data source, writing and/or documenting programs/queries from multiple data sources, and assisting in the building and enhancing reports; providing basic explanations of data findings, analysis and statistical methodologies and measurements.4. Document data and report requirements including source-to-target mapping to ensure data integrity and quality. This includes consolidating and documenting meta data for business values; gathering and documenting business rules and definitions for data attributes in WSIB Enterprise data sources. Ensure data and information are valid and reasonable before releasing to the business.5. In collaboration with analysts and the business, document business and technical requirements and participate in technical and business testing of data sources and BI and analytics products.6. Ensure data quality and integrity of BI and analytics products by matching or comparing data to appropriate data sources, validating accuracy, identifying, analyzing and assisting in the investigation root causes to data issues or problems.7. Assist in the maintenance and improvement of internal processes including the creation of process maps, user guides, as well as identify and implement solutions to increase automation and increase efficiencies.8. Develop and maintain comprehensive end user documentation and reference materials/guides for BI and analytics products.9. Assist the Business Analysts with the compiling of data, ensuring data validity and accuracy in order to understand the overall performance of the business to support decision-making.10. Participate in key Branch projects, forums and working groups varying in scope and complexity including the writing of requirements, contributing to work plans and progress reports.11. Perform other related duties as assigned or required.Job RequirementsEducation

High school completion plus additional specialized courses or certificate program up to one year in business statistics, computer science, business/data analytics, data science, business decision support, big data.

Experience

Eight months prior experience in business analytics.

Title: Data Analyst - Rainbow Six Mobile
Description:
Job Description
  The data we collect is pivotal to our success: information such as player acquisition and retention is how we understand the performance of our projects while user feedback and market research allow us to connect to our fans and know how to keep them satisfied. As a Data Analyst at Ubisoft Montreal, you will help us better understand our dedicated fans and provide the knowledge needed to guide our production teams towards a better future for our games.
 Your work will transform data into actionable suggestions or solutions for the Rainbow 6 Mobile team and ensure we can stay up to date with player trends by organizing data into easy-to-understand dashboards or visualisations.

 What you’ll do

Elicit and collect analytical needs from stakeholders.
Find solutions to use data to answer business questions.
Create reports and dashboards.
Build analysis and communicate findings to decision makers.
Design and develop ETL flows to structure data.
Propose in-game telemetry for operational and analytical needs.
Identify new sources of information to collect to enrich analysis.
Profile data to evaluate and monitor quality.
Help construct test cases for testing team.
Participate in the resolution of incidents and problems.
Collaborate with partners of different expertises (Community Manager, Marketing, Monetization, Production, Technical Operations, User Researcher, etc.).




 Qualifications
  What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in Business Intelligence, Administration, Information Technology, Mathematics or any other relevant field of expertise
Experience in a similar position or any other relevant experience
Ability to adopt structured, strategic and rigorous thinking
Autonomy and entrepreneurship
Extensive knowledge of data analysis tools (Excel, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Expertise in reading and writing SQL Language
Solid knowledge of data modelling (Inmon & Kimball) as well as visualization concepts (Stephen Few)
Excellent communication skills/bilingualism (French-English, spoken and written)
Knowledge of the video game industry (a bonus)

 What to send our way

Your CV highlighting your education, experience, and skills

Title: Data Analyst – Subscription Analytics
Description:
Company Description
  Torstar Corporation is a broadly-based media company. Its businesses include the Toronto Star, Canada’s largest daily newspaper, six regional daily newspapers in Ontario including The Hamilton Spectator, and more than 70 weekly community newspapers in Ontario; flyer distribution services; and digital properties including thestar.com (with local editions in Toronto, Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Ottawa and Halifax), wheels.ca, toronto.com, save.ca, a number of regional online sites. Torstar also holds a majority interest in VerticalScope, a North American vertically-focused digital media company.
 The Toronto Star is Canada’s largest daily newspaper and is read in print and across desktop, mobile and tablet platforms by more than 6 million readers every week. Online, thestar.com is one of the most-visited newspaper websites in Canada.
 Our Commitment To Diversity We strive to be a leader in building and cultivating an employee community framed around fairness, support and opportunity. We believe that what makes us different, makes a difference. And as a team, the diversity of our backgrounds, interests and experiences is what enriches our work, and our workplaces. We welcome all, and we strive for an inclusive culture that allows individual growth and shared success.



 Job Description
  Your key goal is to support the Digital and Marketing teams through insights and analysis, focused on the 360 view of a customer. Responsible for delivering exceptional data products that lead to subscription growth and optimal customer experiences. You possess a hybrid skillset of strong analytical depth coupled with business acumen and can leverage your skills to deliver accurate reporting, scorecards, analysis and recommendations to various business units. You will help drive a data-first culture across the organization. This position reports to the Director, Data Science.
 Responsibilities

 Build and maintain key operational KPI executive dashboards, scorecards, and reports
 Conduct various digital subscription, newsroom, and digital advertising analytics
 Leverage the data gathered to better understand how customers find content, where they consume it, how to further optimize that experience, and drive them down the subscription funnel
 Work closely with cross functional teams such as the data engineering team and business teams to ensure that data required by stakeholders is collected and reported effectively in order to help drive successful business outcomes
 Understand each stakeholders’ products, KPIs, goals and challenges to bring data informed recommendations and analysis for testing offers, segmentations and marketing experiments
 Prepare and present presentations to senior leaders in a non-technical way, have a high attention to detail in double checking data for accuracy, and produce detailed documentation




 Qualifications
 

 Basic knowledge of web analytics and analytics setup/configuration and experience with Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Analytics, Parse.ly, etc.
 Advanced experience in creating visualizations through tools such as Tableau, Cognos, Power BI , and/or Mode Analytics
 Technical Skills - experience with SQL, Excel, Python, R, relational databases, data warehouses
 Experience with data-management systems, working with large data-sets and creating reporting surrounding the data
 Knowledge of advanced analytics tools such as Data Robot, Rapid Miner, etc. preferred
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to relay technical concepts to non-technical audiences and explain analytics with context.
 Excellent attention to detail and ability to organize and prioritize
 Highly motivated independent worker

 Additional Information
  AODA Torstar is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

Title: Database Administrator and Data Analyst
Description:
About KEV

 KEV Group is an enterprise SaaS company providing online payment and accounting software to simplify student activity fund management in schools. KEV’s easy-to-use web-based software automates the collection, disbursement, and management of student funds, thereby reducing the time it takes to receive and account for all school activity fees and increasing the time teachers can spend on education. The company is based in Toronto, with offices in the US. KEV is a portfolio company of Serent Capital, a leading middle market private equity firm focused on high growth technology businesses.

 Why Join KEV?

 Work in an industry that benefits children, parents, and schools
 Do meaningful and purpose-driven work, and make a real impact
 Join a growing organization with real opportunity for learning and growth
 Passionate and accessible leadership team that cares about people, personally and professionally
 Flexible work environment


 About the Role
 As the database administrator and data analyst you’ll be responsible for performance monitoring and tuning of our production databases, working with developers to optimizes stored procedures and general database access, perform data analysis, and create standard analytics datasets utilized by business intelligence software.
 The role requires a technically skilled individual that is capable of holding positions of great responsibility. In this role, you'll be the first respondent to database problems that arise and carry out periodic maintenance and troubleshooting.
 To ensure success as a database administrator, you should be an excellent problem-solver and communicator that is fluent in most data manipulation languages. Ultimately, a top-notch database administrator should have extensive knowledge of the databases under their administration and display sound technical skills and administrative aptitude.

 Responsibilities

 Performance Tuning using Execution Plan, SQL Server Profiler and Database Engine Tuning Advisor to optimize queries and enhance the performance of databases 
T-SQL scripting for data manipulation and building Ad-hoc reports 
Re-writing SQL legacy code to improve the performance of the application
 Database migrations to the newer versions
 Investigating issues in production and fixing root causes as and when needed
 Performing adhoc data pulls for analysis
 Creating and automating standard analytics datasets via ETLs to be utilized by PowerBI
 Assisting our customer support & Implementation teams when required

 Requirements

 7+ years experience working with Microsoft SQL Server
 In-depth technical knowledge of database and transaction management technologies 
Experienced with data manipulation languages, data definition languages, physical database design, and application performance analysis & tuning
 Experience in providing support in troubleshooting SQL Server performance-related issues.
 Expert knowledge to analyze performance issues, identify tuning opportunities, implement improvements and advise developers on SQL Server
 Experience automating routine DBA tasks using scripts or adhoc reports


 Nice-to-have experience

 Azure DevOps
 PowerShell


 We Offer

 We are a remote-first organization, with Canadian offices in Toronto and Cambridge, Ontario, and a US office in Wilmington, North Carolina.
 Competitive salary
 Comprehensive health and dental benefits
 Professional development opportunities
 Continuing Education
 Great colleagues and collaboration


 This job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required by the incumbent. Incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as required.

 KEV Group is pleased to accommodate individual needs in accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), within our recruitment process. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please speak with Human Resources or the hiring manager.

 KEV Group is an equal opportunity employer who agrees not to discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.

Title: Business Performance Data Analyst
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.
            





            The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. 
          










           As a Business Performance Data Analyst, you will undertake various financial and operational analyses used by the Workplace Solutions division in making business decisions with a focus on continuous improvement. You will also be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the data used to formulate reports. Primary duties include:
          



             Support the maintenance and refinement of a system that manages employee location & work style, space classification & ownership, service requests and associated metric & exception reporting.
             


             Consult with clients and Workplace Solutions staff to understand data needs and develop tailored reporting solutions to understand workplace data.
             


             Conduct financial and operational analysis, as well as business process analysis, and the interpretation of space-related data.
             


             Research, consolidate, report and make recommendations for best practices.
             


             Input information and maintain a variety of databases containing business-critical information.
             


             Act as the subject matter expert for all databases within Facility Management.
             


             Provide quality control by ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data used for business decisions.
             










Qualifications
 





           A completed 1 year certificate in information technology, business, data analytics or related field and at least 5 years of experience in applicable Data Analytics, Information Technology, workplace management or related field, OR
           


           A completed 2 year diploma in information technology, business, data analytics and at least 3 years of experience in applicable Data Analytics, Information Technology, workplace management or related field.
           


           Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Access, and PowerPoint) is considered to be an asset.
           


           Intermediate proficiency in Archibus, Smart Client, Adobe Suite, People Soft, IWMS (Integrated Workplace Management System) or similar software is considered to be an asset.
           


           You can effectively communicate with technical and general audiences, build productive working relationships with diverse groups, and have the ability to make sound business decisions.
           


           Strong analytical skills along with the ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing priorities.
           


Pre-employment Requirements 





            Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
            


















                 Union: CUPE Local 38
                



                 Business Unit: Facility Management
                







                 Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 6 months)
                



                 Location: 800 Macleod Trail S.E.
                







                 Compensation: Pay Grade 8 $33.79 - 45.19 per hour
                



                 Days of Work: This position works a 5 day
                

                 work week with 1 day off in a 3 week cycle.
                







                 Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week
                







                 Audience: Internal/External
                



                 Apply By: July 26, 2022
                








                 Job ID #: 305967

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Jane is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst who will be responsible for delivering consistent, meaningful insights across the team. You will have strong experience with Looker and preferably experience in a fast-growing software company. You are excited about the opportunity to be responsible for analytics across multiple subject areas and looking forward to the prospect of mentoring junior analysts.
   




   Our small, collaborative team is responsible for delivering actionable insights across the entirety of Jane, so you are interested in championing a data informed culture across all areas of the business, from marketing to product and everything in between. You are passionate about transparency, accuracy, creating delightful experiences with data, and digging deep in to the "why." 
   We want every team at Jane to have the ability to make decisions inspired by data and you will have the opportunity to help make this happen from the ground up.
   




   Like with all positions at Jane, this position is a remote position, allowing you to work anywhere you want across Canada. Building a delighted team who can delight our customers is part of Jane’s DNA, so even though we’re not a strict 9 to 5 environment, we’re working hard to ensure that you also have a life outside of work. We pride ourselves on flexibility & autonomy, and when it comes to decision making, we take a decentralized approach ensuring that our teams' voices aren't just heard, but are acted upon. We're building something special at Jane, and we back that up with an employee stock option plan that ensures that everyone has a chance to share in Jane’s success.
  


 We really want the people who work at Jane to love being here, so it's important that we start off with a bit about what makes our company unique. Here are some specifics about what Jane is all about, and with these, hopefully, you have a better idea if this might be the kind of company you want to be part of.
  


 We’re a North Vancouver-born SaaS company with a distributed remote team across Canada, and our platform is modernizing the world of practice management software. We enable the likes of physiotherapists, mental health counsellors, chiropractors, and other allied health practitioners to run their practices in a digital-first way through features such as online booking, charting, scheduling, secure video, and billing along with an evolving library of features.
  


 Tens of thousands of healthcare practices globally are now running on Jane. In 2021, we processed over 73 million patient appointments, and our scheduling application alone handles more than 10 million API calls per day. Jane is now the number one choice for Allied Healthcare practitioners in Canada. We’re growing quicker in the US than we were here in Canada 3 years ago, and we’re now helping run clinics in 44 countries.
  


 We’re profitable, product-led, and growing organically to the point where 85% of our customer growth is either from customer referrals or word of mouth. Growth like this is unique, especially in the world of SaaS, and it doesn’t happen by chance. We have a brilliant team of over 250 employees who all do an amazing job of listening to our customers, building what they need, and providing industry-leading support.
  


 Last year alone we’ve grown our development team from 36 to 70, and the product team has doubled as a whole. 2022 is going to be a big year for Jane as we’re investing heavily into patient experience with our first patient-facing mobile app, enhancing our telehealth experience, building our own (J)analytics platform, working on global insurance integrations, and introducing new features like HIPAA compliant chat.
  


 Of course, it's not all about the numbers, but this puts into perspective the scale of Jane, from the thousands of practitioners whose lives are made easier each day to the millions of patients receiving treatment. If you’re the type of person excited by this growth, we’d love to speak with you.
  



What you’ll be doing…


 Own several areas of analysis including product and customer lifecycle while working directly with product managers, dev managers and senior leadership to encourage a data-informed culture
 Helping our team build out our new Looker instance, including supporting with documentation, onboarding, training and best practices
 Creating and improving existing metrics, models, dimensions and documentation through collaboration with the team and stakeholders across multiple subject areas
 Championing data-informed decision making, building trust with stakeholders across Jane, and developing policies to uphold our standards
 Testing hypotheses that drive product roadmap decisions by designing purpose-built experiments and performing statistical analysis
 Own analysis from concept to implementation, managing backlog and prioritization of incoming and existing work
 Proactively seek feedback and opportunities to improve our processes, engage stakeholders






To be successful in this role...


 Experience as a data analyst in a high-growth environment
 Familiarity with common SaaS metrics and experience defining, implementing and measuring them
 Experience with Looker development and as a Looker admin
 Desire to mentor other analysts and continue to flex and grow that muscle
 Excellent communication skills and empathy
 The ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical audiences
 Experience running a/b tests
 Proficient in excel, SQL, LookML, and possibly another programming language like Python or R
 Familiarity with ETL (extract, transform, load) concepts and tools
 An extremely detail-oriented mindset and commitment to accuracy






Bonus points


 Experience building out a new BI platform from the ground up
 Experience or an interest in administering Snowflake or Redshift databases






Benefits


 Extended healthcare from day one.
 Parental top-up.
 Participation in Jane’s employee stock option plan (JSOP).
 Investment in your career development & growth.
 $500 annual health spending account.
 Generous vacation policy along with your birthday off!
 Three annual Jane-cation days: additional days off.






   At Jane, we’re committed to fostering an environment that allows you to come to work as your truest self. We believe it’s important to actively recognize, embrace, and celebrate our differences in order to make Jane an inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplace.
   




   We want to build a team of people who make conversations rich with perspective and experience. We are committed to listening to every voice in order to learn and grow because doing this will allow us to meet the needs of the diverse community of helpers that Jane serves.
   




   We do not tolerate discrimination, prejudice, or oppressive isms of any kind. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, experience, and the needs of the Jane community. We encourage anyone who requires accommodation or adjustments throughout the interview process to let us know, and we will do our best to support you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MED Office of Research






       Competition No. -
      

S104648235





       Posting Date -
      

Jul 13, 2022





       Closing Date -
      

Jul 27, 2022







       Position Type -
      

Part Time - Grant Funded





       Salary Range -
      

$18,651 to $25,181 (pro-rated) per year





       Grade -
      

07





       Hours -
      

14










This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).
 This position has a term length of one year plus a day and offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits.
 Location - North campus
 Working for the University of Alberta

 The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.
 The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.
 Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.
 Department summary
 The Office of Research (OoR) in the Dean’s Office of the Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry (FoMD) is under the direction of the Vice-Deans of Research. The OoR provides services and support to a wide range of stakeholders including department chairs/divisional directors, FoMD institutes, faculty members, managers, support staff, trainees, and the public. The OoR supports one of the largest research communities on campus with more than 750 faculty members, 1,900 associated clinical faculty, 600 graduate students, 100 postdoctoral fellows, and 200 undergraduate researchers. FoMD occupies space in multiple buildings on campus and in external hospitals and institutes.
 Position summary
 The Office of Research is seeking a new team member to join our fast-paced, dynamic team focused on supporting the research community in FoMD.
 Reporting to the Research Analyst and working collaboratively with the members of the FoMD Research Analytics Working Group, the Data Analyst supports analytical work that furthers FoMD’s research priorities and enables data-driven decision making.
 The Data Analyst will conduct research and analysis on identified issues and contribute to report writing and generation of visualizations and interactive dashboards. Project work will be used to inform research policies and strategic plans. The Data Analyst must have a strong understanding of data analytics, creative thinking skills, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
 Duties
 TECHNICAL ACTIVITIES:

Collects, curates, and provides preliminary analyses of FoMD research data from internal and external sources. Cleans and structures data according to end-use specifications.
Assists the Research Analyst in identifying sources of data to fulfill analysis requirements including the design of surveys to collect additional data, where needed.
Updates monthly faculty-wide grant submission records in PeopleSoft.
Supports the Research Analyst in the development of reports, visualizations and dashboards for FoMD Senior Leadership and other internal research stakeholders.
Researches and implements analytical methodologies to improve data gathering and analysis through automation.
Develops an internal database to store FoMD-specific research data for integration with existing datasets. Updates data and develops SOPs to ensure ongoing database maintenance.
Reduce inefficiencies in analytics process from extraction to end analysis.

 OTHER ACTIVITIES:

Redact grant applications of identifying information for inclusion in the FoMD Grant Repository.
Develops materials (e.g. website, infographic and video) to communicate the value of maintaining bibliometric data and utilizing unique digital identifiers (i.e. ORCID iD)
Liaises with Faculty members including but not limited to providing assistance in obtaining an ORCID iD and cleaning their online bibliometric profiles.

Qualifications

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in health research or other related field with experience in research and analysis
Knowledge of statistical research and analytic methods and a demonstrated ability to apply them and adapt to new techniques as they evolve.
Ability to independently use relevant computer application programs for data access/extraction, analysis and reporting and learn new ones as they evolve.
Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, in particular, the ability to present complex results in an easy to understand manner.
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Superior ability to communicate with colleagues, faculty and other support staff in a technical or non-technical style.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively.
Excellent organizational and project planning skills.
Knowledge and experience with bibliometric analysis and extraction tools is an asset.
Experience with business intelligence visualization tools such as Tableau is an asset.
Computer programming experience and knowledge of various programming languages (e.g., Python) is an asset.
Working knowledge of University data systems is an asset.



How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, MÃ©tis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The University of Manitoba is a driving force of innovation, discovery and advancement. Our momentum is propelled by our campus community – UM faculty, staff and students whose determination and curiosity shape our world for the better. Our teaching, learning and work environment is uniquely strengthened and enriched by Indigenous perspectives. With two main campuses in Winnipeg, satellite campuses throughout Manitoba, and world-wide research, UM’s impact is global.
Discover outstanding employee benefits, experience world-class facilities and join a dynamic community that values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. We are one of Manitoba’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. At the University of Manitoba, what inspires you can change everything.
The opportunity: 
The Data Analyst designs, develops, tests, and implements computer programs written in SAS for complex research investigations looking at the determinants of health and health care of populations using administrative health, social, and education data. It is the responsibility of the incumbent to correctly interpret goals and objectives set out by project teams and then develop the appropriate computing and statistical solutions. They provide guidance on the structure and content of databases and the optimal statistical approach to investigate research objectives. In addition, they aid in writing technical documentation as well as sections of manuscripts for peer-reviewed journals.
The qualifications and experience we’re looking for: 
· Master's degree in a directly related study area (such as statistics, community health sciences, social sciences or quantitative analytic methods) is required.
· Three years of directly related work experience in large database analysis, longitudinal data analysis is required.
· Detailed knowledge of SAS is required.
· Detailed knowledge of epidemiology and statistical methodology for health research is essential.
· Working knowledge of coding systems used in health research such as ICD-9-CM, ICD-10-CA, CCI, ATC, is required.
· Familiarity with other statistical analysis packages such as R, STATA, SPSS is an asset.
· Advanced knowledge of statistical methodology such as survival analysis, multinomial logistic regression, Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE) and structural equation modelling (SEM) is preferred.
· A background working with Statistics Canada data, such as census data, as well as administrative health data, such as CIHI's Discharge Abstract Database (DAD), is beneficial.
· An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
· Demonstrated skills involving data linkage, data manipulation (SET/MERGE, use of pointers, RETAIN), use of procedures for statistical analysis (GENMOD, GLM, LOGISTIC) are required.
· Must be proficient in in MS Windows, MS Office (specifically Excel and Word).
· Effective communication skills in English, both oral and written, are required.
· Ability to work within tight timelines is required.
· Confidentiality of the information must be maintained.
· Conscientious attention to detail is required.
· Ability and willingness to learn new techniques is essential.
· Must be able to work in a team environment as well as independently. Keyboarding skills are necessary as this is a computer programming position.
· Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory punctuality and attendance, is required.
Why the University of Manitoba?
Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:

Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
Competitive vacation time.
Employee and Family Assistance Program.
A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.

Apply today through the University of Manitoba’s recruitment site, UM Careers: https://viprecprod.ad.umanitoba.ca/DEFAULT.ASPX?REQ_ID=22128
Closing Date: July 24, 2022
Applications will only be accepted if you apply on UM Careers.
The University of Manitoba is committed to the principles of equity, diversity & inclusion and to promoting opportunities in hiring, promotion and tenure (where applicable) for systemically marginalized groups who have been excluded from full participation at the University and the larger community including Indigenous Peoples, women, racialized persons, persons with disabilities and those who identify as 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two Spirit, lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, questioning, intersex, asexual and other diverse sexual identities).
If you require accommodation supports during the recruitment process, please contact 204-474-7195. Please note this contact information is for accommodation reasons only.
Application materials, including letters of reference, will be handled in accordance with the protection of privacy provisions of The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (Manitoba). Please note that curriculum vitae will be provided to participating members of the search process.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $57,566.60-$83,064.80 per year
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-07-24Expected start date: 2022-08-22

Title: Transportation Data Analyst
Description:
Transportation Data Analyst
Georef Systems Ltd. is a Waterloo-based tech company that provides school bus route planning software solutions to the K-12 industry across North America. We believe strongly that innovation is the key to efficiency and our passion for creating intuitive solutions has made our BusPlanner Suite the market leader here in Canada. We continue to listen to our clients and produce software that is what they want, what they need, and easy enough to actually use. Our commitment to customer service sets us apart as we provide personal, dedicated service to each of our valued clients.
We are looking for a confident, dynamic and engaging professional to enhance our growing team. As a Transportation Data Analyst, you will be a valuable member of a highly cross-functional team using your data management, planning, and communication skills to provide high-quality GIS transportation management solutions, consulting services and training to our new and long-term clients in a collaborative atmosphere.
:: WHAT YOU WILL DO ::

Provide consultative, client-focused technical and process support to our clients
Implement new transportation databases for clients who have recently adopted our BusPlanner transportation management software
Maintain and manage the operational environments of our cloud-hosted clients
Maintain documentation for products and internal processes
Assist with the preparation of software demonstrations including the creation of sample databases, etc.
Engage actively in continuous process and technology improvement efforts

:: WHAT YOU SHOULD EXPECT ::

A level of autonomy to exercise your technical and organizational skills to achieve team goals
The opportunity to be involved in the development of geomatics-based planning databases
A fast-paced work environment where multi-tasking and attention to detail are critical
Working with sensitive and protected information that requires an added level of care
The feeling of satisfaction that comes from making a difference in the professional lives of our clients
Working variable shifts, both in the office and potentially from home, to cover our Help Desk hours of 7am to 7pm
A starting salary ranging from $52,000 - $60,000, plus benefits and bonuses

:: THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE :: 

Geomatics, Geography/GIS, Planning, Business, or Communications degree, diploma or equivalent professional work experience
Strong analytical ability and problem-solving skills, particularly in a technical environment
Strong aptitude in the use of computer software and data management
Solid written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Experience with customer service is an asset
Bilingual (English/French or English/Spanish in particular) is a strong asset and will be given preference


An understanding of transportation management concepts, experience with transportation software, and/or a working knowledge of SQL is an asset
Valid G driver’s license

Applicants who match this description are encouraged to apply online with a resume with a cover letter, in PDF format, at www.busplanner.com. Our offer of employment will be conditional on the provision of a clear criminal records check.
For more information about us, visit www.busplanner.com.

Bonus pay

data analytics: 2 years (required)

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Data Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 382351
 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.

 The Business Intelligence/Business Performance Optimization team resides within Bell Business Markets and is responsible for developing, maintaining and using data to drive insights on customer experience and optimization of our back office. The team consists of data analysts for analyzing data, capacity planning management for sourcing and maintaining data, programmers for building dashboards and data scientists for building machine learning models.

 Our team partners closely with other business intelligence teams within the company and supports primarily our operational teams with impactful insights that help us continue to transform the business. In addition, the team has an active role in the change management process within Bell Business Markets, often including: automation initiatives, self serve tool development, and process engineering. We are looking for a soon-to-be or recent university graduate with an aptitude to create business impacts using data-driven approach. As part of this team you will have the opportunity to implement the latest practices in analytics, data visualization and machine learning to enable Bell Business Market team members to have faster and more insightful access to the drivers of their operations.
 
How the program works: You will have the opportunity to work on projects and improve your skills in presenting to upper management, data analytics, capacity planning management, data engineering and machine learning.
 
Key responsibilities may include: 

Identify areas for ML/AI opportunities and demonstrate to internal clients how ML/AI can

 improve their business

 Highly analytical with an understanding of the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets 
Ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations 
Demonstrated initiative, leadership and a passion for learning new skills 
Strong work ethic and persistence in the face of challenges and opportunities 
Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn quickly, with an ability to manage multiple projects and priorities 
Work with partners within Customer Operations and across Bell to make data-driven

 business decisions

 Critical Qualifications / Competencies: 

Undergraduate or masters degree in Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Operations Research, Physics or Mathematics 
Experience with Machine Learning algorithms, including strong knowledge of the mathematical underpinnings behind various methods: regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, dimensionality reduction 
Manipulating large & complex datasets Statistical software and data-mining tools and methods; such as SAS, SPSS, MatLab/Scilab, R, CART or other statistical packages 
At least one general programming language such as Python (preferable), Java or C/C++ Experience with query development using SQL Experience with data visualization tools and time series 
Presentation skills are an asset 
Experience in reporting and data visualization tools such as Microsoft Reporting Services, Microstrategy, Tableau and Python Dash is an asset 
Experience in large data sets and machine learning techniques is an asset 

#EmployeeReferralProgram

 Adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Title: Business Data Analyst
