Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job ID #343355
 Senior Data Analyst 
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Data Analyst. 
Senior Data Analyst – Job Description 

The main function of the Data Analyst is to provide business intelligence support and supporting areas by means of both repeatable and ad hoc reporting delivery reports (charts, graphs, tables, etc.) that enable informed business decisions 
Working with the internal teams on the remediation activities for ingestion of historical data 
Helping with coordination of data format, data mapping and data conversion from source to target 
Analyzes performance of process activities, identifies problem areas, and presents findings in clear, concise charts, graphs, tables, or summaries 
Establishes standardized methods of recording, tracking and reporting on activity 
Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to coordinate changes 

Senior Data Analyst – Mandatory Skills 

5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst 
Demonstrated knowledge of one or more key information service standards such as SDLC, ITIL, QA/testing, Project Management, Six Sigma, etc. 
Strong PC skills including knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint 
Experience working with Data query utilities and technology 
Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills to be able to work well with technical peers and business stakeholders at different levels within the organization 
Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions 
Ability to work as part of a team, as well as work independently or with minimal direction 
Good time management and organizational skills to effectively manage high scale project 
Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required 

Senior Data Analyst - Nice to Have Skills 

Prior experience with data conversion projects 

Senior Data Analyst - Assignment Start Date 
ASAP – 3 months to start 
Senior Data Analyst - Assignment Location 
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT MASTERCARD FOUNDATION 
Mastercard Foundation seeks a world where everyone has the opportunity to learn and prosper. Through its Young Africa Works strategy and Canadian EleV program, the Foundation works with partners to ensure that millions of young people, especially young women, access quality education, financial services, and dignified work. Mastercard Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. The Foundation is independent with its own Board of Directors and CEO.
 THE WORK AT THE FOUNDATION 
The Foundation has begun working within Canada in partnership with Indigenous communities and post-secondary institutions to listen, learn, and best understand how we can act in meaningful ways. The EleV strategy was co-created with Indigenous communities, young people, and partners to enable 30,000 Indigenous youth to complete their education and transition to dignified work aligned with their values and aspirations.
 As reflected in Canada's Truth and Reconciliation Commission Calls to Action, education is a key driver of improved socio-economic well-being. Through building partnerships with Indigenous communities, we look to expand our initiative ultimately helping to support a generation of transformative Indigenous young leaders who will be change agents within their communities. We believe that by setting a bold target, we will encourage engagement across sectors and create momentum that will elevate the strengths and opportunities of Indigenous youth. In keeping with our approach, Indigenous communities and young people will be the drivers of this transformation. The program will promote innovations to address longer-term systemic change to achieve economic prosperity and social well-being within Indigenous communities.
 The EleV team oversees current and emerging partnerships related to Indigenous education. Consistent with our overall vision and Youth Africa Works strategy, we will share learnings and opportunities to connect across the work of the Foundation. While operating in distinct contexts, the centrality of youth voice and vision, affirmation of culture and identity, and priority to enhance community capacity for self-determination are common threads upon which our work is strengthened and reinforced.
 UNDERSTANDING AFRICA PROGRAMS AT THE FOUNDATION
 We have entered a very exciting time at the Foundation as we scale up our operations across Africa to realize our Young Africa Works strategy. Our role at the Mastercard Foundation is to be a catalyst. Our Young Africa Works strategy focuses on working with others to spur systemic change so young people have the opportunity to find work that is dignified and fulfilling.
 The Foundation has opened offices in Rwanda, Kenya, Ghana, Senegal, Ethiopia, Nigeria, and Uganda, building a broader leadership presence in Africa to develop specific strategies that support youth employment. Within a country, we work with governments, the private sector, educators, young people, and other funders to improve the quality of education and vocational training, prepare young people for the work force, expand access to financial services for entrepreneurs and small businesses, and connect job seekers to dignified and fulfilling work.
 We are ambitious and driven. Our values transcend and rise above everything else as our guide. We encourage you to bring your bold ideas, curiosity, and expertise to your work. We laugh at ourselves and with each other. We are a team. Our journey together makes our impact even more meaningful.
 If you are an experienced BI Data professional looking to increase your impact, read on!
 THE OPPORTUNITY 
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Operations Lead, the role will be responsible for executing reporting and data requests by pulling, structuring, analyzing, and organizing data outputs.
 WAYS YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE 

Conduct basic data analytics as necessary for reports and internal needs.
Collate, structure, and enable integration of multiple different types of data sets for analyses.
Provide ad hoc support for data analytics requests (e.g., aggregation, disaggregation, pivot tables).
Monitor and maintain data for quality, completeness, and structure for optimal utilization.
Maintain knowledge of what data the Foundation has and where / how it is stored.
Maintain knowledge of relevant external data sources that are most heavily utilized by the Foundation (e.g., where to go to retrieve, limitations and characteristics of the data, periodicity of updates, levels of quality, etc.).
Ensure adherence to data dictionary, definitions, and governance protocols.
Engage with counterparts in functional teams (e.g., Programs, Impact, Finance, IT, KM) to ensure on-going robust data quality control and intake.
Maintain data privacy standards and protocols.
Manage data equity issues necessary (e.g., addressing data biases, data ownership, collection methods.
Determine protocols and infrastructure necessary for data collection, validation, storage, structure, retrieval and utilization to help build out the function.
Assess business questions and develop prototypes of the front-end solutions to fit each business question & ensure efficient performance of the solution.
Create data transformation list for each of the visualization and work with the BI Back-End Developer to decide where to execute the said transformations (back-end or front-end) and develop the solution accordingly.
Advise on the ETL (Extraction, Transforming, Loading) data process required to reach user-defined objectives in visualizations.
Develop the visualizations using pre-aligned set of tools.
Automating data ingestion processes.
Enhance data sets by creating automated match rules.
Automating data pre-processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity.
Optimizing Big Data system performance for data pre-processing and Machine Learning algorithms running, including code optimization, Map/Reduce fine tuning, etc.
Analyse, plan and develop requirements and standards in reference to scheduled projects.
Establishes and implements project communication plans, providing status updates to affected staff and stakeholders.
Managing change requests from the users and managing the versioning / release schedule of the solution.
Monitoring the solution usage.
Engage with requestor(s) to refine understanding of the business needs underlying BI requests and tailor outputs to meet needs, iterating as necessary.
Champion the use of data and improve data literacy through education of Foundation staff.
Provide support to program team with external data collection activities from time to time if necessary.

WHO YOU ARE

Bachelor's degree in Data science, data analytics, social sciences is required.
Strong comfort with, and experience in, retrieving, structuring, analyzing, and visualizing data across most well-establish data analytics platforms (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, R, Advanced Excel).
Familiarity with complex data structures and tasks, procedures, processes to maintain.
Experience monitoring and maintaining data quality utilizing best practices.
Familiarity with most common modes of preparing and presenting data insights (e.g., PPT, Word, e-mail, SharePoint).
Experience driving adoption of BI tools.
Demonstrated full toolkit of data management and analytics (e.g., cleaning, structuring, validating, correlations, regressions, statistical analyses, advanced analytics).
Ability to work with complex data sets and understand how to transform and combine disparate data to enable effective analytics.
Ability to translate data insights and outputs into appropriate, consumable formats (e.g., PowerPoint, Word, e-mails, SharePoint, Prezi).
Ability to retrieve data from data warehouses using SQL queries.
Ability to business partner with requestors to clarify substance of requests; act with a "Service mindset," and strive to become a trusted partner''.
Understand use case methodologies, how data insights are utilized by different audience, nuances of how to prepare and present data outputs for different uses.
Ability to flexibly engage other analytics capabilities within the org (e.g., Impact) and outside the org (e.g., Impact Partner Organizations) to execute against co-owned deliverables.
Self-directed and requires minimal guidance to produce most on-going reporting, data analytics, and visualization outputs.
Resilience and flexibility to maintain productivity through shifting priorities, parameters, rapidly changing context, and across time zones and geographies.
Resilience and persistence to ask the right questions, clarify requests, and iterate as necessary to provide the right outputs.
Solid judgment on prioritizing requests and seeking guidance when appropriate.
Listening actively to understand needs and provide constructive/receive feedback.
Aptitude for and keen interest in learning new information design and communication technology.
Resilient, intrapreneurial and flexible mindset comfortable working in a dynamic and ambiguous environment.
Strong self-direction balanced with collaborative and creative approach.
Meticulous detail-orientation and track record of delivering timely results under pressure.
Service mindset for responsiveness to requests and striving towards becoming trusted business partners to drive common Foundation goals.
Exceptional communication skills to support a culture of change.
Professional maturity, cultural sensitivity, impeccable integrity in alignment to Foundation mission and values.
Demonstrate a commitment to Mastercard Foundation's values and vision.

Deadline for Applications is August 22, 2022.
 Mastercard Foundation (the "Foundation") values and respects your privacy. By submitting an application for this opportunity, you hereby agree to the Foundation's collection, use and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with its Privacy Policy (available at https://mastercardfdn.org/privacy/). Please note that the Foundation may share your personal information with third-party agencies that support the Foundation's recruitment activities, and such third-party agencies may contact you directly regarding this opportunity. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the Foundation's Privacy Officer at the address indicated in its Privacy Policy.
 The Mastercard Foundation values the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the organization and we are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. 
Completion of satisfactory business references and background checks are essential conditions of employment. 
For more information and to sign up for the Foundation's newsletter, please visit http://www.mastercardfdn.org/ Follow the Foundation on Twitter at @MastercardFdn
 NB: To avoid missing email communication about your application, please check your spam/junk folder and mark our emails as "not junk".

Title: Junior Research Scholar/Post-Graduate Research Scholar - Data Analyst
Description:
French translation follows below / La version française suit

 The Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada (APFC) is looking to hire a full-time Junior Research Scholar (JRS) or Post-Graduate Research Scholar (PGRS) with a specialty in data analysis to work on gathering, transforming, and preparing data on sub-national connections between Canada and the Asia-Pacific. This role will support the development of the Canada Asia Sustainability Tracker (CAST). CAST is an online, interactive platform for mapping and visualizing developments in the Asia Pacific with respect to specific nodes of Canadian engagement with the region.

 The data created through this role will further develop our understanding of the rich web of connections linking people and places in Canada and Asia. These connections may be cultural, economic, diplomatic, etc. Some examples of datasets we hope to augment or develop include:


 Foreign direct investment
Published academic research collaborations
Asian diaspora communities in Canada
Commodities trade and supply chains
Canada's educational diaspora
Canadian culture in Asia (sports, music, etc.)
Asian culture in Canada (food, music, language, etc.)
Student exchanges, study-abroad experiences, university partnerships
Canadian businesses with locations in Asia
Diplomatic missions and trade offices
Trans-pacific NGOs



 Many of the datasets we are considering come from one or more open or internal sources but will require considerable thought and effort regarding selection, validation, transformation, and formatting to be ready for integration with CAST. It's critical that the datasets being developed are maintainable and updatable, so a large part of the work will focus on setting up automated data transformation/validation pipelines within an appropriate software framework such as Node, Python, PHP, R, PostgreSQL, etc.
 Another key task for this role will be to maintain and extend our database of Canadian and Asian sub-national jurisdictions in collaboration with our regional specialists.

 The application deadline is Sunday, August 7 (at 11:59 p.m. PST). Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled; you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as you are ready.

 Eligibility

 Applicants must


 be eligible to work in Canada and be either a student or have graduated from a Canadian post-secondary institution with either a Ph.D. or master's degree within the past 24 months of the application deadline of Sunday, August 7, 2022 (at 11:59 p.m. PT).
and as part of our legal obligation under the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) and consistent with our Vaccination Policy, APF Canada requires all staff and future staff to be dual-vaccinated. Such vaccination requirement is subject to APF Canada's duty to accommodate under applicable human rights legislation.



 Skills & Experience

 Applicants should be able to demonstrate


 experience working with complex datasets using modern programming languages, data tools, and methods
ability to write clear, concise code and share examples, e.g. through a GitHub profile or similar.
detail-oriented approach to data management



 Other skills and experience that will be considered beneficial:


 Experience with JavaScript /web development
Knowledge and experience of the Asia Pacific, including languages
Experience working with GIS and open geospatial data (e.g. OpenStreetMap, Wikidata)



 Location & Start Date

 We offer a friendly and flexible work environment from our offices based in Toronto and Vancouver. We are working both in the office and remotely on a hybrid schedule, and the JRS/PGRS will ideally be available for regular in-office collaboration in either city. However strong applications from elsewhere in Canada may be considered.
 The start date is flexible, though we hope to fill the position quickly, with a grant agreement initially lasting one year. There is a possibility to extend the grant agreement until March 31, 2024.

 Major Responsibilities


 Audit existing datasets for accuracy/validity/completeness and make updates as necessary
Collect and format new datasets in close collaboration with topic or region specialists
Automate data update/validation workflows in consultation with the CAST development team
Work with the APFC research team to identify potential topics/areas for new datasets
Provide support to various ongoing research initiatives as needed
Assist with other duties as assigned in support of APFC



 Term & Compensation

 This one-year grant agreement offers a research stipend of $3,300 to $4,000 monthly, based on qualifications. The stipend will be paid in regular installments throughout the year and will be reported on a T4A (i.e. is not subject to tax withholding).

 Application Procedures

 Applications should include the following documents as ONE MERGED PDF file. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Please click here to apply.


 One-page cover letter detailing your career interests, fit with the job requirements, and why you are interested in working with APF Canada
Résumé detailing your academic background, skills, and/or professional experiences relevant to the job description



 The application deadline is Sunday, August 7, (at 11:59 p.m. PST). Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled; you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as you are ready.

 For questions, please get in touch with Dr. Nate Wessel at nate.wessel@asiapacific.ca

 La Fondation Asie Pacifique du Canada (FAP Canada) est à la recherche d’un chercheur de cycle supérieur à temps plein, spécialisé en analyse de données, pour travailler à la collecte, la transformation et la préparation de données sur les liens infranationaux entre le Canada et l’Asie-Pacifique. Ce rôle permettra de soutenir le déploiement du Suivi de la durabilité Canada-Asie (CAST). CAST est une plateforme interactive en ligne servant à cartographier et à visualiser les développements en Asie Pacifique particulièrement marqués par une implication canadienne.

 Les données créées dans le cadre de ce rôle nous permettront de mieux comprendre le réseau dense de liens entre les personnes et les lieux au Canada et en Asie. Ces liens peuvent être culturels, économiques, diplomatiques, etc. Voici quelques exemples d’ensembles de données que nous espérons enrichir ou étoffer :


 Investissement étranger direct
Collaborations de recherche universitaire publiées
Communautés de la diaspora asiatique au Canada
Commerce des matières premières et chaînes d’approvisionnement
Diaspora éducative du Canada
Culture canadienne en Asie (sports, musique, etc.).
Culture asiatique au Canada (nourriture, musique, langue, etc.).
Échanges d’étudiants, expériences d’études à l’étranger, partenariats universitaires
Entreprises canadiennes implantées en Asie
Missions diplomatiques et bureaux commerciaux
ONG transpacifiques



 Bon nombre des ensembles de données que nous examinons proviennent d’une ou de plusieurs sources ouvertes ou internes, mais nécessiteront une réflexion et des efforts considérables en matière de sélection, de validation, de transformation et de formatage afin d’être prêts à être intégrés à la plateforme CAST. Il est essentiel que les ensembles de données créés puissent être maintenus et mis à jour. Une grande partie du travail consistera donc à mettre en place des pipelines automatisés de transformation/validation des données dans un cadre logiciel approprié tel que Node, Python, PHP, R, PostgreSQL, etc.

 Le maintien et l’expansion de notre base de données des administrations infranationales canadiennes et asiatiques, en collaboration avec nos spécialistes régionaux, constituent une autre tâche essentielle du poste.

 La date limite de dépôt des candidatures est le dimanche 7 août (à 23 h 59 HP). Les candidatures seront acceptées sur une base continue jusqu’à ce que le poste soit pourvu; nous vous encourageons à soumettre votre candidature dès que vous êtes prêt.

 Admissibilité

 Les candidats doivent :


 être autorisés à travailler au Canada et soit être étudiants ou avoir obtenu un doctorat ou une maîtrise au cours des 24 derniers mois avant la date limite de dépôt des candidatures, le dimanche 7 août 2022 (à 23 h 59 HP).
Et, dans le cadre du Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) et de notre politique de vaccination, tout personnel de la FAP Canada doit avoir reçu au moins deux doses d’un vaccin contre la COVID-19. Cette exigence en matière de vaccination est assujettie à l’obligation d’adaptation de la FAP Canada en vertu des lois en matière de droits de la personne.



 Compétences et expérience

 Les candidats doivent être en mesure de démontrer :


 une expérience dans l’utilisation d’ensembles de données complexes à l’aide de langages de programmation, d’outils de données et de méthodes modernes;
une capacité à écrire un code clair et concis et à partager des exemples, p. ex., à l’aide d’un profil GitHub ou analogue;
une approche minutieuse de la gestion des données.



 Autres compétences et expériences qui seront considérées comme des atouts :


 expérience de JavaScript et du développement Web;
connaissance et expérience de la région Asie-Pacifique, y compris des langues;
expérience de travail avec les SIG et les données géospatiales ouvertes ( ex., OpenStreetMap, Wikidata).



 Lieu et date de début

 Nous offrons un environnement de travail convivial et flexible depuis nos bureaux situés à Toronto et à Vancouver. Nous travaillons à la fois au bureau et à distance selon un horaire hybride, et le chercheur de cycle supérieur à temps plein sera idéalement disponible pour une collaboration régulière au bureau dans l’une ou l’autre ville. Toutefois, les candidatures solides provenant d’autres régions du Canada peuvent être prises en considération.
 La date de début est flexible, mais nous espérons pourvoir le poste rapidement, avec un accord de subvention d’une durée initiale d’un an. Il existe une possibilité de prolonger l’accord de subvention jusqu’au 31 mars 2024.

 Principales responsabilités


 Vérifier l’exactitude, la validité et l’exhaustivité des ensembles de données existants et effectuer les mises à jour nécessaires.
Collecter et formater de nouveaux ensembles de données en étroite collaboration avec des spécialistes du sujet ou de la région.
Automatiser les processus de mise à jour et de validation des données en consultation avec l’équipe de développement du CAST.
Travailler avec l’équipe de recherche de la FAP Canada pour déterminer les sujets et domaines potentiels pour les nouveaux ensembles de données.
Offrir du soutien aux projets de recherche en cours, au besoin.
Participer à d’autres tâches assignées au service de la FAP Canada.



 Durée du mandat et rémunération

 Cet accord de subvention d’un an offre une allocation de recherche de 3 300 à 4 000 $ par mois, en fonction des qualifications. L’allocation sera payée en versements réguliers tout au long de l’année et sera déclarée sur un T4A (c.-à-d. qu’elle ne fera pas l’objet d’une retenue d’impôt).
 Processus de candidature

 Les candidatures doivent inclure les documents suivants dans UN SEUL FICHIER PDF FUSIONNÉ. Les candidatures incomplètes ne seront pas prises en considération. Veuillez cliquer ici pour appliquer.


 Une lettre de présentation d’une page expliquant vos intérêts professionnels, en quoi vous répondez aux exigences du poste et les raisons pour lesquelles vous souhaitez travailler avec la FAP Canada.
Un curriculum vitae exposant en détail votre formation universitaire et vos compétences ou expériences professionnelles en rapport avec la description du poste.



 La date limite de dépôt des candidatures est le dimanche 7 août (à 23 h 59 HP). Les candidatures seront acceptées sur une base continue jusqu’à ce que le poste soit pourvu; nous vous encourageons à soumettre votre candidature dès que vous êtes prêt.

 Pour toute question, veuillez contacter le M. Nate Wessel, à nate.wessel@asiapacific.ca.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data AnalystPanoply Media is looking for a mid level digital marketer who would like to learn and grow their knowledge and experience in digital marketing, working within the Digital Media Team.Your eagerness to learn will allow you to grow within an environment led by a senior marketing team allowing you to quench your thirst for learning new skills within the ever growing digital marketing landscape (from Connected TV to audio down to Social Media, and much more).You are curious, passionate and attentive to details. You are solutions oriented and like to see the full story and enable others to follow along.
Our valuesWe believe in finding value by doing the hard work. We are all hands on when it comes time to activate, execute and analyse our campaigns.We think that there are great opportunities for ambitious brands who are willing to take a chance on emerging media. We don't rinse and repeat, we always push the envelope to find new opportunities to reach consumers where other brands are not active.We believe in the mid-funnel. The duality of Top-funnel branding and Low-funnel sales activation have plagued marketers since digital media arrived on the scene. We believe that new technologies now make it possible to transmit a brand message while also activating sales.What You'll DoThe Data Analyst plays a key role within our operations team in the day-to-day execution of our advertising campaigns. We expect the candidate to become the key technical resource for tracking & analytics, as well as build out the dashboards within the provided tools. This role will be an ever growing role and can grow into managing a team of data specialists, as we keep growing.Responsibilities

Work with the team in order to gather requirements of dashboards (client objectives, KPIs, and any special reporting needs)
Determine potential roadblocks and solutions for tracking and optimising towards our advertisers KPIs
Work within a various set of platforms to gather reporting and connecting APIs to dashboard
Visualisation of data in a clear precise manner
Develop partner relationships with different ad tech solutions
Create processes to ensure we are leveraging the platforms efficiently and cost effectively
Work closely with the VP and with Digital Media Director to establish a roadmap and determine the needs of the operations team
Developing and ensuring top quality dashboards for clients and management
Provide clean and clear data for post campaign analysis
Drive key reporting metrics for management
Remain up to date on new features and media innovations. Present these to the internal team on a regular basis

What You Bring

DEC or BAC in Marketing/Analytics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
Understanding of media metrics and dimensions
Data visualisation experience (Datorama, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Knowledge of ETL processes
Added assets if you know (SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset is a must.
Attention to detail
Ability to learn on your own and investigate when needed
Excellent written and oral communication skills (French and English)
Remain organised and consistently follow-up when needed
Intermediate to advanced skills with Excel or Google Sheets

What's in it for you?

Learn and grow within a team of digital marketers who have 15+ years of experience.
Work on million$+ advertising national digital campaigns
You will get access to the top leading industry platforms and training
Flexible work schedule
Hybrid model of working from home and office
Summer hours
Yearly offsite

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Ottawa Hub location)
Description:
Requisition ID: 152051  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team Oversees Finance Data Management & Data Services within Global Finance & Risk Technology (GFRT) provides analytics and support services for Global Finance Initiatives. The Finance Data Management Data Services team supports Financial Close Processes and provide Financial Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Governance services for Toronto/Canada. The team is heavily involved in business transformation projects and equivalency testing during migrations.

 The Role As a Data Engineer you are required to participate in multiple finance transformation projects, liaise with stakeholders on new business initiatives, delivering solutions to meet the needs of multiple lines of business, and interfaces extensively with business clients. The incumbent will have a minimum of 2 to 3 years of strong expertise querying data from ledgers, data models, database design and an understanding of the Bank's financial data. The individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive, and demonstrate initiative, coaching the data engineers and eagerness to learn.
 Some of the key accountabilities include:

Work with senior team members (architects, developers, testers) to develop and implement data solutions for finance reporting systems
Analyze data in both Financial Systems and Big Data environments
Support senior team members through research assignments and proof of concepts
Demonstrate a passion for problem solving and data presentation technologies
Facilitate UAT testing for system migration and new initiatives
Report development and support for internal customers; including executives analytical minded skillset
Provide analytical support to company leadership by providing ad-hoc analysis and data trouble shooting support
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviors; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and managing succession and development planning for the team.



 What You Will Bring to Succeed


Advanced level SQL design / reporting / data mining experience or familiar with using ACL
CPA/CA or Accounting/finance knowledge with computer science/data sciences certification is preferred.
Data Modeling experience with Agile methodology and familiar with scrum meetings and sprint planning.
Analytical and Detail-oriented
Report development and support for internal and external customers; including executives analytical minded skillset.




 The Workplace


We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation



 Scotiabank As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Data Analyst to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the major banks.

Analyzes performance of process activities, identifies problem areas, and presents findings in clear, concise charts, graphs, tables, or summaries

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
FNHA Overview





The First Nations Health Authority is a diverse and transformational health organization of professional, innovative and dedicated team members and leaders.
 The first of its kind in Canada, FNHA works as a health-and-wellness partner with BC First Nations to support self-determination and decision-making to improve health outcomes.
 JOIN OUR HISTORIC JOURNEY At FNHA, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to BC’s history. With a unique governing structure and mandate, our fluid work environment means you can play an active role in real change. Our talented teams value respect and foster lateral kindness in their working relationships. Our holistic approach to wellness, based on First Nations teachings, is incorporated into all aspects of work culture. Where else will you get to create a personal wellness plan as part of your performance goals?






 Position Summary





Senior Data Analyst provides specialized expertise in the research, design, implementation and delivery of strategic data analysis and economic evaluation. Designs and implements data collection and mapping initiatives, at community, regional and organizational levels.
 As a health and wellness organization, the First Nations Health Authority has aligned with the Provincial Public Health Order released on October 14, 2021. We have a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees at First Nations Health Authority. This policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If selected for employment, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination by providing a copy of your BC Vaccination Card Passport with the QR code.






 Responsibilities





Provides senior level of advice and recommendations in the strategic analytical environment of the Health System Matrix (HSM) and other related First Nations data sources by developing effective tools, ensuring consistency and validity in data and collaborating on the preparation of final summaries and reports for FNHA stakeholders.


Undertakes analysis of health status, health utilization and expenditure data, including the HSM, via trend and comparative analysis of expenditures and health service utilization, collating the findings into practical formats, then analyzing and preparing reports and power points that are suitable for community, Nation, regional and FNHA audiences.


Provides a leadership role in the development of data analysis capacity at community and regional levels, supporting community-driven, nation based approaches which inform regional operations and priorities.


Provides strategic support to Policy, Planning and Transformation by providing a data analysis and review, economic evaluation and financial costing lens, as requested, in environmental scans, policy analyses, strategies and frameworks, etc.


Builds data management capacity, including access to First Nations health status, health utilization and expenditure information, through design and development of tools such as the Health Services and Asset Map (HSAM) dashboards and Access interface, and proactively identify potential data sources for inclusion.


Identifies potential data sources for economic and financial projection analysis and provide recommendations on the appropriate methodologies/approaches.


 A Full Job Description is Available Upon Request






 Qualifications





Education

Master of Public Health or Epidemiology, plus 5 to 7 years of recent, relevant, and significant experiences in statistical analysis and knowledge transformation, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 Experience

Recent, relevant and significant experience in statistical analysis and knowledge transformation, usually defined as experience gained over 5 years
Recent, relevant and significant experience in health research and data analysis
Experience working with First Nations/Aboriginal Health 







Knowledge, Skills & Attributes





Knowledge

Knowledge of research and data analysis methodologies and techniques
Applied knowledge of statistical software through coursework or work experiences: Excel, Access, Tableau, R, QGIS and Microsoft SQL
Knowledge of First Nations health issues, OCAP ® and associated data governance practices and their link to health governance transformation in BC
Knowledge of population health and the First Nations perspective on health and wellness

 Competencies

Awareness - Thorough knowledge of the current First Nations health data landscape in BC and the critical role that data can play in accessing opportunities for BC First Nations health and wellness.
Leadership - Ability to influence, motivate and inspire others through direct and indirect means to accomplish organizational objectives in a manner consistent with the 7 Directives, Shared Values and Wellness Operating Principles.
Decision Making - Uses sound judgement to make good decisions based on information gathered and analyzed.
Problem Solving - Analyzes problems by gathering and organizing relevant information. Comes up with appropriate solutions with minimal supervision.
Analysis – Synthesizes, assesses and analyzes information and applies strategic and tactical thinking, including the ability to understand multiple perspectives, to develop analytical frameworks and to prepare reports and briefings. 







Closing Statement





Diversity
 The First Nations Health Authority is committed to respecting diversity within our workforce; preference will be given to individuals with Indigenous ancestry (First Nations, Inuit, Métis).
 What You Can Expect From Us
 Joining our family means joining an organization that supports personal growth, in-house training, a paid volunteer day and a unique full-day orientation program.
 Leading with culture, all FNHA employees complete San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training. We support our family to be leaders in wellness and all staff members develop a yearly wellness plan as part of their performance partnership and goal-setting.
 Closing
 Please note that only those applicants shortlisted will be contacted. If you do not hear from us about this position, please accept our sincere appreciation for your interest in FNHA!
 For more information about us, please visit: www.fnha.ca/about/work-with-us
 If you have any inquiries or issues please contact FNHA Recruitment at careers@fnha.ca or 1-844-699-3186.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About SickKids







Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
 When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
 Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.





 Position Description





The Opportunity:
 SickKids is leading a transformative enterprise-wide initiative to deliver leading edge, data driven, individualized medicine through AI in Medicine for Kids (AIM). This includes the development of high impact machine learning models and the build of machine learning operations (MLOps) that will enable the efficient and responsible deployment of AI. 
SickKids is seeking a data analyst that will develop cutting edge machine learning models to solve clinical, research, and operational challenges. In this role, you will partner with SickKids’ renowned experts to deliver on projects that will enable us to realize AIM’s mission of becoming a leader in personalizing paediatric care through applied artificial intelligence. 
Here’s What You’ll Get to Do:

Work with some of the best clinicians, data scientists, and software engineers in the world
Design ML models to help solve clinical problems and thereby improve the care of our patients
Work with a variety of hospital data including text, images, and physiological waveforms
Refactor aspects of existing projects to integrate them into the AIM pipeline
Test and validate ML models to ensure they are reliable and accurate
Support the build of the MLOps environment by articulating requirements, assessing the experience from a data science perspective 

Here’s What You’ll Need

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related field 
Background in Machine Learning / Data Science
Proficiency in Python and shell scripting 
Knowledge of containerized environments, such as Kubernetes, an asset
Previous work experience in Machine Learning/Data Scientist, an asset
Excellent project and time management skills and a strong attention to detail 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills along with strong interpersonal skills

 This will make you extra competitive:

Hands-on experience cleaning data and training models for clinical or biomedical data sets 
SQL and R 
Knowledge of medicine or biology 


 To apply, please visit our careers page by clicking the below link:

 For more information about The Hospital for Sick Children, please visit: www.sickkids.ca 
Employment Type
 Casual








 Our Commitment to Diversity





The children and families we care for are from a variety of communities, and so are our employees. We welcome and encourage everyone to join our organization and be part of our team.
 When requested, SickKids will provide access and inclusion supports to eligible candidates to support their full engagement during the interview and assessment process. Information received related to access or inclusion will be addressed confidentially. 
Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
 FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a health care institution, our highest priority is the safety of patients, families and staff. As a result, we are adopting all prevention measures to ensure the safety of our patients, families and our staff. Therefore, any offer of employment is conditional upon you submitting proof that you have been fully vaccinated with a Health Canada or World Health Organization (WHO) approved COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible and no later than fourteen (14) calendar days prior to the effective start date, in addition to satisfying any other condition(s) that may be set out in an offer. If a candidate fails to satisfy this condition (or any other condition(s) set out in an offer), any offer of employment shall be immediately rescinded.
 How to Apply
 Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.
 If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

Title: Senior Financial Planning and Data Analyst
Description:
Community:
  


     Iqaluit
   




    Reference number:
  


     14-507363
   




    Type of employment:
  


     Indeterminate
   




    Union Status:
  


     This position is included in the Nunavut Employees Union
   




    Salary:
  


     $95,882 to $108,810 per year, 37.5 hours/week
   




    Northern Allowance:
  


     $15,016 per year
   





     Subsidized staff housing available
   




    Closing Date:
  


     Friday, August 26, 2022 - 11:59pm
   





 This employment opportunity is open to all applicants.
The Government of Nunavut was selected as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People and recent graduates in 2021. With one of the fastest growing and youngest populations in Canada, Nunavut is a dynamic, vibrant territory, committed to becoming an even better place for future generations. As a government, we are strengthening our unique model of governance - one that integrates Inuit societal values, promotes use of the Inuktut language, achieves a representative public service, and collaborates with partners to achieve the promise of Nunavut. Successful applicants will enjoy a competitive salary, medical and dental benefits, a defined benefit pension plan, relocation privileges and opportunities for training and career advancement.
Reporting to the Manager, Budgets, the Senior Financial Planning and Data Analyst (Analyst) takes the lead role in the budgetary coordination for the Department of Community and Government Services Operations and Maintenance Appropriation in accordance with Government of Nunavut’s acts, policies, Department of Finance instructions and senior management direction. This position ensures systems and processes are in place to facilitate and coordinate budget planning development management and analysis of the department’s program budget including ensuring adequate information is available for appropriate resource allocation decision. The Analyst plays a key role in the preparation and consolidation of major budgetary exercises such as the business plan and the main estimates. This position will lead and coordinate data analysis, investigations, and assessment of financial information that enable senior management at various levels to make data driven financial decisions.
The Senior Financial Planning and Data Analyst is part of a team of financial and administrative specialist that provide financial, accounting and program support to various divisions. In addition, this position provides advise and direction to outside agencies, and regional staff regarding financial procedures and the interpretation and application of financial acts and policies to ensure full compliance. The incumbent facilitates access to information maintained in the Departments financial information systems to support division operations and monitor key indicators, ensuring the integrity of data/information released in the Department report and submissions. The Analyst is responsible for providing day to day supervision, leadership and support to subordinate staff, including staffing, assigning work and training. The duties of this position are carried out in accordance with the Financial Administration Act, Financial Administration Manual, Central Agency Guidance, departmental policies, directives and procedures and the General Accepted Accounting Principles.
The knowledge, skills, and abilities required for this job are usually obtained through a recognized degree in Commerce, major in accounting or related field, plus three (3) years of directly related experience. Supervisory and/or team lead experience is required. Experience with financial management information systems and experience with ERP financial modules (AP, AR, PO etc.) are also required. Actively pursuing and currently enrolled in the Canadian CPA designation program with advanced standing is an asset.
The Official Languages of Nunavut are Inuktut, English and French. Applicants may submit their resume in any of the official languages of Nunavut. Fluency in two or more of Nunavut’s official languages would be considered an asset. Knowledge of Inuit communities, culture, land, Inuit Qaujimajatuqangit, Inuktut and experience working in a northern cross-cultural environment are also considered assets.
Acceptable combinations of education and experience may be considered for this position. We encourage you to apply if you have equivalent years of education and/or experience equal to the education and experience requirements listed above.
An eligibility list may be created to fill future vacancies.
If you are interested in applying for this job, please email your cover letter and resume to gnhr@gov.nu.ca. Please include the REFERENCE # in the subject line of your email.

The Government of Nunavut is committed to creating a representative workforce, therefore priority will be given to Nunavut Inuit who self-identify as being enrolled under the Nunavut Agreement in accordance with the Priority Hiring Policy.
Government of Nunavut employees serving a probationary period must obtain and provide written authorization from the deputy head of their employing department. The authorization from the deputy head must accompany your application for your application to be considered.
Possession of a criminal record may not disqualify candidates from being considered. An assessment of the criminal record will be measured against the scope and duties of the position. This is only a requirement for positions that require a satisfactory criminal record or vulnerable sector check.
Applicants may submit their resume in any of the Official Languages of Nunavut.
Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
The onus is on candidates in receipt of foreign post-secondary education credentials to have their foreign credentials assessed through a recognized Canadian education institution. Failure to do so may result in the rejection of their application.






   Contact:
  




Department of Human Resources (Iqaluit)




Government of Nunavut P.O. Box 1000, Station 430 Iqaluit, Nunavut X0A 0H0 Phone: 867-975-6222 Toll Free: 1-888-668-9993 Fax: 867-975-6220 Email: gnhr@gov.nu.ca www.gov.nu.ca/public-jobs

Title: Senior Geospatial Data Analyst
Description:
Please visit our website for full job description and to submit your application https://jobs-emplois.ottawa.ca/OttawaPolice/search
Overall Purpose
Reporting to the Manager Business Performance, the Senior Geospatial (GIS) Analyst is responsible for providing subject matter expertise in location analytics to inform the organization’s data and analytics strategy, including:

Race and social identity through the establishment appropriate data standards for spatial and non-spatial data, proactively identifying analytical opportunities and providing recommendations that improve all elements of the data analysis process and increase analytical capacity throughout the organization.
Leverages advanced analytical techniques to conduct business analysis that identify meaningful insights, interpreting data and turning it into knowledge that informs tactical and strategic business decisions.
Provides analytical leadership managing a portfolio of projects, and providing supervision to Analysts, Researchers, and co-op students.
Improve the outcomes of enhancing public trust, duty of care internally and externally and to further evolve aspects of community safety and well-being (CSWB) by adopting and including community co-design / co-production.

Major Responsibilities
Inform the organization’s data and analytics strategy and standards:

Provide subject matter expert for location analytics, supporting the development of data collection, integration, and analysis strategies (including race and other social identity data).
Contribute to the development of data standards and guidelines for the collection, analysis, and visualization of spatial and non-spatial data.
Provides recommendations on the quality and limitations of data to advance organizational priorities.
Establish data-sharing agreements, memorandums of understanding, with data providers, community, and academic partners.
Facilitate meetings with internal and external clients to help define opportunities, provide expertise in spatial data collection methods, and make recommendations on solutions.

Apply a user-centered approach to develop analytical solutions, thematic maps, dashboards, web-based products employing best-practices:

Create, maintain, and enhance the OPS community safety / open data portal, including all associated public facing web-maps.
Leverages advanced analytical / geospatial techniques to conduct analysis and produce reports for internal and external clients, including analysis of societal inequity relating to social identity.
Collaborate with internal and external partners (incl. consultants) in the design, configuration, and delivery of GIS solutions.
Build data sets from various sources, transforming operational data into spatial data, to be incorporated into web-based/online applications.
Update and maintain geodatabase, create workflows, publish data and making data management decisions.

Provides analytical leadership managing a portfolio of projects, and providing supervision to Analysts, Researchers, and co-op students:

Maintains technical expertise through ongoing research of innovative practices and engaging with senior level networks and professional associations.
Proactively establishes partnerships, identifies opportunities, and make recommendations that increase analytical capacity throughout the organization and with our community.
Advocates for the consistency and quality of geospatial data analytic deliverables, and the enhancement of corporate strategic and business planning processes through geospatial analytics.
Manage a portfolio of projects; lead project committees and working groups from inception to implementation, and continuous improvement.
Establishes collaborative partnerships with stakeholders (Incl. the community, academia, municipality, and other levels of government).
Contributes as a subject matter expert on spatial data and analytics projects, represents the Unit / Police Service in this capacity on committees, task forces, working groups, meetings, as assigned.
Responds to routine and non-routine inquiries or requests for information from outside agencies and partners, municipalities, vendors and/or members of the public, escalating issues where appropriate.
Provides, supervision, guidance, and training to Analysts, researchers, and others in the organization on location analytics.
Research innovative practices, technology, and GIS information management trends, and makes recommendation for adoption.

Statement of Required Qualifications
Education

Completion of a four (4) year university degree in geography, geomatics, computer science, or a related program with emphasis in geographic information systems.
Experience and formal training combined may substitute for stipulated education requirements.

Experience

Minimum of five years (5) of experience working with geospatial data collection, interpretation, and analysis, including demonstrated experience as a technical leader and subject matter expert including:
Confident and experienced in gathering requirements and presenting solutions to management and business stakeholders
Experience working with ESRI enterprise technology (including Desktop, Online, Server, web apps, mobile apps, and creating sites with ArcGIS Open Data Hub)
Experience prototyping and requirements analysis and implementing enterprise-level systems.
Experience with ETL tools such as FME (Feature Manipulation Engine)
Integrating data from a variety of sources (SQL Server, Flat files, XML, GIS, APIs, Web Services)
Experience in creating, maintaining data models, and associated meta data.
Open data design and delivery experience.

Language

English – fluency in oral, reading, and writing.

Hours of Work
Monday to Friday day shift schedule
Effort and Working Conditions

Works independently and as a team, under the general direction of the Manager, Business Performance.
Subject to periods of prolonged sitting, visual and mental concentration.
Utilizes advanced analytical skills to research, plan and resolve technological problems associated with capturing data, using integrated computerized databases and police systems.
Organizes own assignments to ensure tasks are completed in a timely manner, while performing daily activities.

Desired Qualifications

Geographic Information Systems Professional (GISP) or similar designation.
Certification in project management (PMP).
Experience working in GIS or business intelligence in public safety / law enforcement.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $99,286.00-$116,922.00 per year
Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Day shift
Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:The Ottawa Police Service requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of vaccination as a condition of employment.
Application deadline: 2022-07-20

Title: Data Analyst 3
Description:
About Behavox:
 Behavox is shaping the future for how businesses harness their most important raw material - data. Our mission is bold: Organize enterprise data into actionable information that protects and promotes the business growth of multinational companies around the world.
 From managing enterprise risk and compliance to maximizing revenue and value, our data operating platform presents a widespread opportunity to build multilingual, AI/ML-based solutions that activate data for every function within a global enterprise.
 Our approach is unique, and it's validated by our customers who tell us to keep forging ahead because no one else is aggregating, analyzing, and acting on data to uncover opportunities or solve problems quite the way we are.
 We are looking for fearless innovators who have an insatiable appetite for building what no one has built before.
 About the Role
 The Data Analytics Team creates applications that leverage tools provided by the Behavox Platform to give clients insights into their data. Specifically, we work with subject matter experts to learn about topics like insider dealing, and then, using linguistic rules, NLP, and machine learning, create models to detect this illegal activity within our clients' data. Each application is a small product itself - with its context, objectives, approach, means.  This will be and exciting opportunity for a talented individual looking for:  1. Impact - you will see your contribution to Behavox product offering and consequently, on the business world. 2. Autonomy, ownership, and professional growth. 3. The opportunity to use cutting-edge technologies to solve practical problems on real data.
 What You'll Bring

Fresh NLP experience (text analysis, theory and approaches of applied linguistics, NLP tools, statistical concepts related to text data analysis)
First-hand experience in analyzing and adjusting ML models performance
Python development, preferably related to ML or NLP (sklearn, pandas, matplotlib / pyplot, tensorflow / pytorch, spacy, nltk), in research or production setting, including git flow, collaboration, tests. Java / Groovy experience would make you even more valuable, but is not mandatory.
Knowledge of statistics based on University level courses AND/OR applied within a working environment.
Experience in consistently working on the same product during different stages of its lifecycle.

What You'll Do

Build data-driven and ML-based compliance / conduct solutions in Python
Work on production applications
Refine internal tools and automations
Use statistics or NLP to get important insights
Explore varied datasets to suggest and POC data and model improvements

What We Offer

A truly global mission with a passionate community in locations all over the world
Huge impact and learning potential as our aspirations require bold innovation
Highly competitive compensation with 100% bonus pay already integrated
Benefits include fully covered health coverage for employee and family
Generous time-off policy and flexible work schedule

About Our Process
 We take Talent very seriously and we are building a community of extraordinary individuals working together in very high performing teams. We also know that the best Talent always has options so we believe that the process has to be a two way assessment - the company AND the candidate assessing the business needs alignment, the career next step alignment, and the cultural alignment.
 During the process we will begin by exploring the core factors regarding salary and location along with core experience and skills and values alignment. We will then deep dive explore the critical technical competencies we have identified for the role, and then we will deep dive in behavioural competencies.
 The most aligned candidate will then be asked to do a practical work task simulation activity so we can make sure that you will enjoy the kind of work the role requires, and this task will typically be presented and discussed with a group of colleagues and managers. Finally we will ask you to meet with a number of our senior leaders to make sure that you are making the most informed call possible.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Publicis is an omni-channel communications agency with over 600 employees across our Canadian operations. The office is the largest in our industry in Canada and boasts talent across various disciplines of marketing and advertising expertise. Publicis carries a balanced split of Canadian, U.S. and Global clients for which we are Agency of Record. Publicis supports a range of D&I actions through our Driving Change team as well as giving back to the community through a long-standing participation in the Out of the Cold Program. With a strong, active and familial culture, Pub United is the agency’s social club, hosting events as wide reaching as Curling, Trivia Nights and more.



 Job Description
  As part of the Publicis Data & Insights Team, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and providing insights that help monitor, optimize and deliver data driven recommendations to our clients on a regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and ad-hoc basis. This candidate must strive to ensure that the data used in the analytics process is accurate and robust. Candidates must also think strategically to identify issues that need to be optimized or resolved. The Senior Data Analyst will always work proactively to prioritize resources in order to deliver on the tasks.
 As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:

 Lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis
 Provide actionable insights through data
 Work with client and account teams to define KPIs and provide strategic support through the use of data
 Point out opportunities to advance data client maturity
 Create dashboards within Datastudio and Tableau Desktop
 Lead regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests)
 Lead efforts to optimize the client’s digital experience

 You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:

 Think strategically in everything you do
 Are intrinsically-driven and celebrate every success
 Enjoy a variety of work
 Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills
 Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right
 Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments
 Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment
 Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback
 Are able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processes
 Thrive in a collaborative work environment that has an “open door” policy since we literally have no doors in our office.
 Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams
 Are a self learner and believe in continuous learning and improvement




 Qualifications
 

 ~2 years experience in web analytics, ideally within an agency setting
 ~2 years experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
 Knowledge of user-testing technologies (Google Optimize, Adobe Target, Optimizely, or similar)
 1-2 years experience with Datastudio, Tableau, PowerBI, Qliksense or similar data visualization tools
 Experience with Google BigQuery
 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
 Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
 Basic Understanding of SQL
 A big plus if you know Python or R and/or Google Analytics 4
 He/she should be curious by nature: critically thinking about the business and marketing implications of data – how analytics can be used to inspire great creative, content and user experience
 Someone that is self-motivated, hard-working, excited by digital possibilities.
 Someone who can both present well, but also build beautiful presentations
 Can tackle anything thrown their way. You do not have “that’s not my job” in their
 Undergraduate Degree or Relevant Certification (Marketing, Business, Statistics, Analysis, or other related degrees considered an asset)


 Additional Information
  Publicis Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of our community. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. If you require a specific accommodation please contact Human Resources at 416-925-7733 or by email at inquiries@publicisna.com

Title: Technical Data Analyst, Enterprise Data & Analytics
Description:
Technical Data Analyst, Enterprise Data & Analytics - ( 220002IT )
Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity
We are looking for a technically minded data analyst who is passionate about enabling the business with better access to data and insights that will drive business performance as a member of the Enterprise Data & Analytics team within Business Experience (BX).
To accomplish this, you will work with our business stakeholders, analysts and analytics team to understand and enhance the key insights they need to drive our forward-looking strategy. You will drive the fulfillment of those by the design and development of the technical constructs that enable the creation and access to those insights.
This role will have exposure to the entire insight-to-action lifecycle, being primarily responsible for the design and development of the enabling data models and repositories from which insights will be generated.
Stantec offers a flexible work environment with hybrid work from home options and we are open for this role to be based out of any posted location.
Your Key Responsibilities

Translating insights required by the business into technical requirements for data movement and data modelling to support adhoc reporting and analysis .
Design and develop data movement and transformation solutions.
Analyze and evaluate data in applications and ERPs for:

+ Applicability to a given use case or insight
 + Appropriate methods and tools to extract
 + Data quality and usage considerations

Map and model data to optimize for reporting and analysis in re-usable, extensible solutions.
Integrating data across systems to enable adhoc reporting and analysis.
Research and understand market trends in data analytics, modelling, and data movement.
Formulate and estimate a plan with business and functional analysts to solution given a set of requirements.
Adhere to Stantec’s data security requirements, and appropriate documentation and change control processes.
Support end users in understanding how to best leverage solutions developed.
Support formal user acceptance testing activities such as test case creation, execution, and issue resolution.
Develop your craft as a data analyst as you work with our team and our business to understand their challenges and work with them to build effective, sustainable, and valued solutions.

Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials

Able to relate decision points in a business process to the insights and data necessary to guide the process.
Strong understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Capable of developing both prototype and enterprise-class solutions.
Strong organizational, time management, problem solving, and analytical skills.
Detail-oriented with high-degree of critical thinking.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Excellent team player demonstrated by being held accountable to other team members while also holding other team members to their tasks.

Education and Experience

3-5 years of hands-on professional development experience in design, development and implementation of data and analytic systems.
Demonstrated experience in designing and developing ETL/ELT processes.
Experience in test planning, preparation, and execution.
Understanding and experience working with agile development practices.
Excellent knowledge of standard concepts, best practices, and procedures within a data analytics environment.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize and present technical requirements of proposed solution.
Experience with finance, HR, and project related data would be an asset.
Experience using tools such as Oracle Data Visualizer or Power BI is desirable.
Experience with Kimball, Inmon or Data Vault methods of data modelling is desirable.
Experience with leveraging data from ERPs, particularly Oracle is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Jira, Gitlab or Confluence would be an asset.
