Title: HRIS and People Data Analyst
Description:
Purpose
 The HRIS and People Data Analyst reports into the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics.
 The incumbent in this role will work closely with the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics to understand all current HR business processes and provide recommendations that will contribute to creating more efficiencies using HRIS system.
 This position is responsible for the implementation, support, and maintenance of the organization’s human resources information systems (HRIS) and data and is responsible for providing technical advisory services, guidance, and recommendations to management regarding system requirements based on company resources and needs.
 As a change agent champion, the HRIS and People Data Analyst plays a key role in driving continuous improvement initiatives and adapts to the changing needs of the organization. In this evolving role, the incumbent will support the ongoing maintenance of the system by understanding UltiPro new releases and/or managing business requirements that impact key modules. Effectively ensure communication to users and stakeholders impacted by deployment of changes and enhancements.
 The HRIS Analyst believes in our Vision, is empowered and is a key contributor in bringing the People Analytics plan to life; and as a personal leader, creates clarity and gains commitment from the team for the shared Vision, Purpose, and Values.
 Key Areas of Accountability
 HR Systems – Implementation, Maintenance and Hyper care Support:

Acts as the subject matter expert for all human resource information systems and troubleshoots and works with third parties to resolve and adjust design of systems for effective use.
Provides support on leading technical initiatives and projects including, but not limited to, gathering requirements, planning, design, implementation, and training end users.
Provides end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitors reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identifies potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.
Recommends changes and improvements to existing processes and reports and gathers data as necessary. Identifies and makes recommendations for new or improving current systems and processes with considerations for improved efficiency, effectiveness, financial implication, quality, and scalability.
Supports configuration of business processes; ensuring appropriate security is applied within role limits.
Ensures accuracy and integrity of People data through regular review of the HRIS data, workflow, and practices in collaboration with the P&C team, IT, and system users.
Ensures employee information captured is compliant with any legislation related to employee data.
Motivated to take initiative to identify and anticipate department’s needs and make recommendations for implementation. Applies HR functional knowledge in optimizing HR information systems support.
Responsible for the review, testing and implementation of HR information system upgrades or patches.
Participates in development of HR objectives and systems, including metrics, queries, and standard reports for ongoing company requirement.
Designs, implements, and manages new and supplemental processes and tools for performance management and talent development programs.
Conducts User Acceptance testing for any updates and new features to the systems.
Develops and maintains training documentation on business processes & HR systems. Maintains issues and risks log, communicates status, and escalates concerns to the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics.

 Client Group Support and User Adoption:

Builds strong business stakeholder relationships across the organization and externally to collaborate, gather feedback and build system solutions that align with operational needs.
Offers continuous HRIS training to the P&C Team and to the organization, develops end user documentation, and provides support and training for all system changes and/or developments, when required.
Supports the improvement of the overall user adoption of the HRIS system for both team members and managers by developing content designed to improve user experience via trainings, tips, hands-on support, and other methods.
In collaboration with the Senior Talent Development Specialist, provides technical support and instruction to client group users of the LMS to navigate, build, and manage effective learning systems for online learning for employee teams.
Provides necessary system support to the Talent Acquisition, Total Rewards and Payroll teams.
Develops business communications, both written and verbal, to support change management initiatives in new HRIS functionality to improve client group experience and increase user adoption rates.

 Data and Analytics:

Applies knowledge of HR information systems and data in extracting and analyzing current, historical, and forecasted data to support strategic workforce planning.
Provides scheduled and ad hoc reporting and analysis to P&C team members and other external client groups. Performs complex data manipulation and aggregation of data from multiple data sources with high degree of accuracy.
Supports the development and maintenance of reporting practices to bring standardization and consistency to HR metrics and reporting requirement associated with People and Culture – dashboards, turnover, headcount, recruitment metrics, etc.
Maintains awareness of current trends in HR information systems with a focus on product and service development, delivery, and support, and applying key technologies. Works in partnership with Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics to socialize insights and trends for business stakeholders.
Partners with the People and Culture Business Partners to support the company and its client groups in the effort to attract, engage, and retain top talent by ensuring data and analytics support business decisions.

 Qualifications
 Education, Certification, Licenses

Undergraduate Degree with a focus on Information Management, Business Administration, Human Resources and/or supplemented with course work in analytics (is an asset)
CPHR designation; considered an asset
HR/People Analytics certification; considered an asset

 Experience

3 – 5 years’ related HR work experience and knowledge of HR policies, practices, and procedures
2 – 3 years’ experience using HRIS and Payroll software/s

 Skills

Advanced proficiency with systems and software including MS Office, HRIS (UKG, Workforce Now/ADP, Dayforce/Ceridian, etc.), Payroll, Adobe, and MS SharePoint
Strong aptitude and precision in working with data
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong business writing and presentation skills

 Attributes

Ability to work well under pressure with multiple projects and timelines
Ability to influence stakeholders at various levels
Warm, charismatic, energetic demeanor
Practices high discretion and excellent judgement, decision making, and diplomacy
Builds credibility, respect, and trust with co-workers and customers
A true partner with P&C colleagues and customers in the business
Effectively works with and advises people of all positions and levels within the company
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and maintains composure in stressful situations
Open and responsive to feedback and seeking growth

 Work Environment

Vancouver-based, hybrid role
Will be required to travel intermittently to other company locations for system implementation and/or training of team members. Travel will fluctuate depending on business requirements

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. Learn more at https://e.inc/

 Role Summary:
 E INC is seeking Principle/Lead Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to build and manage BI reporting. The role will be a senior member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team and will work with stakeholders from various sides of the business to understand data models, pull data and perform analyses to drive business decision making. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and other helpful information and at times, be prepared to present findings and discuss trends and insights. Review and improve data and analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency and accuracy. The candidate will also be an active contributor to the Data & Analytics team policy committee to establish and implement standards across the company.

 What You Will Do:

Solve data questions requiring advanced transforms, custom queries, statistical analysis, or other related tasks outside the realm of possibility for a self-service tool. 
Create ad hoc scripts to extract meaning from the underlying data and answer relevant business questions. 
Convey results that speak to the requester’s core business questions and provide key insights and relevant action items. 
Clearly communicate nuanced and complex analytical concepts, often translating meaning to impact on the business. 
Sustain a comprehensive knowledge of analytics tools (such as Power BI, SQL, JupyterLab, Tableau, statistical languages/packages, or other tools to easily analyze and visualize data) and apply knowledge to help build out more dynamic, automated, and easy to consume reporting for key stakeholders. 
Build reporting dashboards from start to finish, including identification of strategic key performance indicators (KPIs), queries to obtain the data, visualizations, and dashboard maintenance. 
Educate team members on data literacy to promote proper and relevant usage of dashboards and reporting while also maintaining a general understanding of team and project priorities. 
Collaborate with internal partners to identify and understand key data sources for analytics. 
Strong communication skills to translate reports into insights and be able to present to senior business leaders



 What You Will Need:

MBA or Master’s degree in field related to statistics, data analytics, programming, Information Systems, Data Science or Computer Science. 
10-12+ years of experience in the following: 
   
Advanced and experienced in SQL and SQL Server. 
Advanced and experienced in building complex dashboards for variety of audiences with advanced BI tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics or PowerBI. 
Strong knowledge and working experience of building Data Structures in Amazon Web Services (AWS) 
Experience utilizing databases and warehouses for analysis. 
Experience with infrastructure tools (e.g., Transactional Systems knowledge, data repositories, data catalogues) 
Experience with data management tools (e.g., integrations – structured/rectangular and non-structured data/excel, external, APIs) 
Programming background, specifically in statistical languages and packages such as Python. 
Experience with forecasting, statistical analysis, predictive algorithms, clustering, and segmentation.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and interfacing with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations). 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.



 E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:

Competitive pay
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k/RSP with Match
Company paid Group Life/AD&D insurance
Paid time off
Flexible working environment
Continuous Learning
And an amazing culture to top it all off!



 E INC is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is currently seeking a Data Analyst! Our client is located in Mississauga and is one of the largest organizations in the retail food industry. The Data Analyst will be working hand in hand with the HR team. Please see all details below. 

 Remote? No, Hybrid - in office 2 days/week 

Start date: Immediate 

Hours: Mon-Fri 9am - 5pm 

 Key Responsibilities & Skills 

 Ability to understand the Business ask and translate into Data deliverable 
Ability to analyse data 
Ability to create the Reports independently as per the Business ask 
Ability to explain the findings and provide insights based on the data 
Partner closely with the HR Ops and Analytics team to define key metrics, scorecards and measures, and dashboards to support talent programs 
Ensure the right data sets are in place to manage and monitor. Work with HR solutions team to operationalize. 
Provide analysis on the complete cycle of talent analytics and the interrelationships between different talent information and processes. 
Identify statistical analysis techniques required to deliver HR insights. 
Evaluate the effectiveness of talent investments and programs based on analysis. 
Partner closely with HR Solutions team to create sustainable reports to drive decision making. 


Requirements:
 Data visualization (Tableau knowledge preferred) 
SQL knowledge 
HR data or People Analytics experience preferred 
Data Analytics experience 
Presenting to stakeholders/clients 
Required to compile large data, data cleansing/purge data 
Must have experience with Excel (Advance level). Specifically pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas, sorting data, manipulating data and take this data to present it back to teammates in a manner that is easy to understand 
Logical Thinking and understanding 
Experience with any data visualization tools 
Experience analyzing large amounts of data and consulting clients. 
Experience formulating hypotheses, interpreting and communicating results. 
Undergraduate degree in Finance or commerce or Stats preferred 
5 years experience in an analyst role 
Knowledge of SAP HR, BW, Tableau/SAS and Success Factors 

 Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles. 

 Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, instant notifications for AI-matched jobs, and more. 

 Questions? Call your local office at 
1.888.490.4154. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Material Master Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 

 Focused on leading the transition to a sustainable future, Glen Dimplex Americas is enhancing the moments that matter in life with a commitment to delivering the best design and efficiency in the areas of temperature control and comfort creation. With operation throughout North America the success of the Glen Dimplex Americas organization is a testament to the strength of our people and investment in innovation and technology. 
Our portfolio of industry recognized brands includes Dimplex, Cadet and Faber. Together these brands provide complete product offerings in the residential and commercial comfort categories, ranging from electric heaters, to fireplaces and controls. 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is a division of the Glen Dimplex Group - the world's largest manufacturer of electrical heating, which holds significant global market positions in domestic appliances, heating, cooling, ventilation, and renewable energy solutions. Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland the Glen Dimplex Group privately owns over 40 brands with operations in 80 countries. 

 Our Values 
We Think Customer– we aim to put our customers at the center of everything we do, taking time to understand their needs; creating solutions that meet and exceed their expectations, enhancing everyday moments 
We Care About People– we recognize the power of a community with a common purpose; empathizing with others’ point of view and acting with integrity to create a safe and healthy environment 
We Value Innovation– we are building a better future day by day; developing innovations that will create quality, consumer-centric, sustainable solutions 
We Keep it Simple– we make the complex simple by driving out inefficiencies; which enables us to be agile, responsive and to get the job done 

 The Opportunity 
The Master Data Materials Analyst will govern and manage the Materials Master Data objects within SAP/MDG. The successful candidate will liaise with the Business to ensure business continuity across all Material objects, will validate requests and ensure updates are made accurately in accordance with the Company Business requirements. This role is critical to ensuring that Data quality standards are adhered to. 


In this role you will:


Develop an understanding of the business ticketing and workflow tool Fresh Service and it’s supporting process for requests to initiate new materials or changes to existing materials
Facilitate enrichment completion by all areas of the business
Escalate as needed within each area to ensure completion in a timely fashion
Manage SAP templates to support the request for creation of new materials to streamline and simplify the process
Play an active role in the governance of the Material Master data objects as they workflow through the change request process in SAP
Ensure that maintenance of all Material Master Data objects is carried out with a high level of accuracy in accordance with Data quality Standards
Adhere to and continually look to improve on the company's data quality standards by conducting reviews of data at regular intervals
Liaise with Business Stakeholders to communicate the processes and standards and resolve issues on Material setups
Review and validate Master Data Change Requests
Execute checks for duplicate records over all Master Data Change Requests
Proactively monitor data accuracy and facilitate required data corrective actions with business owners, such as Engineering, Product Management, Supply and Manufacturing in addition to other internal groups
Reject Change Requests with errors and justifying/supporting any remediation
Support reporting on MDM team activities, volumetrics and KPI's
Execute periodic reviews and clean-ups for assigned Materials Master Data objects
Support the Project Data Migration activities, as required
Support continuous improvement initiatives in Master Data Management
Execute mass updates of material master data as required
 What You Need 


Working knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system desirable
Detail oriented with a high level of accuracy of data entry
Strong Microsoft office skills, particularly Excel
Able to prioritize activities such as management of worklists and queues
Willing to take ownership for several assigned critical master data objects in SAP
Willingness to learn to develop business and system skills
Ability to interact with personnel at various levels
Ability to work in teams, influence across various levels of the organization, and manage conflicting departmental priorities
2 years’ experience in Master Data processing specific to Materials considered an asset
 What We Offer 
Core Total Rewards 


Fully funded Group Benefits (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, dependent life, AD&D, short term disability, & long term disability)
Group RRSP with 100% Employer Match up to 4%
Portable Benefits, Consult +, and Telus Pharmacy Group
3 Weeks Vacation Immediately
Employee Assistance Program
Workplace Wellness Program
Support of professional memberships/certifications
 Additional Rewards 


Educational Reimbursement Program
Smart casual dress atmosphere
Summer Fridays
Employee Service & Recognition Awards
Referral Bonus Program
A unique opportunity to be a key player in a growing global organization
An innovative fast-paced culture focused on people
 How to Apply 


Our team members include people like you: enthusiastic, innovative, motivated and creative. If you are interested in joining our team or learning more about this opportunity, please apply now. Glen Dimplex Americas offers a competitive total rewards package, and we are continually striving to attract and retain the best talent available, building ongoing success for both our organization and our employees! 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. 

 We thank all applicants for their interest in Glen Dimplex Americas, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Joseph Ribkoff designs classic and contemporary garments for fashion-forward women with a youthful state of mind. Each one of our carefully tailored pieces offers the effortless fashion, fit, and quality that we’ve been synonymous with. 

 Over the years, the brand has blossomed into a touchstone for timeless, youthful style. Driven by a passion that has never ceased to propel our company’s vision, Joseph Ribkoff has been an ally to women, dressing them with flair and perfect fit for over 65 years. From our quality and distinctly designed products to our unwavering commitment to retail partners, Joseph Ribkoff’s values resonate in everything we do and create. 

 Today, his legacy lives on through the work of a devoted, talented team operating from the four corners of the world. Sold in over 60 international markets, Joseph Ribkoff is a global emblem of quality and elegance. 

 Montreal Corporate Head Office, where most of their employees are based, offers career opportunities in Design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT and HR as well as in the Production and Warehousing facilities. 


Objective:
 Reporting to the Director of BI & Applications, the Master Data Analyst creates, update, and assure the data consistency in the ERP & PLM systems. Data accuracy is a key aspect of this role as well as to support the end user in all their requests. Engaging with business partners and participating in projects/initiatives, the Master data Analyst play a key role in establishing the procedures and governance to be followed when it come to master data management. 


Responsibilities:


Create and update master data in ERP systems & PLM such as, new style of garments, colors and fabric content, vendor accounts, employee accounts, specific customer accounts, pricing, etc.
Participate in day-to-day data cleansing activities.
Create, modify, and enhance new and on-going consistency test reports
Contribute to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within Master Data and Data Quality
Create, maintain, and communicate documentation around master data processes.
Responsible to support the end users by answering and analyzing all requests related to data received through a ticket system, in a timely manner.
Maintain good communication with business partners regarding master data requests and proactively pursue all information required for the timely completion of work assignments
Discuss with departments stakeholders to prioritize the work to do.

Qualification and Skills:


DEC in data management, business, or related field
3-4 years of experience in data management or pertinent related work experience
Strong MS Office knowledge (Excel, Word, Outlook)
Experience with Microsoft D365, an asset
Strong written and oral communication skills are required
Ability to build solid relationships with various departments
Strong analytical and systems thinking skills
Ability to think critically and find solutions
Detail oriented & organized
Bilingual, French & English
 Joseph Ribkoff is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Title: Sr Financial Analyst - Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Your Opportunity:
 Activity & Workload Consulting & Analytics is a service of Health Professions Strategy & Practice (HPSP). Activity and Workload information supports unit, program, and organizational decision-making, planning and benchmarking (Operational Best Practice), when used with other clinical, financial and statistical data. The Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for analyzing the information requirements of the patient care managers and designing and delivering complex management reports and analysis from a variety of databases, with emphasis on patient activity and workload data.
 Description: 
As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for reporting and interpreting complex financial and statistical information to support senior level management, operating portfolios and external reporting requirements. Your responsibilities include in-depth analysis; reporting related to financial statements and other cyclical activity; responding to audit requests; development, input, maintenance and monitoring of departmental budgets; policy, procedure and internal controls interpretation, development and enhancement; and coaching and mentoring to Financial Analysts and entry level staff members.


Classification: Sr Financial Analyst
 Union: AUPE GSS
 Unit and Program: Activity and Workload Consulting and Analytics, Health Professions Strategy & Practice
 Primary Location: IBM Building
 Multi-Site: Not Applicable
 FTE: 1.00
 Posting End Date: 21-JUL-2022
 Temporary Employee Class: Temp F/T Benefits
 Date Available: 01-AUG-2022
 Temporary End Date: 31-MAR-2024
 Hours per Shift: 7.75
 Length of Shift in weeks: 2
 Shifts per cycle: 10
 Shift Pattern: Days
 Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
 Minimum Salary: $41.00
 Maximum Salary: $49.60
 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable

 Required Qualifications: 
Completion of post-secondary diploma in Accounting or related field (e.g. Economics, Statistics).
 Additional Required Qualifications: 
Post-secondary diploma in computer systems or information technology, from a recognized technical institute. Proficiency in EPIC Clarity, Caboodle & Access Data models.
 Preferred Qualifications: 
Training in Tableau reports. Knowledge of acute care clinical data is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst, Revenue Assurance
Description:
Req Id: 383289

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 The Finance Team manages the performance and risk profile of Bell, ensuring the needs of customers, investors and employees are balanced with long-term business success. We work closely with internal and external stakeholders to develop and execute plans that help the company achieve its strategic objectives and ensure financial sustainability.
 The Revenue Assurance (“RA”) Team is part of Finance, and its mandate is to identify, recover and prevent revenue leakage across the Wireless Market. The Revenue Assurance team is focused on improving profitability by maximizing revenues and minimizing costs. The Service Revenue team focuses on service revenue reporting and forecasting. This role will be cross functional with both the RA and Service Revenue team; collaborating with a wide variety of stakeholders such as Product Management, Marketing, Finance, IT, Operations, Customer Care, etc…
 The objectives of the role are:

 Develop scripts and queries to extract data from our various systems and manipulate into a meaningful format
 Identify and assess potential revenue leakage opportunities and perform diagnostics/process mapping to determine project feasibility
 Act as a change agent to improve billing accuracy and participate in new service/feature introduction to mitigate revenue leakage
 Review business processes and workflows. Documenting these with the objective of pinpointing gaps.
 Extract Elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders, customers and end users.
 Collaborate with Project Sponsors to determine project scope, vision and improve operational processes.
 Conduct interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
 Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team 
Influence the development and implementation of business processes/infrastructure from Sales to Collection.
 Lead cross-functional resources on multiple, concurrent revenue recovery projects.


 Critical Qualifications/ Competencies:

 Expertise in SAS/SQL, Teradata, COGNOS and Microstrategy with the ability to create queries in each of these databases and experience handling large datasets (50M+ rows)
 Predictive modelling in R or other statistical packages
 Proven Project Management skills (3+ years experience)
 Established track record in the co-ordination of cross functional and virtual teams
 Strong capacity to analyze and design workflows
 Business analysis and analytics experience
 Strong documentation skills and attention to detail.
 Demonstrated ability to conduct effective research, analyze data and communicate results
 Strong communication/presentation skills
 Indepth knowledge of Order and Billing systems (SingleView, NM1, OneBill, UsageView)
 Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills
 Results oriented, curious and pro-active
 Strong sense of urgency and willingness to take initiative

 Educational level required: 

University degree in business, Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics or IT

 Years of experience required: 

3 years Project Management, Business Analyst, experience analyzing revenue and related drivers


 Specific experience: 

Knowledge of SAS/SQL
 PMP Certification or Business Analyst Certificate an asset
 Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite
 Previous experience working as a Business Analyst for software development projects
 Finance exposure

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  About MUFG Investor Services:
 MUFG Investor Services provides asset servicing solutions to the global investment management industry. Leveraging the financial and intellectual capital of MUFG – one of the largest banks in the world with $2.8 trillion in assets – we provide clients access to a range of leading solutions from fund administration, middle-office outsourcing, custody, foreign exchange, trustee services and depository to securities lending and other banking services.
 With a diverse and dynamic network of offices across the globe, MUFG Investor Services provides challenging and rewarding careers. We achieve this by offering continuous learning and development, collaborative team work environment, promotion of work-life integration, and exposure to a wide variety of work.
 Imagine your future at MUFG Investor Services where you can grow professionally, in a diverse and inclusive workplace that rewards your contribution.
 #LI-Hybrid



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Executive Director, Head of Data Engineering & Strategy, this is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-growing organization in Financial Services.  You Will

 Mine data from multiple sources and develop data processing pipelines
 Explore source databases and tables to develop source to target mapping that meets our data requirements
 Work with business analysts, data engineers and product owners to gain a deeper understanding of business processes and data requirements
 Define and manage meta-data standards, data mappings and the data dictionary
 Define data quality rules, validation checks and automated cleansing methods for data pipelines
 Use data analysis, aggregation, imputation and visualization techniques on large datasets to gain business insight.
 Implement and test business logic, transformations and calculations to support data pipelines
 Enrich datasets through feature engineering
 Develop data and statistical analysis to look for trends, patterns and outliers in historical data




 Qualifications
  You Have:

 3+ years of professional experience
 3+ years experience with Python
 2+ years experience working with data and statistical analysis techniques
 2+ years experience with data-related process controls, data-mapping, and ETL processes and tools
 2+ years experience working with relational databases (eg. Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL) and SQL
 Experience using AWS Data Lake formation a plus
 Experience in Accounting or financial services technical experience a plus

 Additional Information
  At MUFG Investor Services, we are exceptionally proud of our approach to Hybrid Working. It enables the flexibility to thrive from wherever our employees work and, stay connected to their team and our culture. When we make Hybrid Working plans, we get to know the individual and pride ourselves in underpinning all our decisions with fairness and consistency.
 MUFG Investor Services provides all of its employees with an extremely attractive compensation package. In addition to base salary, there is a group medical insurance scheme, group pension scheme, reimbursement of professional subscriptions, paid holidays and assistance towards gym memberships.
 We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those proceeding to the interview stage will be contacted. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only to provide an accessible candidate experience.
 MUFG is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, MRM
Description:
MRM creatively engineers total human experiences. Through purposeful, dynamic intersections between strategy, creative, technology and data sciences, MRM operates in a borderless, integrated way, to allow for greater collaboration and velocity— all to the service of helping businesses grow meaningful relationships with people. MRM has 35-plus offices across North America, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit www.mrm.com.


 About the Role:
 The Sr. Data Analyst role will be responsible for executing a wide variety of database focused analyses in support of a client that is looking for help to join disparate data sets and develop more automated reporting solutions. This role will support the Manager in understanding the client’s business and analytic needs, in terms of developing reporting that promotes decision making and insights that drive to recommended actions. This role will work alongside a global team of resources to automate data ingestion, data cleansing and data management. In this role, the senior analyst will have exposure to a wide variety of data analysis and Business Intelligence tools such as Azure Synapse, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Power BI and will be expected to apply these tools on a daily basis.


 Responsibilities: 

Plan, design, and have ongoing accountability for the creation of cutting-edge visualizations to meet our client’s needs
Assist in building state-of-the-art, multi-cloud capable products by: 
   
Automating build and deployment processes
Creating solutions that include custom-made, open source and 3rd party solutions for solving pertinent business problems

Serve a multitude of functions including but not limited to: investigation of new product features, identifying new opportunities (in technology or to advance our client’s goals), creating internal processes for removing obstacles within the team
Responsible for creating documentation and educational materials that capture best practices for utilizing product, data governance and data management
Be an integral player in verification of enterprise databases to allow for confirmation of data integrity and investigation of any discrepancies
Utilize SQL (preferably MDX) to create new data engineering processes, perform database management, and identify best practices
Develop creative solutions in visualization, data management and automation that help drive our business forward
Continuously look for improvements, monitor quality levels, and manage quality problems
Lead client conversations related to ongoing initiatives where you embody our team’s “we’ll figure it out” mindset


 Required Skills
  Education and Experience

At least 3+ years of experience in data and analytics
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills
Highly accountable self-starter with the ability to work well within a group, as well as independently
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology preferred
Knowledge and experience with SQL (preferably in SQL Server) and MDX (preferred, not required) coding languages
Experience with ETL and ETL tools (SQL Server Integration Services is preferred, but other tools such as Airflow would work)
Demonstrated experience using Power BI (preferably with DAX experience) – with a keen eye towards industry trends in data visualization
Knowledge and experience within Azure preferred (Databricks or Data Factory to access Data Lakes, SSAS, Synapse and Function)
Certifications in Power BI and other tools listed above is desired
Some working business understanding, to help reclassify business data into usable format
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Must be able to handle multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Must be proficient in MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint); advanced Excel skills a plus
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and evolve as business requirements change.

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Description:
Req id: 29917 
    







     Richmond Hill, ON, CA 
     Mississauga, ON, CA 
     Waterloo, ON, CA
     










OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

 As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
     



Life At Opentext:




      At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.
     



The Opportunity:




      OpenText is looking for a candidate with strong SAP master data background and data analysis skills to be part of a diverse team with a focus on projects relating to data governance, master data architecture and management.
     



      As the Senior Data Analyst, your role is to be the expert in master data structure, design, governance and use across the organization. You will be working on data migration projects that deal with legacy master data from our acquired companies (M&A) into OpenText systems, ensuring business requirements are met and business processes are aligned. The primary objects you would focus on include Vendor master and its multiple attributes, banking rules, P2P processes. You will need to understand the flow and impact of master data objects to downstream systems and other transactional objects. You should be able to work with cross functional business as well as IT teams and be able to share the data analysis across these teams.
     



What You Will Do :




Deep understanding the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data.
Understanding of data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems.
Understanding the Procure to Pay (P2P) is a must-have. 
Experience with a Vendor Management System such as Ariba
Knowledge of Orders to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) business streams is an asset.
Building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, including aligning opinions and approaches across disparate teams.
Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis.


Assisting with designing business processes to be aligned to the master data 
Creating or contributing to SOPs for the operational team.
Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and completeness.





What It Takes:




8+ years working with SAP or a similar ERP for maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management/governance experience and experience within Procure to Pay (P2P), or Orders to Cash (O2C),Record to Report (R2R) business streams.
Experience with data migrations and integrations
Advanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis.
Knowledge and experience with master data tools such as SAP MDG, Data Services, Information Steward; 
General understanding of project lifecycle & development 
Excellent collaboration skills
Ensure adherence to change control process
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or a combination of education and equivalent experience
7+ years of providing data solutions in a similar setting. 
10+ years IT experience
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

      Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Customer Master Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 

 Focused on leading the transition to a sustainable future, Glen Dimplex Americas is enhancing the moments that matter in life with a commitment to delivering the best design and efficiency in the areas of temperature control and comfort creation. With operation throughout North America the success of the Glen Dimplex Americas organization is a testament to the strength of our people and investment in innovation and technology. 
Our portfolio of industry recognized brands includes Dimplex, Cadet and Faber. Together these brands provide complete product offerings in the residential and commercial comfort categories, ranging from electric heaters, to fireplaces and controls. 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is a division of the Glen Dimplex Group - the world's largest manufacturer of electrical heating, which holds significant global market positions in domestic appliances, heating, cooling, ventilation, and renewable energy solutions. Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland the Glen Dimplex Group privately owns over 40 brands with operations in 80 countries. 

 Our Values 
We Think Customer – we aim to put our customers at the center of everything we do, taking time to understand their needs; creating solutions that meet and exceed their expectations, enhancing everyday moments 
We Care About People – we recognize the power of a community with a common purpose; empathizing with others’ point of view and acting with integrity to create a safe and healthy environment 
We Value Innovation – we are building a better future day by day; developing innovations that will create quality, consumer-centric, sustainable solutions 
We Keep it Simple – we make the complex simple by driving out inefficiencies; which enables us to be agile, responsive and to get the job done 

 The Opportunity 
Reporting to the Sales Enablement Manager, the Customer Master Data Analyst will govern and manage all Customer Master Data details including pricing that are required to be maintained in SAP. The successful candidate will liaise with the Commercial team and the overall organization to ensure business continuity across all Customer objects and in accordance with the Company Business requirements. The candidate will play a key role in adhering to the Data quality standards as developed by the organization. 


In this role you will:


Develop an understanding of the business ticketing and workflow tool Fresh Service and it’s supporting process for requests to initiate new customers or changes to existing customers
Ensure a deep understanding of all aspects of the customer master data including basic data, Customer information record, inclusion/exclusion lists, pricing, output conditions, etc.
Ensure adherence to defined Delegation of Authority for approvals for new customers and updates and identify requests that are not compliant with standard process and procedure
Identify required updates to Fresh Service request templates/forms used by requestors for submittal to streamline and simplify the process
Ensure that maintenance of all Customer Master Data objects is carried out with a high level of accuracy in accordance with Data quality Standards and company policy
Adhere to and continually look to improve on the company's data quality standards by conducting reviews of data at regular intervals
Liaise with Business Stakeholder to communicate the processes and standards and resolve issues on Customer data setups
Provide reporting on MDM activities, volumetrics and KPI's
Execute periodic reviews and clean-ups for Customer Master Data objects
Support continuous improvement initiatives in Master Data Management
Execute mass updates of customer master data as required
 What You Need 


Working knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system desirable
Detail oriented with a high level of accuracy of data entry
Strong Microsoft office skills, particularly Excel
Able to prioritize activities such as management of worklists and queues
Willing to take ownership for several assigned critical master data objects in SAP
Willingness to learn to develop business and system skills
Ability to interact with personnel at various levels
2 years experience in Master Data processing specific to Customers preferred
 What We Offer 
Core Total Rewards 


Fully funded Group Benefits (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, dependent life, AD&D, short term disability, & long term disability)
Group RRSP with 100% Employer Match up to 4%
Portable Benefits, Consult +, and Telus Pharmacy Group
3 Weeks Vacation Immediately
Employee Assistance Program
Workplace Wellness Program
Support of professional memberships/certifications
 Additional Rewards 


Educational Reimbursement Program
Smart casual dress atmosphere
Summer Fridays
Employee Service & Recognition Awards
Referral Bonus Program
A unique opportunity to be a key player in a growing global organization
An innovative fast-paced culture focused on people
 How to Apply 


Our team members include people like you: enthusiastic, innovative, motivated and creative. If you are interested in joining our team or learning more about this opportunity, please apply now. Glen Dimplex Americas offers a competitive total rewards package, and we are continually striving to attract and retain the best talent available, building ongoing success for both our organization and our employees! 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. 

 We thank all applicants for their interest in Glen Dimplex Americas, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Product Operations
Description:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale. 

 Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity. 

 How do we make work life better? 


By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users
 We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you! 


Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States. 

 About the opportunity 

 The Ceridian Product Operations team, situated between the Product Management and Product Readiness organizations within Ceridian is looking for a Qualitative Product Operations Analyst 

 The purpose of the role is to build out the best practices, methods, and tools, that foster an evidence-based product culture. 

 The ideal candidate is passionate about deeply understanding the user behaviors and challenges, sharing knowledge, and building tools that enable our product teams to accelerate and scale. 

 What you’ll get to do 

 Qualitative Insights 



you will lead initiatives focused on developing tools and practices to be utilized by our internal P&T teams to better understand our customers, their needs, and how they use our products. You’ll bring a background in user experience research and analytics, ideally from an enterprise SaaS software firm, and have experience with business intelligence dashboard creation focused on product analytics. Your work will be focused on 3 key areas.
 Culture through collaboration 



Partner with our Global Customer Office (GCO) and Data teams to create new avenues to aggregate qualitative data on product usage
Collaborate closely with UX Design research teams where appropriate to leverage and build upon Ceridian’s overall research knowledge base
Work with product management and business leaders to identify priorities and trade-offs between short and long-term research projects based on the product roadmap priorities
Contribute to the development of a qualitative, evidence-based thinking culture in our organization
Wherever possible, enable self-service tools and data access
 Discovery through research 



Design frameworks/approaches for product managers to prove/disprove hypotheses quickly
Training on and occasionally facilitating user feedback sessions that inform better product decision making
Design templated studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
 Unlocking insights via analytics 



Develop and optimize internal tools (BI Dashboards) to provide awareness & insights on product health
Regularly share insights, implications, and recommendations that both fuel ideation and evaluate output
 What’s in it for you 



Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
Amazing time away from work programs
Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events
 Skills and experience we value 



Degree in STEM or human behavior related field or has equivalent experience relevant to role
3-5 years of experience in a research role applied to products
Experience building business intelligence dashboards
Experience mentoring people and evangelizing a practice
Experience working with B2B2C enterprise solutions
Highly motivated, autonomous and resourceful
High level of comfort presenting to all levels of an organization up to C-Suite
Ability to compartmentalize and distill quality insights from large data sets
 Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. 

 We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Business Lead Analyst Payments is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.  Responsibilities:

 Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
 Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
 Consult with business clients to determine system functional and non- functional specifications/requirements and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
 Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards
 Provide in-depth and sophisticated data analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
 Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
 Coordinate with multiple key partners and orchestrate the functional flow across multiple areas like Payables, Receivables, Reporting, etc as part of New requirements gathering
 Participate in multiple scrum teams and play PO role to cascade information to various teams and defining user stories in tools like Jira
 Create user stories with proper dependencies in Jira by adding details like Acceptance Criteria, Detailed requirement for developer to understand, organize by create Jira dash boards and tracking user stories till the end of production deployment
 Work in Sprints agile model to execute user stories, validate the results and validate, attest the output of the story by the developer as part of sprint review sessions
 Participate in product backlog and sprint planning, backup Scrum Master when needed by running a scrum call

 Qualifications:

 Experience with Payments (ACH, SWIFT, ISOMX, Cheque etc.) and Liquidity domain highly preferred
 10-12 years of experience
 Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
 Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
 Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
 Ability to write queries in Oracle SQL, snippets in Python to understand the data and dependencies between multiple tables is preferred
 Agile experience as a PO and Certification in PO is preferred.
 Excellent communication skills and should be able to talk to key stake holders like Business development team, Operations team etc...
 Good understanding in functional and technical aspect of the projects.
 Very good analytical skills to understand dependencies and multiple system
 High level understanding of multiple domains like Corebanking, Reporting, Warehousing, AML etc. is a plus

 Education:

 Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
 Master's degree preferred

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual.  Responsibilities:

 Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flows.
 Coordinates and contribute to the objectives of data science initiatives and overall business through leveraging in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function.
 Assumes informal/formal leadership role through coaching and training of new recruits.
 Significantly influences decisions, work, and performance of all teams through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in the business.
 Conducts strategic data analysis, identifies insights and implications and make strategic recommendations, develops data displays that clearly communicate complex analysis.
 Mines and analyzes data from various banking platforms to drive optimization and improve data quality.
 Delivers analytics initiatives to address business problems with the ability to identify data required, assess time & effort required and establish a project plan.
 Consults with business clients to identify system functional specifications. Applies comprehensive understanding of how multiple areas collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business goals.
 Consults with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards; recommends solutions.
 Leads system change process from requirements through implementation; provides user and operational support of application to business users
 Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry standards.
 Impacts the business directly by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams.
 Considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment; identifies and communicates risks and impacts.
 Drives communication between business leaders and IT; exhibits sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

  Qualifications:

 5-8 years experience using tools for statistical modeling of large data sets
 Ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem solving techniques
 Demonstrates interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
 Payments & Liquidity experience is preferred

  Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
