Title: Accounting Data Analyst
Description:
Accounting Data Analyst 
GardaWorld, a company with an entrepreneurial culture and operating in an international context, is looking for a dynamic, results-oriented person ready to take on challenges in a constantly evolving environment for a Temporary Contract Accounting Data Analyst position. 
Under the supervision of the Regional Director, Cash Management Division, you will be an important contributor to the Cash Management team to support the Montreal team. 
Your responsibilities: 

Manage client inquiries and questions regarding account balances
 Coordinate and verify all branch inquiries regarding account balances
 Support the branches by respecting the deadlines
 Make any necessary adjustments to the accounting system
 Work closely with the operations and sales departments
 Generate reports
 Analyze, investigate and resolve discrepancies to create correction sheets for the posting team
 Maintain clear and structured documentation of daily reconciliations for all identified outstanding accounts
 Any other related tasks

 Your Profile  : 

Ability to adapt to a constantly and rapidly changing environment
 Good management of priorities and respect of deadlines
 Great attention to detail and good ability to manage stress
 Customer focus and good communication skills
 Autonomy, initiative, sense of responsibility
 Good ability to manage priorities and good analytical skills
 Good knowledge of the Office software suite
 Bilingualism 
2 to 5 years of relevant experience
 College diploma or professional diploma in accounting 

We offer : 

International company offering several long-term career opportunities
 Dynamic and stimulating work environment
 RRSP and insurance

 Interested? Apply online or send your resume to Fanny.blais@garda.com? TV20

Title: Assurance Experience Management, Data Analyst
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 As an Experience Management (EM) Analyst, you will support the Assurance EM team by creating reports and analysis around deployment, utilization, development and capacity management; ensuring accuracy of data in our deployment systems/enablers and support projects and initiatives as required.

 Your key responsibilities will include:

 Reporting:

 Act as a subject matter resource on EM tools/enablers
 Create routine reports using existing templates that show utilization performance, availability forecasts, and variances between actual and forecasted utilization
 Assist with ad-hoc analytics requests by pulling reports from EY systems and tools
 Create/maintain accurate client-serving records in EM systems (i.e., roster updates, new hire records, etc.)
 Partner with Talent, Workforce Planning, and Finance on headcount reconciliation

 Teaming:

 Understand system and reporting escalation points to resolve problems accordingly
 Demonstrate effective teaming with Canadian EM team by proactively/creatively responding to analytics requests
 Participate in ad-hoc projects as required (i.e., creation of dashboards, etc)
 Identify ways to improve EM processes and contribute to team initiatives
 Actively support Americas Experience Management and EY enablers including Retain; EY Advance; MERA; Mercury; SuccessFactors, etc.
 Work with peers across the Americas Assurance EM by contributing to EM priorities; task forces; and/or projects

 Knowledge, Skills and Experience requirements:

 Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
 Proficient in other Microsoft applications
 Understanding of Data Visualization tools, Power BI, Tableau
 Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail
 English language skills - very strong written and verbal communication
 French language skills a plus
 Proven client service focus, with an ability to resolve issues quickly, with a sense of urgency
 Strong problem-solving skills
 Flexible in adapting to constantly changing priorities
 Outstanding teamwork and interpersonal skills
 Confident at working independently and a self-starter
 Adept at handling multiple tasks, with strong organizational skills
 Experience in a professional services firm desirable

 Education

 Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience

 What we offer

 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 Diversity and Inclusion at EY
 Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety

 EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst


 Location: This position can be located in Winnipeg or Toronto.


 Application Deadline: July 30, 2022


 Our organization:

 Founded in 2017, Wellington-Altus Financial Inc. (Wellington-Altus) is the parent company to Wellington-Altus Private Counsel and Wellington-Altus Private Wealth —the top-rated* wealth advisory company in Canada and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies. With more than $20 billion in assets under administration and offices across the country, Wellington-Altus identifies with successful, entrepreneurial advisors and portfolio managers, and their high-net-worth clients.

Investment Executive 2021 Brokerage Report Card



 The opportunity:


 Reporting to the Vice-President, Data Architecture, the Senior Data Analyst will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, the incumbent will be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.

 Key responsibilities include:



Overseeing the development and use of data systems by identifying and developing efficient ways to organize data store, and analyze data, while also paying attention to security and confidentiality. 
Planning, managing, and leading the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical / functional specifications in alignment with standards and frameworks. 
Providing technical leadership and working in close partnership with business partners / technology / project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications. 
Developing, implementing, and maintaining complicated problems and building simple frameworks. 
Identifying trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets. 
Evaluating organizational methods and providing source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets. 
Creating best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization. 
Evaluating internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data. 
Working directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships. 
Capturing and converting business requirements into consumable artifacts & information to be used by the data engineer and quality analysis team to support project & support requests. 
   
Working closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers. 
Proactively analyzing data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity. 
Creating and maintaining rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources. 
Defining and implementing data acquisition and integration logic, selecting appropriate combination of methods and tools within defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution. 
Developing and maintaining databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and building scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets. 

Performing other duties as assigned.



 The ideal candidate will possess:



An undergraduate degree in computer science, economics, or statistics or equivalent combination of appropriate experience.
7 years' experience leading and managing a data analytical team.
7+ years' experience mining data as a data analyst. 
7+ years' demonstrating proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization. 
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations. 
5-7 years' data analyst experience in teams following Waterfall and/or Agile methodology. 
Experience working with data model designs. 
Experience executing end user testing in UAT.
Experience with Azure, AWS. Hadoop, Confluence, and Jira. 
A foundational understanding of SDLC and Agile delivery methodologies. 
Experience in business process and data mapping. 
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant. 
Experience working with external vendors. 
Excellent communication skills, including group facilitation and presentation skills. 
Strong SQL skills, data mining experience, working on a cloud platform, MS Office expertise. 
An ability to work with a data cloud team and to converse requirements/use cases to each member. 
An understanding of data modelling and design, with the ability to translate requirements to existing and/or new data models.  
An ability to validate and test on behalf of the end user any data deliverable to ensure requirements were met.
Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques is an asset. 
Experience working within the financial services industry; wealth management and/or Institutional services is an asset. 
Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL languages is an asset. 
Practical experience in statistical analysis using statistical packages including Excel, SAS, R in an asset. 
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment is an asset.



 Conditions of employment:



Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
A background check, satisfactory to the employer, may be required of the successful applicant prior to commencing employment.



 Wellington-Altus is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community and welcomes applications from women, racialized persons, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and genders. All qualified individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our organization are encouraged to apply.


 If you require accommodation for the recruitment process, please let us know at the point of application.


 To apply:


 Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations. You will be contacted if you are selected for an interview. More information about working at Wellington-Altus can be found on our website at www.wellington-altus.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Sr. Data Analyst, Technology – Data & Analytics
 The Data & Analytics organization is looking for a highly motivated individual with strong organizational and analytical skills for the position of Senior Data Analyst. This role will be responsible for working with data subject experts to research questions about data sources, connections to other sources, lineage and ownership for projects within the newly created Target State Migrations team.
 You will be a part of the Data & Analytics organization, whose strategic goal is to create a world-class Data & Analytics company by building, embedding, and maturing a data-driven culture across Thomson Reuters.
 About the Role
 In this opportunity as Sr. Data Analyst, you will:

 Perform data requirement capture and analysis as needed for the projects.
 Map the data journey from operational system sources through any transformations in transit to its delivery into enterprise repositories (Warehouse, Data Lake, Master Data, etc.)
 Deliver detailed analysis of multiple data sources and collaborate with Data Modelers and Data Engineers.
 Innovate with new approaches to metadata elicitation, documentation, and usability by business stakeholders
 Facilitate implementation of metadata tagging, lineage/provenance practices and data quality measurement.
 Effectively communicate and liaise with other data management teams embedded across the organization and data consumers in data science and business analytics teams.
 Analyze existing data pipelines and document them as required.

 About You
 You’re a fit for the role of Sr. Data Analyst if your background includes:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, Computer Science or related technical degree preferred.
 5+ years of relevant experience working with databases, data warehouses or Data and Analytics or technology operations.
 Knowledgeable about Data modelling 3NF & Dimensional, including conceptual, logical and physical.
 Proficient in SQL; experience in Analyzing data pipelines, including data models and data processing
 Hands-on experience with programming and scripting languages.
 Beginner Knowledge of AWS, Snowflake, Python, and broad understanding of technologies used to build and operate data and analytic systems.
 Excellent critical thinking, communication, presentation, documentation, troubleshooting and collaborative problem-solving skills.
 Ability to conduct business requirement gathering and analysis.


 What’s in it For You?
 You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

 COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
 Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
 Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
 Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
 Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
 Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



 Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

 We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

 We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

 Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

 More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: SAP Data Analyst - Manager
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 SAP Data Analyst – Manager
 The opportunity
 EY Consulting Services is a fast-moving, high-growth area with huge potential. We are currently seeking a Manager to join our SAP enterprise applications team.
 This team offers variety, challenge, responsibility, and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. To address the shifting landscape of our clients' needs, EY has established a national Center of Excellence focusing in the broad topics of Enterprise Intelligence, Risk Transformation, IT Risk, and Enabling Technologies. Enabling Technologies primarily focuses on the design and optimization of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) packages such as SAP solutions. Our team typically works with Fortune 1000 clients across a variety of industries, Manufacturing, Pharma, Energy/Utilities, Transportation, Telecommunications, Entertainment/Media, Oil/Gas, and Consumer Goods/Retail.  Your key responsibilities
 As a Consultant, you'll assist in developing applicable methodologies, tools, approaches, points of view, thought leadership, and accelerators to differentiate EY in the ERP consulting market. You will also participate in large-scale SAP solution implementation engagements in a client-facing capacity and be required to demonstrate functional and technical leadership by helping our clients to collaboratively solve their challenges.
 To qualify, candidates must possess:
 Soft-skills:

 Experience leading clients through new data concepts (Data Stewards, Data Governance, Mock Loads, Data Object Master, Data Owners, etc.)
 Should be a self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be comfortable interfacing with a client on a daily basis. This role requires daily interaction with the client at many levels including executives.
 Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating enterprise domain knowledge with technology skills.
 Effectively team with diverse skills and backgrounds and foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment.
 Consistently deliver quality client services, driving high-quality work products within the expected timeframes and on budget.
 Ability to challenge stakeholders against SAP industry best practices and propose creative solutions to address business requirements.
 Participated in large-scale SAP client engagements with prior consulting experience and a demonstrated history of driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the "C" level of Fortune 500 companies.
 Monitor progress manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Manage expectations of client service delivery. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business.
 A willingness to travel to meet client needs; depending on the project travel may be estimated at 25-75%.


 Hard-skills:

 5-7 years of SAP MDM experience, 3+ E2E implementations,
 Extensive data migration (ETLV) experience and expertise in S/4HANA data migration using SAP Data Services. Knowledge of various S/4 data loading methods (IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom programs)
 Good understanding of SAP data conversion lifecycle covering data readiness, data conversion design-build-test, mock loads, data validation, data cutover
 Experience of SAP data profiling and cleansing (de-duplication, match/merge, standardization, rationalization)
 Deep knowledge of key SAP objects (e.g MM, BP, Equipment, Functional Locations, BOMs) and working knowledge of a few SAP functional modules:
   
 Record to Report (FI, CO)
 Procure to Pay (MM, IM, EWM)
 Project Systems, Portfolio and Project Management
 Plant Maintenance, Quality Management
 Production Planning, IBP
 HR

 Experience delivering SAP data conversion solutions for Oil, Gas and/or Energy clients is a bonus.


 What we look for
 We’re interested in passionate leaders with a strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the IT Consulting space. If you have a strong passion for helping businesses achieve their IT strategy, this role is for you.
 What we offer  At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


 Diversity and Inclusion at EY  Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety  EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make your mark. Apply today.
 EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Data Analyst Internship: 
Provincial Smart Home Services is one of Canada's fastest-growing companies. We provide residential homeowners with the latest Smart Home and HVAC products as well as 24/7 protection on their new equipment.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to help process of analyzing, interpreting, and displaying data using different approaches and business intelligence tools is known as data analysis.
Responsibilities: 
· Interpret data, examine results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely and accurate reports.
· Develop dashboards, track metric progress and look into changes.
· Build key data sets to empower teams to perform their own analysis.
· Work with, and manage, third-party advertising vendors and make improvement recommendations where needed.
· Conduct secondary/contextual research to support analysis
· Manage various pipelines/automation
Work Experience and Skills
The Data Analyst has the following capabilities:

Self-starter and excellent problem-solving skills.


Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written


High level of attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-up is required


Ability to work effectively with various levels of staff, including senior management and executives

Additional Skills and Experience: 

Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel, customers, clients, and 3rd party partners.
Eager to work as part of a team, providing strategic solutions for the enterprise.
Committed to the success of the department and the company through open communication, sharing ideas and innovations.
Strong organizational and planning skills, with the ability to balance multiple ongoing projects.

3 MONTH INTERNSHIP
THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION!

8 hour shift

Title: Digital Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are
Vigorate is made up of a team of people. Each of us is driven by a passion to create digital experiences that will build strong one-to-one relationships. Smart. Curious. Engaged. Fun. Problem solvers.
Vigorate focusses on the concept of enabling our clients strategic marketing goals, leveraging the Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
We are one of the fastest growing marketing service providers in Canada because we work hard to establish and grow long-term relationships with our clients. Our collaborative, flexible business model ensures that we structure every relationship around our clients’ success.
We work directly with brand marketers and their agencies across all verticals, providing the strategic leadership and execution support that are required to maximize the power of the marketing cloud technologies today’s marketers are investing in.
The Opportunity
As a Digital Marketing Business Insights Analyst with Vigorate, you will be our thought leader for our data products and services, with a focus on Salesforce data products including Datorama, Marketing Cloud reporting and other visualization tools such as Tableau.
This Digital Marketing Business Insights Analyst role will have several areas of focus including, but not limited to:

Ongoing Reporting and Quarterly Business Review (QBR) processes
Proactive recommendations on reviewed customer data to drive the direction of ongoing digital programs
Data Organization and Visualization Subject Matter Expert

Overview of Position:
This is both a strategic and executional role that will be responsible for working with retail clients and internal staff to define, develop, and deploy services and Solutions centered around our data practice.
You will develop strategies and plans for developing reporting and QBR standards, data visualization processes and working with retail client brand teams to define appropriate digital audiences. In addition, you will maintain and enhance data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support answers to complex business questions regarding customer engagement and conversion. You will also be the primary contact for our clients to ensure audiences and messaging are being effectively delivered, and are being appropriately measured.
Key Activities:
Organizational Strategy & Practice Development – Data Products & Services

Develop best practices and playbooks for incorporating digital audiences into brand marketing plans, including creation relational database schema's


Provide subject matter expertise and on-going education to Vigorate retail clients and internal teams so that the enterprise can keep up with the pace of change in marketing

Data Products Strategy Development & CDP Management

Reporting customer movement across marketing segments over time


Validating digital data collection across properties and marketing channels
Support multiple brand teams with a mixture of common audience segments, and specific audiences for each brand's identity and core messaging
Working knowledge of data mining principles (predictive analytics, collecting data from multiple data sources)


Experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques to draw conclusions and proactively develop actionable recommendations for the business


Support Analytic Leads in planning digital campaigns and measurement frameworks around audience activation, and in assembling and analyzing results post-execution
Work closely with the Vigorate client Brand Analytic Leads to manage data usage, messaging, flow, and media investment

Analysis and Visualization

Query large client data sets to transform and report on various segments of the data
Review client data sets to develop new, or refine, existing segments
Identify attributes and create new segments by combining first party and second party data to create the primary record
Support development of multivariate testing capabilities, including test structures, deployment and analysis
Collaborate with business users and analyze user requirements


Create Tableau solutions and define required supporting architecture (e.g., data marts)
Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective solutions to clients

Skills and Experience: 

Hands-On Experience with Tableau
Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud considered a strong asset
3+ years of experience working with customer data using SQL (or another database query language)
2+ years of creating relational databases
Knowledge of marketing technology landscape (e.g., tag managers, performance dashboards)


Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail, and the ability to drive results-oriented decisions


Advanced Excel skills for data manipulation (e.g., conditional statements, VLOOKUP, macros, and pivot tables)
Strategic hands-on thinker and problem solver who is willing and able to roll up their sleeves and get into the data
Proven track record of delivering results that drove demonstrable business value
Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments
Well-developed communication, collaboration, interpersonal and leadership skills with an ability to build and maintain effective relationships

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80,000.00-$95,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care
Wellness program
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:We have a hybrid work from home policy
Experience:

Tableau: 2 years (preferred)
Email Marketing: 2 years (preferred)
Datorama: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The same philosophy of personal attention that distinguishes Yorkville Education Company as a leading provider of post-secondary education also makes us an exceptional place to work. We are a modern and progressive institution that prioritizes diversity, opens doors to those often overlooked and provides pathways to successful careers.
Yorkville Education LP launched in 2004 with a simple idea: to offer people in search of a purposeful path with the flexible, rigorous and career-focused degrees they need to succeed. With campuses in Ontario, British Columbia and New Brunswick, we equip our online and on-campus graduates from both Yorkville University and Toronto Film School with the professional knowledge, skills and designations that employers seek out. Every member of our team – from the President, right on down to the newest hire – shares a passion for learning, teaching and growing, both as individuals and as a collective. While our focus remains on providing our students with transformative, accessible and flexible higher education pathways, we also nurture an inclusive, supportive and genuinely kind work environment for our employees in three provinces.
If you want to help transform the Canadian post-secondary education landscape and shine a light on academic excellence, please join us.
Who we need: 
Our University is actively seeking an Data Analyst. We are looking for a highly motivated, smart, and technologically savvy individual that would like to work on the entire data analytics stack from designing and building data pipelines to providing stakeholders with action-oriented insights. The individual will be key contributor in enabling a data-driven company culture by ensuring the various teams at the Yorkville University have the data they need to make sound strategic decisions in a timely manner. They will use best practices to ensure data flows reliably from the source of data acquisition to consumption for analytics while documenting data definition & processes along the way. The individual will help with the rollout of the business intelligence tool organization-wide and will work with various stakeholders to ensure that they understand how to interpret the data.
If you want to take on a role where in an environment that makes a profound difference on the experience of students, we would love to talk to you.
What’s in it for you: 
We provide a transformative, accessible and flexible higher education environment, our team shares a passion for learning, teaching, and growing. We nurture an inclusive, supportive, and diverse work environment throughout our three campus locations.
- Health Benefits- Dental Coverage- Competitive Salary
What will you do: 
End-to-End Data Management
- Develop ingestion, transformation, and cleansing pipelines to prepare a variety of structured and unstructured data sources for data analytics- Assist with maintaining current data pipelines made up of multiple sources flowing to a centralized data warehouse- Monitor and improve data quality through the creation of new mechanisms to guarantee data accuracy and completeness- Design and implement dimensional and tabular data models for new data sources- Work to improve data definitions and data integrity across the organization- Partially or completely automate repeatable data preparation and integration tasks in order to minimize manual processes- Ensure data flows are well documented through UML diagrams and process explanations
Data Analysis & Visualization
- Create and update existing dashboards for stakeholders to monitor key business metrics- Collect, organize, analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy and present complex information in a simplified way to various audiences- Build reports to track test coverage, overall data quality of the project and effectiveness of test automation
What you bring: 
- University degree in computer science, business intelligence, information architecture, data analytics or another related field- 1-3 years of experience of relevant business intelligence/data analytics experience- Experience in Data Modelling, ETL Development, Data Workflows, and Data Warehousing- Hands-on experience with data visualization tools, creating dashboards to track key performance indicators using PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, etc.- Strong working knowledge of SQL (query authoring, window functions, subqueries, etc.)- Knowledge of data pipeline development tools (e.g., dbt, FiveTran, stitch, etc.)- Driven, passionate, creative, and thrives in a fast-paced environment- Outstanding writing and documentation skills- Knowledge of data modelling using fact and dimension tables- Excellent attention to detail, specifically related to data quality- Knowledge of programming languages in a data pipeline development context (e.g., Python)- Familiarity with certain cloud computing suites (AWS, Azure, GCP) considered an asset
What does the best of all worlds mean at Yorkville Education?
- An atmosphere that successfully blends an entrepreneurial culture with education. We value innovation and continuously look towards expanding our programming, working with the latest research, tools, and solutions. As a private school with government approval of our offerings, we have the opportunity to do more, stay current, and be future-forward.- The chance to accelerate your career and disrupt education by responding to the needs you see and purposefully challenging the status quo. Everything we do here is about delighting and engaging our employees - and ultimately our students- from mentorship to teaching, from creative outlets to analytical ones.- A place where all individuals feel welcomed in the academic and workplace environments and can bring their authentic selves to the educational and work spheres. We celebrate the full range of human diversity, and we acknowledge that equal access to opportunities and services may require the removal of barriers that equity-seeking communities experience in trying to obtain this access.- The opportunity to grow with access to free courses, certifications, and programs - right up to our Doctorate offerings.- An appreciation for the insights and skills you bring to work with a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits, including a wide breadth of wellness services, and a work-life balance.
Join us
We welcome and appreciate candidates with a range of backgrounds and experiences. If you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, express your interest now.
Diversity, equity and inclusion are a critical component of life at Yorkville Education Company and we are committed to making these values an integral part of our culture. We encourage applications from all qualified applicants, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC), people from the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Transsexual, Queer, Questioning, Two-Spirit, Intersex, Asexual + (LGBTQ2SIA+) community, and other equity-seeking groups.
Yorkville University is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act ('AODA'). If you require accommodation for disability, please notify Human Resources at 1-866- 467-0661 ext. 1236.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hire Standard is recruiting on behalf of our client for a full-time, in-office Data Analyst position located in Calgary, Alberta.
This is a fixed-term position beginning August 1, 2022 and ending February 5, 2023.
Position Summary: 

Delivers the right datasets to the right people by finding and integrating data from multiple sources with high quality consistent metric calculation in a repeatable way.
Supports BI Visualization and Function team stakeholders to enable data discovery, data-based process execution, leading and trailing metric development, visualizations such as dashboards, reports and related applications.

We are offering $30.00 - $35.00 per hour for this position.
Responsibilities: 

Develop and implement accurate, consistent and secure data sets supporting key metrics
Leverages strong knowledge of traditional data warehousing, data structures and tools
Organizes data into optimal data structures flexible to cross-functional and cross-process data needs
Develops and maintains a business driven data pipeline optimized to the business needs; able to identify and proactively transition pipelines to IT when appropriate
Leverages an understanding of data systems and business process into definition and delivery of innovative data integration solutions
Continuously improves data and business drive data processes supporting key metrics
Enjoys digging deep for the answer and won't give up until they have it – problem solving mentality
Supports functional and analytics users by simplifying multiple data sources queries, identifying optimal ways to prepare and navigate datasets, implementing data quality control and timely communication of data issues or gaps
Adaptive to changing tools, technologies and data environments
Responsible for delivering collaboratively built cross-functional insight
Provides leadership in a small team format to understand, design and deliver a maintainable data pipeline
Uses business acumen and functional stakeholder input to understand data needed for process enablement, to locate the needed data, and to translate to the right measures at the right granularity
Drives the common understanding of key performance indicators and metrics needed to make business critical decisions and drive business results
Facilitates definition of common cross functional and cross brand metrics and calculations bringing together inputs from senior level (N-5+) resources across Supply Chain Management, Commercial Marketing and Sales
Builds strong working relationships with Supply Chain Management and Commercial function leaders, and IT Data Stewards and Data Support Teams, Global data governance and Global Crop Science COE teams

Requirements: 

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field
4+ years of experience working with data
Direct experience in the Business Intelligence field
Experience leading small project teams
Collaborative team-focused delivery experience
Experience leveraging one or more tools in the Business Intelligence Data Integration space (e.g., Alteryx, Trifacta, Paxata, Informatica, Talend, Ascential)
Strong competency working with data in relational databases using SQL or equivalent
Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills in the data arena
High degree of business acumen in the area of relating data to business process drivers and performance management
Proven experience defining and delivering metrics in a data architecture to support reporting and analysis
Very strong communication skills with all levels of business leadership

Preferences: 

Ag Industry and/or supply chain knowledge strongly preferred

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those considered will be contacted.
By applying to this position you agree to receive email communication from Hire Standard.
To learn more about this job and other opportunities, please visit us online at hire-standard.com.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 6 months
Salary: $30.00-$35.00 per hour
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Numerator is a data and tech company bringing speed and scale to market research. Headquartered in Chicago, IL, Numerator has more than 2,000 employees worldwide. The company blends proprietary data with advanced technology to create unique insights for the market research industry that has been slow to change. The majority of Fortune 100 companies are Numerator clients.
 Here at Numerator, we've made all corporate roles have maximum flexibility between office and remote work, except for rare situations when the role requires coming into an office regularly. In those situations, the recruiter of that role will clarify at the beginning of the process if that is the case. In fully remote situations, the company will provide technical equipment necessary to be successful in the role. In addition to maximum flexibility of return-to-office, the company also provides generous PTO, Internally Quiet Focus Time, and other recharge efforts to give time back to employees.
 Job Description Numerator is looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our Data as a Service (DaaS) team. As part of our DaaS team, you will be a vital member ensuring on-going excellence in delivery of our data feed solutions. You will be responsible for the technical delivery of our data feeds product to a myriad of clients and strategic partnerships, as well as work on on-going improvements and extensions to this capability. This is an opportunity to collaborate with a cross-functional team in one of our fastest growing business areas.
 Responsibilities

Develop expertise in Numerator datasets with deep understanding of data schema and storage systems
Define queries for data feed deliveries via interpretation of data requirements and scoping documents
Maintenance of technical documentation as it relates to DaaS delivery processes
Assist in development and maintenance of Airflow dependent processes
First level support for operational triage and bug fixes in code
Implement extensions of pre-defined code and architecture
Regularly communicate progress and timing implications for directed tasks  

What you bring:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related fields
Intermediate to advanced experience with SQL
Experience with ETL tooling (particularly Airflow)
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and comfort with shifting environments
Strong database skills
Experience with version control systems (Git, etc.)
An eagerness to learn new things, and improve upon existing skills, abilities, and practices.

Nice to have's:

Prior experience with Snowflake Data Warehouse
Knowledge of engineering best practices and coding standards
Airflow - Experience building and monitoring DAGs, developing custom operators and using script templating solutions
Scripting experience with Python
CPG and/or retail industry knowledge

What we offer:

An inclusive and collaborative company culture
An opportunity to have an impact on our growing teams and organization
Ownership of platforms and environments with industry leading product
Market competitive total compensation package
Volunteer time off and charitable donation matching
Strong support for career growth, including mentorship programs, leadership training, access to conferences and employee resources groups
Great benefits package including health/vision/dental, unlimited PTO, 401k plus matching, and more! 

If this sounds like something you would like to be part of, we'd love for you to apply! Don't worry if you think that you don't meet all the qualifications here. The tools, technology and methodologies we use are constantly changing and we value talent and interest over specific experience.  While this position can be remote, Numerator is only able to hire in many, but not all, states and provinces. In certain cases, if you are not located in a specific area where Numerator is able to hire, you may not be eligible for employment.
 We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law

Publicis Groupe’s agencies are present in over 100 countries around the world.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
About Us



 Snapcommerce is a high-growth company that sits at the intersection of mobile commerce and fintech. Our flagship product, Snaptravel allows millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging. We are currently in the scale-up phase of the company with plans to grow from ~150 employees to ~300+ employees as fast as possible while maintaining the advantages and culture of being a startup.
  


 With a high-performing team of world-class leaders, Snapcommerce thrives on tackling intricate problems within AI, E-commerce, and Conversational Design to push the boundaries of the value we can add to our users’ lives!
  


 At Snapcommerce, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the company. Check out this article from our CEO, Hussein on Snapcommerce's Core Values to learn more!
  


 About the role:



 We are looking for a 
   Data Analyst to join our Data Team. As a Data Analyst at SnapCommerce, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and drive our business strategy and rapid growth. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach, you are well-versed in quantitative analysis and will use your know-how to help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets.
   




   This is an exciting opportunity to take ownership as you run deep-dive analyses, create regression models, build dashboards, generate reporting to drive business growth, and draw strategic insights from product and user data. 
  



Responsibilities: 


Consultative: You will work with various business units (product, ops, supply, finance) to help form their strategy using data
 Data-driven Culture: You will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & outcomes
 Analysis & Insights: You will support daily requests for data analysis and assist on a variety of projects where you will extract business insights and present findings to key stakeholders
 Visualizations: You will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, crafting automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams






 Experience and Qualifications


 Experienced in writing SQL (demonstrated knowledge)
 Experience with BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Periscope, etc.) and databases (dbt a strong asset)
 Prior experience working with Consumer Lending, E-commerce and/or Supply an asset
 Experience with statistical analysis (e.g. Python, R) is an asset
 Some experience in Finance or Business facing roles (Supply, Product)Able to communicate technical limitations and infrastructure and how it is impacted by business needs
 Exceptional critical thinker coupled with knowledge of how to effectively communicate elaborate concepts
 You're eager to work at a fast-growing startup and learn more about analytics
 Natural curiosity 






Perks & Benefits


 We are a Remote-first company, we offer flexible working hours with complete work-from-home freedom and a guilt-free unlimited vacation policy
 Enjoy rewards and travel discounts using SnapTravel
 Competitive salaries, equity options, full benefits from day one, wellness budgets, and paid development - we’ve got you covered!
 UberEats credits, meal budgets, special treats, and team lunches. When in the office, enjoy daily snack services and unlimited coffee, tea, and other drinks
 Guiding continued growth with Learning & Development, Diversity & Inclusion events, TED talk Tuesdays, and Lunch & Learn opportunities
 We welcome new additions with a generous EI top-up, parental leave, additional vacation, and a flexible return-to-work plan
 Game nights, Happy Hours, internal hackathons, team building games, workouts, and more






 We Believe in Equal Opportunity



 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Part Time Sports Data Analyst
Description:
Sports Data Analyst
Spin Services Canada is part of the Sporting Solutions International corporation which is a market leader in the sports gaming industry.
We are looking for candidates to join our part time pool of trading analysts to cover data from the following sports: NFL, NHL, NBA, MLB, NCAA, Various Soccer Leagues, and Tennis tournaments.
Duties include pricing data for sporting events, accurately recording in-play games and feed driven data, as well as researching stats for all major North American sports leagues and various Soccer and Tennis competitions.
This is a fantastic opportunity to join the growing Sports Betting Market industry and a unique employment opportunity for anyone who has a passion for Sports. From our location here in Canada we provide the data to both sides of the Sporting group company, fixed odds worldwide and Sports spreads for Europe.
Whilst there are no minimum qualifications as such, you must be good with math, excellent with computers and above all knowledgeable and passionate about sports. We cover a wide range of sports so the ideal candidates will have an interest in a couple of the sports listed although just having a huge passion for one of the listed sports is not a negative. Having an interest / knowledge in the Sports Betting Industry would be a bonus.
We are currently looking to increase our NCAA American Football offering for the current season starting end of August, so any candidates who have an interest in American Football please can you state this in any cover letter.
What is important to note is that it is critical to have a love and passion for sports, or this job will not be a great fit for either side.
You will be expected to demonstrate this knowledge and passion during the interview process, and it would be helpful to advise on what sort of sports you have a passion for in the initial application.
The position is based around the major sports leagues live schedules, so most shifts will be in the evening. A typical shift can be 4 pm - 11 pm or 5 pm - 9 pm. Shifts will end no later than midnight MT.
We are flexible around your studies, but we do expect a minimum of 2 shifts availability per week with the opportunity to work up to 5 days. Evening and Weekend availability is essential. Hours can vary and are dependent on the candidate's flexibility around the listed sports live schedules.
We are looking to recruit multiple candidates with a view to starting early August or with immediate effect for anyone who has a passion for American Football, including NFL. NCAA and CFL.
The ability and opportunity to work remotely will be discussed during the interview process, with office working / remote or a combination of a hybrid working all viable options after a successful initial probation period in the Office . Our office is in downtown Edmonton so you would need to be located locally.
Sporting GroupThis gives a brief description of what we do, both for sports spread sevices and wholesale services and it's worth looking into the about us sectionSporting SolutionsThis breaks down what we can offer to wholesale partners around the globeSporting IndexThis is where the company started and is still a strong component of what we do on a day-to-day basis. A useful section to look at is the What is Sports Spread training Centre
Job Type: Part-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market.
 We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.



 Job Description
  At Wish, our Data Science & Engineering team is composed of Data Scientists, Data Analysts & Data Engineers who focus on centralizing corporate data in order to gain insights, knowledge and scalability, that empower a proactive and rigorous analysis of key business indicators. Our mission is to derive wisdom from data via the application of Data Science.
 Wish has exciting opportunities for talented Data Scientists on our Buyer Side (Product) data science team. This is a unique opportunity to experiment with a 500 million strong consumer base that draws 100+ million MAU. Successful candidates will have extensive backgrounds in quantitative fields and significant experience with experiment design and execution at scale.
 What you'll be doing:

 Conduct insightful analysis using internal and external data (e.g. revenue, customer, merchant) to gain insights that will drive financial business decisions.
 Conceptualize and build centralized tools (including pipelines) that can extract data/insights for daily business management in an automated manner.
 Work effectively with cross-functional teams globally, assimilating requirements, driving results in the form of data insights and being liaison between engineers and business partners.
 Develop dashboards and visualizations for the business stakeholders and maintain the integrity of the reports.
 Investigate monetary impact on new programs and assist with ad-hoc requests.
 Process a large amount of data and do deep dives to understand certain trends/patterns, carry out correlation analysis to identify causes and relatedness.
 Design, development and evaluation of highly innovative models
 Troubleshoot, maintain and update legacy data pipelines across MongoDB, Tahoe and Redshift
 Investigate discrepancies across various data flows and reconcile the differences




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor's or Master’s degree in an analytical field or similar.
 3+ years of work experience in doing finance/business data analysis.
 Proficiency in SQL or other query languages, deep experience and strengths to develop complex queries.
 Development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, PHP, Perl, etc.).
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to transform data into business insights and actionable recommendations.
 Experience working with large data sets that are structured and partially structured.
 Working knowledge of data visualization tools (Superset, Tableau etc.).

 Here at Wish, you are joining a team and company at a time of growth and transformation. You will love being surrounded by people who are as passionate as you are about e-commerce, technology, and a data-driven culture. Even if you don't meet 100% of the above, we encourage you to still apply!
 Additional Information
  Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
 Individuals applying for positions at Wish, including California residents, can see our privacy policy here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst
 Location: Vancouver, BC or Remote


 About Us
 Exact Payments is a leading provider of high-performance payment services to bank partners, software platforms, and omnichannel merchants. Exact delivers a highly scaled payments platform integrated with leading processors in the US and Canada including Fiserv/First Data, Elavon, TSYS, Chase Canada, and Moneris.

 Founded in 1999, Exact is a proven player in the eCommerce payments market with deep expertise in building and supporting payment platforms for large banks, ISVs, and its own direct client portfolio. Our cloud-based technology is fully redundant and offers comprehensive integration options including Rest APIs, PCI-compliant hosted payment pages, and virtual terminal interfaces. The technology stack is built for scale delivering the highest level of performance and reliability at transaction volumes exceeding 1 billion annually.
 Exact is a private equity-backed company headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, and Vancouver, British Columbia.

 Your Role
 We are recruiting a Data Analyst to join our Product Support team. Reporting to our Vice President, Product Support, this person will be responsible for developing data analysis tools designed to identify issues across our infrastructure of high-volume transaction processing servers and applications. The Data Analyst will leverage Kibana and Elastic Stack to build a suite of log queries and data visualizations which will be used by our Support team to rapidly identify processing or integration issues and advise clients on resolution strategies.
 This position will be located in our Vancouver, British Columbia office.

 What You Will Be Doing

Develop expert technical knowledge of our payments infrastructure including gateway processing engines, application services, MySQL and Amazon Aurora databases, and Elastic Stack.
Design and build a suite of data analysis tools using Elastic Stack and Kibana
Build Product Support dashboards using Kibana and data visualizations using Telemetry TV
Take lead on database and transaction log query responsibilities for the Product Support team as well as other groups performing system research and resolution including: DevOps, QA, and Software Development.
Collaborate with Software Development on level 3 technical issues or client integration problems using log queries and transactional data to isolate the root cause
Train Product Support team on Query tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualization services
Participate in Product design sessions leveraging data insights to inform bug fixes, enhancements, and feature prioritizations
Collaborate with DevOps to leverage tooling and data set to inform infrastructure upgrades and enhancement strategies
Developing trusted relationships with technical counterparts across the team as well as with key customers



 About You



3+ years experience in a Data Analyst role for a technology company. SaaS software, Payments, or eCommerce experience is highly desirable.
Experience and working knowledge of Elastic Stack and/or Kibana
Prior experience supporting payment processing systems and/or eCommerce technologies is desirable
Excellent problem solving and communication skills



Development experience including: PHP, Ruby on Rails, .Net, Python, SOAP Web Services, Linux, Node.JS


Fast learner interested in developing strong command of leading-edge tools including Telemetry TV (data visualization)




Works well in a collaborative environment and loves learning from a group of highly technical peers



Exhibits a technical, logical thought process plus a strong commitment to learning and growing in the Financial Technologies (Fintech) field


Interested in growing and moving within a Company always looking for people to take on the next challenge


Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or relevant field preferred



 What We Offer
 We are a team of passionate professionals working together to ‘propel high-performance digital commerce for our clients and partners’. We value diversity, creativity, innovation, collaboration, integrity, and respect and are looking for people who share these same values to join our growing team. We offer a comprehensive benefits program for our Canadian employees including Extended Healthcare benefits and a Retirement Savings Plan with a company match.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DUTIES:
 The Centre for Teaching & Learning (CTL) is seeking a Data Analyst to develop digitized processes and analyze, interpret and visualize data from various sources for multiple projects. Reporting to the Associate Dean, the incumbent will support the quality assurance team by applying data analytic skills and software skills in Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep, MS Power Platform and other software (e.g. Office 365 Apps, OneDrive, Canva, etc.) and project management skills for various projects. Working closely with the quality assurance team and other stakeholders, the incumbent will support the development of digitized and visualized processes and projects, by providing analyst support.
 Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, program, test and deploy the digitization of various quality assurance and data driven processes using MS Power Platform.
Create dashboard visualizations and provide data analysis for various projects using Tableau.
Develop and maintain databases and products.
Design and develop surveys and reports summarizing and visualizing data.
Intersect with the online course outline application (WebCOT) and other data sources.
Collaborate with the quality assurance team to understand business requirements and ensure accuracy, effectiveness and longevity of data analysis, visualizations and storage.
Ensure that institutional policies and procedures are met with respect to data use and storage.
Produce spreadsheets, reports and Tableau visualizations to effectively address project needs.
Provide technical and analytical support to curriculum mapping and program teams during key timelines.
Prepare reports and presentations for the department and college.
Write relevant educational, training, and technical documents
Develop and maintain project work plans for each project identifying key dates, leads, timelines, and initiatives.

QUALIFICATIONS:


Minimum of an Honors Baccalaureate degree or postsecondary graduate certificate in Data Analytics or Information Technology (or related field) required.


Certified on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or the Power Platform.


Experience with Business Analysis and/or Project Management would be considered an asset.


Minimum of 3 years recent experience in the information technology sector, particularly within a data analyst environment.


Advanced skills with visualization software (Tableau), MS Power Platform, MS Teams, Adobe products and MS Office skills (Word, Excel) required.


Exceptional skills in communication, critical thinking and research.


Ability to work effectively with a team as well as work independently and proactively.


Exceptional interpersonal and consultation skills with a high level of adaptability in dealing effectively and positively with diverse team members.


Ability to produce high quality, detailed written documentation.


Excellent organizational, analytical and time management skills including the ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.



 Required Skills
  Hourly rate: $32.00
 Required Experience
  Part-time support opportunity: Regular part-time Hours: 24 hours per week Reporting To: Associate Dean
 Please apply below by submitting your cover letter and resume to the online portal. Applications will be accepted until July 27, 2022. Competition number SP22-23.
 We thank you for your interest in employment with Durham College however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst - Ads
Description:
6ix Inc. is a financial technology company on a mission to unlock social mobility globally by empowering anyone from anywhere, to invest in anything. Our flagship product - 6ix.com - combines the power of community and technology by making it easy for anyone to attend, host, and market virtual investment summits.
 Reports: Data Analyst - Ads will report to Daniel Barankin, CEO at 6ix.

 As a Data Analyst - Ads, you will be responsible for organizing and analyzing both the data collected from ads and data from 6ix.com
 Responsibilities


 Interpret data, examine results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely and accurate reports.
 Develop dashboards, track metric progress and look into changes.
 Build key data sets to empower teams to perform their own analysis.
 Work with, and manage, third-party advertising vendors and make improvement recommendations where needed.
 Conduct secondary/contextual research to support analysis
 Manage various pipelines/automation

 REQUIREMENTS


 You have 3+ years of data analytics experience
 Must have strong experience deploying ads and analyzing data from ad campaigns
 You have a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field required
 Strong understanding of APIs
 Strong experience with Excel, SQL, Google BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform, ThoughtSpot, Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads Manager, Google Tag Manager, Customer Data Platform
 Experience with website analytics tools and generating reports
 Exceptional communication skills
 Excellent understanding of data to drive impactful actions (familiarity with A/B and multivariate experiments)
 Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects with high-quality, timely execution

  Why 6ix? Compensation: Competitive salary + benefits + share options Leadership Development: Our goal is to hire for life; therefore, we will invest resources in unlocking your full potential so that you can rise without limits. Employee Equity Plan: Our goal is to align our interests; therefore, you can purchase shares in 6ix and profit from our shared success. Growth: Weekly 1-on-1 with management, 100% reimbursement for work-related books, and career growth opportunities. Performance Bonuses: We reward performance and celebrate your wins along with you in the form of team bonuses for achieving and exceeding goals. Five-Year Sabbatical: Our goal is to honour our people; therefore, after five years with 6ix, you get a four-week paid sabbatical, equivalent to a $5K bonus.

 Our mission spans seven continents (including Antarctica), 10 billion people (we give consideration to past and future generations), and is fundamentally a mission about leaving the world in a better state than how we found it.  Will you join us?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Execute internal consultation projects by understanding stakeholders' objectives and converting business requirements into data problems and providing suitable data solutions.


Implement advanced-level techniques and tools including statistical modeling and business intelligence tools to perform in- depth data analytics and reporting.


Design integrated ETL flows with query languages to streamline data extraction, transformation and loading process.


Supporting the design of databases and data warehouse by defining the relationship between different data sources to prepare data.


Visualize data with business intelligence tools to provide in-depth insights for management teams and support their decision making process.


Lead the team of data and business intelligence analysts by performing project management functions to ensure the quality and efficiency of delivery of data products.


Other duties may assigned.

Key Qualifications & Skills: 

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.


Strong technical expertise in SQL, query languages, and data integration.


Strong technical expertise in business intelligence tools, preferably Power BI.


Strong organizational skills and excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills, ability to work with minimal supervision.


Strong communication, collaboration, teamwork, and people skills.


Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits ( Extended health care, vision care etc.).


Training & Development Programs.


An opportunity to grow into a larger role.

工作内容:

通过了解公司目标,将业务需求转化为数据问题,并提供合适的数据解决方案,执行内部咨询项目。


实施高级技术和工具,包括统计建模和商业智能工具,以执行深入的数据分析和报告。


使用查询语言设计集成的ETL 流,以简化数据提取、转换和加载过程。


通过定义不同数据源之间的关系来准备数据,支持数据库和数据仓库的设计。


使用商业智能工具可视化数据,为管理团队提供深入的洞察力并支持他们的决策过程。


通过执行项目管理职能来领导数据和商业智能分析师团队,以确保数据产品交付的质量和效率。


其他分配的职责。

任职要求:

拥有相关领域的学士学位或同等学历或相关工作经验。


在 SQL、查询语言和数据集成方面拥有足够的知识背景。


优秀的商业智能工具技术专长,最好是 Power BI。


优秀的组织能力和对细节的掌握,有解决问题的能力,能够在最少的监督下工作。


良好的沟通、协作、团队合作和人际交往能力。


适应快节奏的工作环境,热爱团队工作。

公司福利:

充满市场竞争力的薪资&奖金。
